loans.name: Miguel Evaristo

texts.es:
Miguel, de 23 años de edad, es jornalero, estudio hasta sexto grado, no continuo sus estudios debido a la pobreza en que vivían, decidió aprender a trabajar para poder ayudarle a su familia en los gastos del hogar, está soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres.

Miguel, se dedica a la agricultura, a la ganadería y a la siembra de hortalizas en el invierno; y en el verano utiliza el sistema de riego, dicho trabajo lo desempeña desde hace 8 años, lo aprendió de sus padres, quienes siempre se han dedicado a este negocio.- Para trasladarse a su trabajo camina 3 kilómetros y su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. todos los días.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar 3 terneritas de repasto, las cuales venderá en un periodo determinado y así obtendrá mejores ingresos para ayudarles económicamente a sus padres y darles una mejor calidad de vida.

Miguel, sueña con poder construir una vivienda de ladrillo, para que cuando él se case, pueda darle mejores condiciones a su familia; además desea aumentar su hato ganadero.
texts.en:
Miguel is 23 years old, he is a day labourer and he studied up until 6th grade. He didn't continue his studies due to the poverty in which he and his family live. He decided to learn a job in order to be able to help his family with the household costs. He is single and has no children and he lives with his parents. 

Miguel works in agriculture, cattle farming and vegetable cultivation in the winter; in the summer he uses an irrigation system. He has been doing this work for 8 years and he learnt it from his parents, who have always done this kind of work. He walks 3 kilometres to work and he works from 7am to 4pm every day.  

The loan he is requesting is to buy 3 beef calves that he will sell after a set period of time and so obtain better revenues to help his parents financially and give them a better quality of life. 

Miguel's dream is to be able to build a house in brick so that when he marries he will be able to gve his family better living conditions; he also wants to expand his cattle herd.

loans.use: to buy three beef calves.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 60 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Lilia requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing materials and for the maintenance of her boat.

Lilia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials and for the maintenance of her boat

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Mercy works hard to support her family.

She has a junk shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Mercy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to resell.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to resell.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 49 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. Pacita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like chips, bread, canned goods, egg, coffee, etc.

Pacita has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Pacita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like chips, bread, canned goods, eggs, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en:
Nelsie is 24 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nelsie has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Nelsie has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Padaeteng

texts.fr: Padaeteng est une femme mariée âgée de 52 ans. Elle vit avec son mari et quatre de ses enfants dans le quartier d’Agoè. Padaeteng désire contribuer activement à l’épanouissement de sa famille en vendant de la boisson locale communément appelée Tchoukoutchou préparée à base du mil. Cette activité lui génère un gain favorable afin de venir en aider aux besoins de son foyer grâce au dernier crédit qu'elle demandé. Padaeteng s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché d’Agoè. Pour acheter les sacs de mil, Padaeteng sollicite ce nouveau crédit pour son financement.
texts.en: Padaeteng is a married woman, aged 52, who lives with her husband and four of her children in the Agoè district. Padaeteng would actively like to contribute to her family thriving by selling the local drink commonly called Tchoukoutchou, which is made from millet. This business generates a profit for her to help meet the needs at home, thanks to the last loan she requested. Padaeteng gets her supplies once a month at the Agoè market. To purchase sacks of millet, she is requesting this new loan as financing.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of millet

loans.name: Pouguinipo

texts.fr: Agé de 29 ans,  Pouguinipo est un jeune  homme très actif qui vit dans le quartier d’Agoè. Pouguinipo entreprend un commerce de prêt-à-porter où il sélectionne des vêtements de premier choix afin de les vendre à ses clients. Cette activité lui procure un bénéfice qui favorise sa survie. Pouguinipo s’approvisionne six fois par mois à Hédzranawoé pour disposer ses habits. Pour  équiper sa boutique et présenter de nouvelles tenues de meilleures qualités à ses clients, Pouguinipo demande ce crédit pour atteindre ses objectifs et réaliser une bonne rentabilité
texts.en:
Aged 29,  Pouguinipo is  a very active young man who lives in the Agoè district. Pouguinipo has a business selling ready-to-wear. He selects first quality clothing to sell to his customers. This business brings in a profit which he is able to live on. 

Pouguinipo stocks up six times a month in Hédzranawoé to acquire his inventory. To equip his shop and display new outfits of the best quality for his clients, Pouguinipo is requesting this loan in order to meet his objectives and achieve a good return.

loans.use: to buy 15 shirts and 20 dresses.

loans.name: Mathilde

texts.fr: . Agée de 49 ans, Mathilde est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle vit à Agoè pour exercer son activité de vente de céréales et de produits d’alimentations générales. Ce commerce lui permet de venir en aide aux besoins de sa famille et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire. Mathilde s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché de Wahala. Pour commander des sacs de maïs et des produits d’alimentations, Mathilde demande ce prêt pour acheter ses produits.
texts.en: Mathilde, aged 49, is a married woman and the mother of three children. She lives in Agoè to operate her business selling grains and grocery items. This business enables her to help meet the needs of her family at home and to make a good profit margin. Mathilde gets her supplies four times a month at the Wahala market. To order sacks of corn and grocery items, she is asking for this loan to purchase her goods.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of  rice, and 8 boxes of spaghetti

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: Gulchehra is a creative woman. She was born and grew up in the southern part of the country. She is an experienced and challenged woman. She is a sewer. Gulchehra sews traditional dresses for women. She creates new design of dresses and has many satisfied clients around. She wants to enlarge her turnover income and make her condition of living better. Gulchehra is planning to purchase a new sewing machine for more productivity of her work. She requested financial support from the Kiva project to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS CORAZONES VALIENTES DE MORRO SAN JUAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Purificacion se dedica al negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos,cafe,mandarinas y naranjas, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Brave Hearts of Morro San Juan" communal bank. The bank is located in the Santa Ana district in the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

Purificacion's business is growing fruit. She has a piece of land where she grows bananas, coffee, tangerines, and oranges. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman. She has already been doing this work for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her piece of farmland. She is asking for the loan in order to buy seeds and fruit.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy school supplies, uniforms and school shoes.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS CORAZONES VALIENTES DE MORRO SAN JUAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Dora  se dedica al negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos,cafe,mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Brave Hearts of Morro San Juan" communal bank. The bank is located in the Santa Ana district in the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

Dora's business is growing fruit. She has a piece of land where she grows bananas, coffee, tangerines, and oranges. She works from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She has already been doing this work for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her piece of farmland. She is asking for the loan in order to buy seeds and fruit.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima, 66, is married with five adult-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 23 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. 

Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already took loans previously to purchase additional stock, and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 39 years old and lives in Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with two school-age children. She has different kinds of orchids in her yard and sells them in the market when their flowers appear. She sells each orchid for 150 PHP. She has been doing this business for five years. 

She requested a loan to pay for labor and buy pesticides for the healthy growing of the flowers. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Marivic hopes to open a flower shop in the market.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy pesticides

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita has managed a food vending business in front of the school campus for almost 14 years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her net income from this business is usually spent on their daily expenses and school allowances for their children. She also sells grocery items in her store to generate additional income.

 Due to inadequate capital for her business, Emelita would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase food ingredients, cooking oil, corn starch, juices, sugar, and chicken meat to cook and sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients, cooking oil, corn starch, juice, sugar, and chicken meat to cook and sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.  Yolanda is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase boxes of fish to make dried fish for her dried-fish-making business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 48 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Edwina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, biscuits, etc., to sell.

Edwina has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, biscuits, etc. 

Edwina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, biscuits, etc., to sell

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 41 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Divina is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Divina has been in pig fattening for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Divina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en:
Susanita is 49 years old and married with one child.

Susanita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Susanita has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Susanita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marta Azusena

texts.es:
Marta, está acompañada, tiene 2 hijos de las edades entre 12 y 7 años de edad, su pareja trabaja en una comercial en las cercanías de su casa.

Marta, tiene 2 años de tener una pequeña tienda en su casa; ahora Marta, quiere invertir más en su tienda, es por eso que esta solicitando un crédito, para comprar granos básicos, jabón, papel higienico, entre otros productos, ya que esto le servirá para obtener mayores ingresos a su hogar.

A futuro desea tener una tienda más grande, además, sueña ver remodelada su pequeña casa.
texts.en:
Marta is partnered and has two children ages 12 and 7 years. Her partner works in a business near their home.

Marta has had a small store for two years. Now, she wants to invest more in her store. That's why she is requesting a loan to purchase basic grains, soap, and toilet paper, among other products, since this will help her increase her household income. 

In the future, she wants to have a bigger store and also remodel her small house.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, soap, and toilet paper, among other products.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, de 32 años de edad, está acompañado y es padre de 2 niños de 7 y 2 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado de educación básica, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Carlos, es empleado de una gasolinera, el desempeña la labor de vigilante desde hace 5 años, además de su trabajo también se dedica a la siembre de maíz y hortalizas.

Carlos, decidió solicitar un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas y prepara la tierra que proximamente sembrará.

A futuro sueña con darle un futuro prometedor a sus hijos y su pareja, una vida digna que les permita vivir en mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Carlos, 32 years old, lives with his partner and is the father of 2 children aged 2 and 7. He studied through the second grade of primary school. His partner takes care of the household.

Carlos is an employee at a gas station. He has worked as a guard for 5 years. In addition to his job, he also grows corn and vegetables.

Carlos decided to ask for a loan in order to buy agricultural supplies and to prepare the land that he will soon plant.

In the future, he dreams of giving his children and partner a promising future, a dignified life that will allow them to live in better economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Atsufe

texts.fr: Atsufe est une femme mariée de 46 qui vit à Vakpossito avec son mari et ses neuf enfants. Atsufe vend du sel pour gagner son revenu et favoriser une éducation adéquate à ses enfants. Grâce à ce commerce Atsufe arrive à faire une bonne épargne et tirer un bon profit de son activité.   Atsufe s’approvisionne deux fois par mois chez un grossiste du quartier. Afin de disposer d’un stock important et vendre plus sa marchandise dans les marchés, Atsufe demande ce prêt pour l’aider à atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en: Atsufe is a married woman, aged 46, who lives in Vakpossito with her husband and her nine children. She sells salt to earn her income and to benefit her children with an adequate education. Thanks to this commerce, Atsufe manages to save some money and to derive a good profit from her work. She gets her supplies twice a month from a district wholesaler. To have a significant inventory and to sell more at the markets, Atsufe is asking for this loan to help achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of salt

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée de 31 ans qui vit à Avédji avec ses quatre enfants. Yawa est une femme très dynamique et entreprenante qui vend des friperies pour enfant et adulte en parcourant les quartiers. Ce commerce lui permet d’avoir le revenu nécessaire pour répondre favorablement à ses besoins quotidiens. Yawa s’approvisionne  deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Yawa demande ce crédit pour acheter les habits afin de répondre aux attentes de ses clients et réaliser une rentabilité favorable.
texts.en: Yawa is a married woman, aged 31, who lives in Avédji with her four children. She is a very energetic and entrepreneurial woman who sells secondhand clothing for children and adults by criss-crossing the neighborhoods. This commerce enables her to have the revenues necessary to respond well to day-to-day needs. Yawa gets her supplies twice a month at the big market of Lomé. She is asking for this loan to purchase the clothing for responding to the expectations of her customer and to be profitable.

loans.use: to purchase 50 pieces of children's clothing

loans.name: Djézaou

texts.fr: Agée de 56 ans Djézaou vit à Vakpossito avec ses cinq enfants. Etant très entreprenante et active dans le développement,  Djézaou vend des bois de chauffe aux commerçants de bar et de restaurant. Ce commerce lui permet de bénéficier d’un revenu pour aider son mari à financer l’éducation de leurs enfants. Djézaou s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché de Lama. Pour recevoir une commande de bois, Djézaou demande ce crédit pour faciliter son achat et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Djézaou, aged 56, lives in Vakpossito with her five children. Being very entrepreneurial and active in development, she sells firewood to bar and restaurant merchants. This commerce enables her to benefit from revenues to help out her husband financing their children’s education. Djézaou gets her supplies twice a month at the big market of Lomé. To receive an order for wood, she is asking for this loan to facilitate her purchase and to make a good profit margin.

loans.use: to purchase a truck-load of firewood

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, actualmente esta acompañada y su pareja trabaja como ordenanza en un Centro Escolar, junto a su pareja tiene 3 hijos.

Silvia, tiene un cafetín en el mismo Centro Escolar que trabaja su pareja, ella vende golosinas, bebidas gaseosas, frutas, jugos, comida, entre otros.

Ella necesita el financiamiento para comprar más poroductos para vender, ademas, desea encementar el piso del local, para que tenga condiciones más higienicas.

Silvia, tiene muchos sueños a futuro, ampliar el cafetín es uno de ellos, además, desea construir otro cafetín en la escuela y por supuesto, darle una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Silvia, 36, stayed in school until seventh grade. She is now in a relationship and her partner works as an administrative assistant in an educational centre. She has 3 children with her partner. 

Silvia has a snack shop in the educational centre where her partner works. She sells candy, fizzy drinks, fruit, juice, lunch and other things.

She needs the loan to buy more products to sell. She also wants to cement the floor, so that conditions are more hygienic. 

Silvia has many dreams for the future. One of them is expanding the snack shop. She also wants to build another snack shop in the school and, of course, she wants to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell. She also wants to cement the floor of her snack stall, so that conditions are more hygienic

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase school supplies and school shoes and uniforms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicines, undergo medical exams, and pay for travel

loans.name: Clara Luz Lizzette

texts.es: Clara Luz de 40 años de edad se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de comida, su trabajo lo inicio vendiendo tortillas, y con el tiempo fue instalando su venta de comida, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella  es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y está solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita poder comprar mas materia prima como pollos, carnes, verduras, frutas, arroz, huevos y de mas productos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Clara Luz is 40 years old. For the past 10 years, she has worked selling food. She started her business selling tortillas, and gradually established her food stand. She has many clients, especially her neighbors. With her earnings, she covers some household expenses. She is a single mother who lives in her own house with her two children. She is asking for a loan from Integral, which will allow her to buy raw materials such as chickens, meats, vegetables, fruits, rice, eggs, and other wholesale products. She will then be able to continue with her sales, and to obtain greater earnings.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as chickens, meats, vegetables, fruits, rice, eggs and other wholesale products.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS CORAZONES VALIENTES DE MORRO SAN JUAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Rebeca  se dedica al negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva cacao y café, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su familia. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a member of the Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan community bank, which is located in the Santa Ana district in the province of La Convención and department of Cusco.

Rebeca works as a farmer.  She has land where she grows cacao and coffee.  She works from 6:00am until 7:00pm.  She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is able to help her family get ahead thanks to her work.  She is requesting this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

She is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Glenda Edith

texts.es: Glenda de 39 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella posee una tienda desde hace varios años ubicada en su lugar de residencia, vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, gracias a las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con su hijo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Glenda is 39 years old and a single mother.  She lives in a house she owns with her son.  For a few years, she has had a store located in her home where she sells a variety of products like snacks, sodas, basic grains, coffee, soup, eggs, gelatin, and sugar.  She has many customers thanks to her good prices.  Her sales have allowed her to help her son succeed.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise at wholesale prices since this is her only source of income and this will allow her to have better profits for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, sodas, basic grains, coffee, soup, eggs, gelatin, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en: Jackielyn, is aged 23, married to a medical representative and they're blessed with one child. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 1,000 daily. Her net income on this business is usually spent on their daily expenses. Due to a lack of capital to run her business she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 10,000. She will use the loan to purchase coffee, sugar, noodles, canned goods, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, sugar, noodles, canned goods, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria has a snack-vending business. Her business is doing well, and she doubles her time perfecting her own food snack recipe. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. 

The reason why she availed herself of another loan from PMPC was to buy more ingredients for the food snacks she makes and sells. Today, Gloria is able to repair her house and hopes to save enough for future opportunities.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for the food snacks she makes and sells

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en: Angeles is from Mahayag. He and his wife have rice land and earn a living doing farming activities. Recently, Angeles availed himself of a loan for seedbed preparation, and he hopes to yield more harvest. Angeles deeply wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: to prepare the rice seedbed

loans.name: Laureta

texts.en: Laureta is a businesswoman from Mahayag. She is 55 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Laureta is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Laureta continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been operating her business for 32 years and earns a monthly net income of 3,800 PHP. Evangeline is 55 years old, married, and has two children. She is from Ozamiz City, Philippines.

 Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid her previous loans from PMPC. 

Recently, Evangeline requested a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more inventory for her store to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store to increase her stock

loans.name: Milca

texts.en:
Milca is 57 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four adult children. 

Milca has earned a living from snack vending for more than 18 years. Milca earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of business.  At present, she is receiving monthly support from her son and daughters. 

Milca requested a loan to purchase a brand new personal computer. Milca has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Milca hopes to innovate and improve the taste and quality of her products.

loans.use: To purchase a brand new personal computer.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is 47 years old and married. She lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past ten years, Carmelita has been a farmer. She earns 60,000 PHP every harvest of her rice field and is a new member of PMPC. She is requesting a 14,900 PHP loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizers. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ester works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Ester is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

Ester has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps Fozia's husband for purchasing scissors for cutting hair, a water sprayer, seats, and a mirror.

loans.name: Fadila

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Fadila. Fadila lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour drive from Jakarta. She lives there with her husband and her children (one son and one daughter). She owns a small stall where she sells fuel and provides mobile payment services for her community (in the suburban area in Indonesia, it is easier to find a small stall that sells fuel than to find a big gas station). Fadila already joined Ruma since 2013. She knew Ruma from one of her friends who already became Ruma agent, and she decided to join Ruma because she wants to try another business opportunity.

As the business grows, Fadila is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Fadila improve her business and accordingly, her community, who needs access to such services.  As seen in the photo, Fadila is the one who is standing in her own small stall. She will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Sinet

texts.en:
Sinet is a 22-year-old single student who lives in the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in English literature in the first year at a university in the province. She is motherless and her father is a rice farmer. 

Sinet needs finances to cover the university fees from the first to the fourth year, therefore she has decided to apply for a loan. This loan will help her in earning a bachelor’s degree. After graduation, she wants to be an English teacher with a reasonable salary to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to cover the university fees.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a confident woman. She was born in 1989. She is living in a remote district. She is divorced and she has one daughter. She is a business woman and knows how to run a business successfully. She is a hair stylist, and she has had a business since 2011. 

Madina has a beauty salon in the center of a local market. She does haircuts, hair coloring, manicures, pedicures and other services. She has permanent clients. She wants to improve her beauty salon and attract new clients. 

Madina is asking for financial support to buy new hairnets, hairpieces, hairgrips, hair-dryers, hair-clips, hair brushes etc. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy new hairnets, hairpieces, hairgrips, hair-dryers, hair-clips, hair brushes etc

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 46 years old and lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with 7 school age children. 

Richard has cultivated the riceland of his ancestors for 5 years. He requested a loan to pay for post harvest operations and for seedbed preparation for the next cropping season. He has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Richard hopes that his children can finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operations and for seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 38 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gina has been in pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from meat vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe, de 73 años, es agricultor, no estudió ningún grado académico, debido a los bajos recursos económicos, está casado y su esposa posee un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad, en el que se dedica a la venta de verduras; han procreado tres hijos, de los cuales una vive con ellos, ya que es madre soltera y es Guadalupe, quien le ha ayuda economicamente.

Guadalupe, siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ya que sus padres no lo pusieron a estudiar, por esa razón le enseñaron a trabajar en el campo a cultivar maíz y pipían.- La tierra donde hace sus cultivos está a un kilómetros desde su casa.

El préstamo será utilizado para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, comprar cuatro sacos de abono, una bolsa de semilla y pagar la mano de obra.

Guadalupe, sueña con obtener buenas ganancias, para poder seguir trabajando en sus cultivos de maíz y pipían y de esa manera llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 73, is a farmer. He did not go to school due to scarce financial resources. He is married and his wife has a stand in the city's market, where she sells vegetables. They have three children. One lives with them, since she is a single mother and it is Guadalupe who has helped her financially.

Guadalupe has always been a farmer, since his parents never sent him to study. For this reason they taught him to work the land to grow corn and squash. The land where he grows his crops is a kilometer from his house.

The loan will be used to grow 7,000 square meters of corn, to buy four sacks of manure and one bag of seed, and to pay for labor.

Guadalupe dreams of obtaining good profits in order to be able to continue working on his corn and squash crops and in this way support his household.

loans.use: to grow 7,000 square meters of corn, to buy four sacks of manure and one bag of seed, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Hawaisah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Hawaisah. Hawaisah lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour drive from Jakarta. She lives there with her husband and her three children. She owns a small canteen where she sells meals and provides mobile payment services for her community. Hawaisah already joined Ruma since 2013 and this is the second time she is applying for a loan from Kiva. The previous loan helped her to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community and she thanks all of the lenders because of it.

With the support from Ruma staff, Hawaisah sees there are improvements in her business. Now, as the business grows, Hawaisah is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Hawaisah improve her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Hawaisah is the one who is sitting. She will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband purchase wooden boards and bamboo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps Ghafooran's son in purchasing a new moto rickshaw.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi vit à Sokpèkopé avec deux de ses enfants. Mariée, elle est âgée 35 ans et très active pour le développement de sa famille. Pour relever les défis de sa famille, Akouvi vend des ustensiles en plastique et en alluminium. Grâce  à son épargne Akouvi appuie son mari dans les charges quotidiennes mais n’arrive pas à réaliser ses besoins. Akouvi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé pour avoir les produits. Pour augmenter son bénéfice, Akouvi sollicite ce prêt pour commander son stock
texts.en:
Akouvi lives in Sokpèkopé with two of her children. She is married, aged 35, and very active in the development of her family. To cope with the challenges her family faces, Akouvi sells plastic and aluminum utensils. 

Thanks to her savings, Akouvi helps her husband with the daily expenses but does not manage to cover all her needs. She stocks up two times a month in the Grand Marche in Lomé so as to have her goods. To grow her profit, Akouvi is requesting this loan so she can order her stock.

loans.use: to buy three dozen aluminum cooking pots.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is 50 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer, selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from his shop. 

The needs of his family suddenly increased and Rasheeda 's husband does not have other sources of income to meet these needs. As a result, he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales. Rasheeda requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her husband will use to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for her husband's shop

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales de pollo de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias desde hace 20 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos preciso, gracias a sus ventas ella puede salir adelante con su familia, Lucia está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, pollos, verduras, tomates, entre otros ingredientes para seguir con la elaboración de los alimentos y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Lucia, age 50, lives in her own house with her life companion and her daughter.  She has been selling chicken tamales on foot throughout different communities for 20 years; she has many customers because of her good prices, and her sales have enabled her to move forward along with her family.

Lucia is requesting a loan for the purchase of corn, chicken, vegetables, and tomatoes, among other ingredients, in order to continue making the food, and thus have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase corn, chicken, vegetables, and tomatoes, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Felomina is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Felomina has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Felomina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her weaving business.

Felomina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Felomina would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 32 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by running a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Geraldine is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Geraldine has been in the pig fattening business for eight years and also earns income from basket weaving.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 58 years old and married.

Josefina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Josefina has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Josefina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Salome

texts.en:
Ma. Salome is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Salome is 47 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Ma. Salome has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. Ma. Salome requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods like belts, mirrors, etc. to sell.

Ma. Salome has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Ma. Salome would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods like belts, mirrors, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 22-year-old married woman, with two children. 

Rebecca is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF, to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rebecca has been in the pig fattening business for 3 years, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lane

texts.en:
Lane works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a business selling coconut shells in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years.

Lane has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to purchase more sacks of coconut shells to sell.

Lane would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of coconut shells to sell

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 25 years old and has four children. Aiza is married and  three of her children are currently in school.

Aiza is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Aiza requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aiza has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aiza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Arlita

texts.en:
Arlita is 46 years old and married, with seven children who are in school, Arlita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Arlita has been in this business for three years.

In the future Arlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 48 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Nilda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed, and vitamins for her pigs.

Nilda has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, and lotion.

loans.name: Belita

texts.en:
Belita works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Belita has been in this business for 5 years.

She has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Belita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: As a married parent of five children, Rebecca works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Rebecca is borrowing 19,500 PHP through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), to buy additional fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business. Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a 33-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elvie runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF, to purchase more stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. Elvie has been in this business for 14 years.

In the future, Elvie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Yoro Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Yoro a commencé à prendre le crédit en 2008 à ACFIME. Formé de femmes dynamiques, ce groupe a pour responsable Korotimi qui est le membre représentatif. Korotimi est veuve et a un enfant qui continue l'école. Cette brave dame fait des gâteaux qu'elle vend pour prendre soin d'elle même et surtout pour préparer l'avenir de son enfants. Avec ce crédit, elle voudrait acheter 2 sacs de farine de blé, 1 bidon d'huile, du sucre et les autres ingrédients nécessaire pour faire des gâteaux pour vendre. A l'issue de ses ventes les bénéfices lui permettront de gérer sa vie au quotidien.
texts.en:
The Yoro group became a partner of the ACFIME microfinance institution in 2008. It consists of dynamic women whose representative is Korotimi, a widowed mother of one child still in school. This brave lady makes cakes that she sells to support herself but mainly to provide her child’s future.  

She will use this loan to buy two sacks of wheat flour, one jug of oil, some sugar and other ingredients needed to prepare her cakes. 

Profits from her sales will help her to manage her day-to-day lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of wheat flour, one jug of oil, some sugar and other ingredients needed to prepare her cakes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving blankets for her husband's blanket business

loans.name: Mahina

texts.en: Mahina is 22 years old. She lives with her brother and his wife. She is not married. Her mother emigrated to Russia, and her father has died. Mahina is trying to earn money for herself and her family by sewing dresses. She has been engaged in this activity for three years. Now she wants to expand her business, and she needs the necessary sewing supplies such as fabrics, thread, nylon, buttons and fasteners. Mahina believes that with help from Kiva lenders, she will be able to improve her business, and from the profit she can renovate her house.  Mahina thanks you in advance for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy  fabrics, thread, nylon, buttons and fasteners.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma lives in a local community of Gamu. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children. 

She is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP, to purchase glutinous flour, vegetables, and the needed products for her business. 

Gemma will use her generated income for the allowance of her children, for their business, and for their daily needs. She wants to have a comfortable life for their family.

loans.use: to a purchase stock of glutinous flour, sugar, and some varieties of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Reina Luz

texts.es: Reina de 37 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc. que vende de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza ha logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar. Reina es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maíz para los tamales, plátanos y todos los ingredientes necesarios y así poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en:
Reina, age 37, makes and sells antojitos [traditional snacks] such as fried potatoes, fried yucca, empanadas, tamales, etc. She sells them on foot near her place of residence, and thanks to her sales she has been able to cover her household expenses.  Reina is a single mother who lives in her own house with her two children.  

She is requesting a loan from Integral for the purchase of products that she uses to make her antojitos such as oil, potatoes, corn for the tamales, plantains, and all the necessary ingredients.  In this way she can continue providing for her household and covering expenses that may arise.

loans.use: to purchase oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains, and all the necessary ingredients.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Olivia is thankful that she was previously granted a 19,000 PHP loan that she used for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal household expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan to buy tires and to pay for the maintenance of the tricycle unit. It is important that her tricycle is always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service and the safety of her passengers. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help for her business, as it will surely fund their everyday needs and the schooling of her children. 

Olivia dreams of owning several tricycle units to improve her income and give her family a better life. She aims to send her children to good schools. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Ruth works hard to support her family. She sells Avon products in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending.  Ruth is borrowing 19,000 PHP through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase more products from Avon to sell to her customers. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Avon to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 45-year-old married woman, with seven children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jessica runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP through NWTF, to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, noodles, spices, canned goods, etc. She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Jessica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, noodles, spices, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS CORAZONES VALIENTES DE MORRO SAN JUAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Edith se dedica al negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva cacao y café, la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como patos y cuyes,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This is Edith, a member of the communal bank, “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan”.  It is located in the Santa Ana District, which belongs to the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

Edith’s business is farming; she has land where she cultivates cacao and coffee, and she also has a business raising animals such as ducks and guinea pigs. She has been in this business for several years now, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her farmland.  She is requesting the loan in order to purchase seed and fertilizer.

She is happy about the loan, and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Umri

texts.en:
Umri was born in 1966. She is married, and has four children. She is a business woman, and lives in a rural area. Umri is a brave, honest, gentle, and hospitable woman.

Umri's husband is a master of construction. His free time is spent keeping livestock and selling them at the animal market. Umri helps her husband raise the livestock. She is planning to enlarge their family livestock activity, and she needs forage for the cattle.

Umri is asking for a loan of 3,500 TJS from KIVA to buy forage. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy forage

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 46 years old, married, and had five children. Two of them are studying and need allowances and tuition fees. Her spouse is a farmer, and she sells vegetables for income. She wanted to increase her profits, but had insufficient funds to buy more vegetables to sell. 

So she is now asking for a loan of P17,000 to buy vegetables (squash, eggplant, tomatoes and beans) to sell. 

This additional merchandise will increase her profits and she could save it for educational purposes.

loans.use: to buy vegetables (squash, eggplant, tomatoes and beans) to sell

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
Mariafe is a hardworking mother to her 10-year-old child. She has bravely raised her child alone, since her husband died. 

Mariafe has the skills to do nail care. Doing this kind of service was a hobby for Mariafe, but it turned out to be her primary source of income. Recently, she signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC, in order to access capital. She wanted to purchase a new pedicure and manicure set. Mariafe deeply wishes to open a small beauty salon in her own home in order to draw more customers.

loans.use: to purchase a new pedicure and manicure set

loans.name: Fregelyn

texts.en:
Fregelyn raises hogs and is a vegetable vendor within her local community. She is 28 years old, and married with one child.

Fregelyn has been in this business for 1 year. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP, because she would like to have her business grow continuously. She will utilize this loan to buy hog feed and vitamins for her hog raising business.

Fregelyn knows that having this loan will enable her to earn a better income, and improve her living conditions. She is hoping that lenders will approve her requested loan.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vitamins for her hog raising business

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 44 years old and married with 10 children, seven of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a direct selling Avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of Avon products to sell.

Julie has been in this business for 16 years. 

In the future Julie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of Avon products to sell

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a 50-year-old married woman, with two children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ligaya has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 17,000 PHP through NWTF, to purchase an additional motorcycle for her business. She has been in this business for 6 years. 

Ligaya would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional motorcycle for her business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 41 years old, and married with two children who are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Lucy runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future Lucy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Dolores has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from food vending.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 37 years old and has two children. She is married, and has two children who are in school.

Eva is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

Eva has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 35 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, egg, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Lorena has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, egg, milk, sugar, noodles, etc

loans.name: Etonam

texts.fr: Etonam est agée 23 ans et vit à Logogomé. Etonam est mariée et  mère de deux enfants. Elle vend des habits dans les marchés et dans son quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour aider son mari dans les charges de la famille. Etonam s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Etonam veut passer une commande de ventes des habits et demande ce crédit pour le réaliser. Etonam souhaite disposer d’un local pour élargir son activité.
texts.en: Etonam is 23 years old and lives in Logogomé. She is married and has two children. She sells clothing at the market and in her neighborhood in order to earn a revenue and help her husband provide for the family. Etonam stocks up twice a month at the big market of Lomé. She would like to place an order for clothing and is requesting a loan to do so. Etonam would like to have a store to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy one dozen women's outfits and one dozen skirts.

loans.name: Rene Abel

texts.es: René de 47 años de edad se dedica desde hace 7 años a la venta de leche y queso, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, René vive en casa propia con su esposa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de leche por mayor y comprar nuevos recipientes como los que muestra en la fotografía para poder seguir con sus ventas y poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
René, 47, has been selling milk and cheese for seven years. His business is located in his home and he has many clients due to his low prices. With what he earns from his sales, he manages to cover some of his household expenses. René lives in his own house with his wife. 

He is applying for a loan to buy wholesale milk and to buy new containers, such as those shown in the photo, in order to continue with his sales and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale milk and buy new containers.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
Erika es una mujer de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo varón de 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, sensible, generosa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona Sur de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por las redes viales que conectan a la ciudad y por encontrarse uno de los 2 aeropuertos internacionales, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 19-35 grados centígrados.
Erika es de tez trigueña, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro, usa blusa verde). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio de periódico y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su desde de mejorar su actividad la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de cuñapés, venta de carteras, venta de productos naturales, venta de bisutería, tienda de barrio, librería y peluquería, para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus metas. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno de papa o churiqui), y otros, labor que realiza en un ambiente improvisado como comedor en su domicilio, todos los días de la semana para la hora de almuerzo y la hora de cena. “saco unas mesas y sillas, levanto unas sombrillas y así preparo mi comedor, los clientes son constantes y les gusta mucho el sazón de mi comida…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante en su domicilio y mejorar la calidad de atención a sus clientes, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor, como; harina, arroz, fideo, yuca, papas, queso y otros. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Erika solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor para cocinar platos típicos.
texts.en:
Erika, 34, lives with her partner and has an eight-year-old son. Her business is selling traditional food.

She is a good mother who is sensitive, generous, responsible, and hardworking. She works in her business in the southern part of the city, an area characterized by transportation networks which connect to the city as well as one of the two international airports. The climate is warm and tropical, with temperatures varying between 19 and 35 degrees Celsius.

Erika has olive skin, long dark hair which she ties up, and dark eyes. She is of short, robust stature. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish in general affairs and in her business. In the photo, she is sitting in the middle of the group with a green shirt. She shares her life with her partner, who works in the newspaper business, and with her son, who studies at school. They live in a rented room made of bricks with a corrugated iron roof. They have running water, electricity, and a sewage system. 

In order to improve her business activity, she formed a group of people with businesses such as selling "cuñapés" (bread with cheese), selling wallets, selling natural products, selling jewelry, a neighborhood store, a bookstore and a hair salon, in order to apply for a loan and achieve their goals. Her business is selling traditional food, such as "majadito de charque" (dehydrated meat, rice, fried eggs and fried plantains), "sopa de remojado" (bone soup), "cogote relleno" (chicken necks filled with potatoes or beef), and others. She works in an improvised dining room in her home every day for lunch and dinner. "I take out some tables and chairs, put up some umbrellas, and prepare my dining room. My clients are consistent and they really like the taste of my food," she says. Her dream is to have a restaurant in her home and to improve the quality of her customer service.

She would like to buy wholesale cooking ingredients, such as flour, rice, noodles, yuca, potatoes, cheese, and others. This is the third loan cycle with the institution in the six years she has had this business.

Therefore, Erika is applying for a loan to buy wholesale cooking ingredients to cook traditional dishes.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cooking ingredients to cook traditional dishes.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS CORAZONES VALIENTES DE MORRO SAN JUAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Margarita se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes,patos y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes,patos y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the communal bank, “Los Corazones Valientes de Morros San Juan”. It is located in the district of Santa Ana, which belongs to the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco. 

Margarita’s business is raising animals such as guinea pigs, ducks, and hens.  By means of this business, she wants to open her grocery store, as her dream is to have her own business, and she also wants to have a bigger space where she would be able to sell her animals.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase guinea pigs, ducks, chickens, and animal feed.

She is happy about the loan, and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs, ducks, chickens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is from Ozamiz City, Philippines. She is 53 years old and married. Susan owns and manages a retail store business, selling assorted consumer goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. Susan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 47 and married, and they're blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost 25 years and earns a net income of PHP 2,000 a day. Her net income on this business was spent on the school allowances of their children, food expenses, and electric bills. Due to lack of capital for her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 45,000 to purchase beverages, sugar, canned goods, milk, soap, and shampoo to sell. She's hoping for more business improvement in the year ahead.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, sugar, canned goods, milk, soap, and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Petronilo

texts.en: Petronilo is 52 years old and lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with two adult children. He has a shop that sells meat and has had this business for 20 years. He requested a loan to purchase two cows and three pigs as additional inventory for his meat shop. He has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future,  Petronilo wants to expand his business and open another shop in his town.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and three pigs as additional inventory.

loans.name: Pilardo

texts.en: Pilardo is from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, in the Philippines. He is married, with seven children. Pilardo is a fisherman. He manages his own fishing business and owns fish cages as well. He earns a good income each month doing this work, supporting the needs of his big family, especially his children's education. He has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase new fishing accessories, and pay for an engine repair and overhaul. In the future, Pilardo hopes to buy another fishing boat to improve and expand his fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing accessories and pay for an engine repair and overhaul

loans.name: Ma. Virginia

texts.en:
Ma. Virginia works hard to support her family. Ma. Virginia is married and has a massage service in the Philippines.

Ma. Virginia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like towels, oil, and lotion for her business.

Ma. Virginia has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Ma. Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like towels, oil, and lotion for her massage business

loans.name: Gustavo Santos

texts.es:
Gustavo, de 69 años de edad, no estudió, mas sin embargo con mucho esfuerzo aprendió a leer y escribir, ya que un familiar se esmeró en enseñarle lo básico, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene ocho hijos, todos están casados y el vive solo con su esposa.

Gustavo, se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que estaba muy joven, actualmente siembra maíz y chile verde, en un pequeño invernadero que tiene, le ayudan dos de sus hijos en el trabajo dentro del invernadero.

Con el préstamo comprará tres sacos de abono, una bolsa de semilla de maíz y pagar la mano de obra.

El sueño de Gustavo, es que su cultivo pueda generar buenas ganancias, para poder seguir cultivando y llevando el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Gustavo, 69, did not study, but with plenty of effort he learned to read and write. One of his relatives took great pains to teach him the basics. He is married and his wife is dedicated to the household duties. He has eight children, all of whom are married. He lives alone with his wife.

Gustavo has worked in agriculture since he was very young. He currently plants corn and green chiles in a small greenhouse which he owns. Two of his children help him with the work in the greenhouse.

With this loan, he will buy three sacks of fertilizer and a bag of corn seeds. He will also pay workers. 

Gustavo's dream is for his crops to generate good earnings so that he can continue growing and providing sustenance for his family.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizer and a bag of corn seeds, as well as to pay workers.

loans.name: Saidtohir

texts.ru: Саидтохир мужчина 35 лет, женат, отец троих детей. Он родился и вырос в сельской местности и с детства помогал отцу смотреть за домашним скотом. После женитьбы Саидтохир решил продолжить дело отца. В его делах ему помогает жена. Она доит коров и относит молока на рынок для продажи. На выручку она покупает хлеб на завтрак. У Саидтохира большая семья, он должен обеспечивать и свою жену с детьми, и пожилых родителей. Он подрабатывает так же таксистом в ночную смену. Саидтохир хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота, но у него нет полной суммы денег. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Он надеется на финансовой поддержку и благодарит за доверие.
texts.en: Saidtohir is a 35-year-old married man and a father of three children. He was born and grew up in a rural area and since childhood helped his father to look after livestock. After getting married, Saidtohir decided to continue his father's business. His wife helps him with the business. She milks the cows and sells milk at a market. She buys bread for breakfast with the sale earnings. Saidtohir has a large family; he has to provide for his wife and children and elderly parents. He also works as a taxi driver during the night shift. Saidtohir wants to increase his livestock headcount, but does not have the needed amount of money. This is why he came to Arvand for financial support. He hopes for the financial support and is grateful for the trust.

loans.use: to increase his livestock headcount

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: To make a living, Cecilia sells fruits and vegetables in her community. She is now 63 years old and has three adult children. They are currently residing in a rural community. Due to the hardship of living, she aspires to improve her business and earn a higher income. Cecilia would like to borrow PHP 18,000 to buy more fruits, vegetables and seasonings to sell. Being a hard-working mother, she believes that someday, she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables and seasonings to resell

loans.name: Shiamenda

texts.en: Shiamenda has been successful in managing her sari-sari (small grocery) store. She needs enough inventory to serve her customers well.  Everyday, she makes good sales since she is the only store in the area. Recently she approached Paglaum for much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is 56 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 
Felina earns a living from vegetable farming and duck raising. She’s been engaged in this business for more than three years.  She earns approximately PHP 2,000 a month from her business to support her family's needs. She has requested a loan to purchase a cow for fattening. 
Felina has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. In the future, Felina hopes to expand her duck-raising business.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for fattening

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru: Рахим мужчина 50 лет, женат, счастливый отец и дедушка. Он родился и вырос в тяжелые времена, поэтому с детства приучен к тяжелому труду. Рахим окончил 9 классов средней школы и после этого пошел учиться в технический колледж на электрика. Сейчас он подрабатывает у себя в селе электриком. Также у Рахима есть свой бизнес. Он занимается животноводством. На его участке земли 3 коровы и 10 баранов. Его жена доит коров, из молока изготавливает сметану и творог. Рахим планирует расширить свой бизнес и купить трех молодых барашков. Но у него на данный момент нет полной суммы денег. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Он надеется, что МДО Арванд откликнется на его просьбу о помощи и выделит ему нужную сумму.Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
