texts.fr: Sur la photo celle qui a posé sa main sur  le mouton est Fatoumata. Elle est femme Malienne âgés de 50 ans.  Elle est analphabète, mariée  à un cultivateur et mère de 4 enfants  âgé de 13 à 20 ans tous sont  scolarisés ; elle exerce  l’activité élevage de moutons depuis 6 ans. Elle emprunte le prêt  de RMCR pour pouvoir acheter ses moutons a élever puis elle les revend. Elle s’approvisionne sur le marché local et revendre ses animaux dans le même marché. Le profil qu’elle tire  dans l’élevage des ovins la permet de prendre en charges les dépenses de sa famille ( frais scolaire, médicaux, habillements) et subvenir à leur bien être. Cela lui permet d’aider son mari à prendre les charges de la famille. Dans cette activité elle gagne de bénéfice important raison pour laquelle elle l’apprécie.
texts.en: In the photo, the person with her hand on the sheep is Fatoumata. She is a Malian woman aged 50. She is illiterate and married to a farmer. She has four children aged between 13 and 20 and they all attend school; she has been breeding sheep for six years. She borrows from RMCR to enable her to buy sheep for raising and then she sells them. She buys her sheep at the local market and sells them at the same market. Her profile in the sheep fattening business enables her to assume her family's expenditure (school fees, medical expenses, clothing) and to take care of their well-being. This enables her to help her husband with the cost of running the family. In this activity she makes a good profit that she much appreciates.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée  âgée de 51 ans. Yawa vit à Apédokoè avec ses deux enfants et son mari. Elle est très dynamique et vend des produits d’alimentations générales. Cette activité l’aide à réaliser une bonne épargne et à soutenir son mari pour couvrir les charges de la famille. Pour disposer ses marchandises, Yawa s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché d’Adidogomé. Yawa demande ce crédit pour acheter des biscuits et les marchandises pour alimenter son étalage afin d’avoir encore plus de bénéfice
texts.en: Yawa is a 51 year old married woman. Yawa lives in Apédokoè with her two children and her husband. She is very dynamic and sells general food products. This business helps her to achieve a good savings and to support her husband in covering the family's expenses. To manage her merchandise, Yawa resupplies once a month at the market in Adidogomé. Yawa is asking for this loan to buy cookies and other merchandise to supply her stall so that she can make a larger profit.

loans.use: to buy 50 bags of cookies and 16 dozens of detergent.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio, está casado, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y el último estudia quinto grado, su esposa se dedica a los que haceres del hogar.

Antonio, trabaja como seguridad en un auto-hotel, de ahi dependen sus ingresos, tiene varios años en este trabajo.

Antonio, utilizará el préstamo para ampliar su casa, el quiere que su familia este mucho más comoda, desea construir dos cuartos, para sus dos hijos mayores y tambien, desea mejorar la estructura de la casa, para que resista mejor las condiciones del clima.

Antonio, quiere seguir ampliando su casa, para que sus hijos vivan tranquilos con sus familias propias.
texts.en:
Antonio is married with three children.  Two of them are adults and the third one is in the fifth grade.  His wife takes care of the household chores.

Antonio works as security at a motel.  He has several years in this work and he depends upon it for his income.

Antonio will use this loan to expand his house.  He would like for his family to be much more comfortable.  He wishes to construct two rooms for his two oldest children and he also wishes to improve the structure of the house in order to better resist the weather conditions.

Antonio would like to continue expanding his house in order that his children live tranquilly with their own families.

loans.use: enlarge his house

loans.name: Silvia  Arely

texts.es:
Silvia, es promotora de salud, solo tiene un hijo que actualmente estudia noveno grado, en el centro escolar de su municipio.

Silvia, tiene 20 años de ser promotora de salud de su comunidad, es una gran ayuda para todas las personas de ese lugar, todos la conocen y es una persona muy amigable con todos.

Silvia, necesita el crédito para remodelar su casa, desea hacer gradas en la entrada de su casa y a las personas que la visitan, para que ella las atienda en cualquier emergencia, se les dificulta subir.

Lo que ella desea en el futuro es lograr ver a su hijo graduado de una carera universitaria y sentirse satisfecha con el trabajo que ha realizado todos estos años.
texts.en:
Silvia is a health promoter. She only has one son, who is in the ninth grade at the school in their municipality.

Silvia has been a health promoter for 20 years in her community. She is a great help to everyone where she lives. She knows and is very friendly with everyone.

Silvia needs the loan to remodel her house. She wants to install steps at the entrance of her home for the people who visit her. For her to attend any emergency it is difficult to climb.

What she wants in the future is to see her son graduate from a career university and feel satisfied with the work she has done all these years.

loans.use: to remodel her home.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 30-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two daughter and one son. 

Her husband owns a small business of selling ready-made garments at home. He purchases clothes from the market at low prices and sells them for higher prices in his community. The town people like his garment collection and selections a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because the winter weather is ending and people are demanding seasonal clothes. Rubina requested a loan so that her husband can buy more variety of garments to fulfil the demand. 

Rubina wishes for a bright future for her children and her dream is to provide them with a better education. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's garment business.

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Dans le quartier de Gblinkomégan, Eya vit avec ses quatre enfants. Elle une femme mariée et âgée de 38 ans. Eya est revendeuse de charbon de bois qui gagne son revenu journalier grâce à cette activité. Eya stock les charbons dans sa maison et livre ensuite aux clients qui viennent en chercher. Eya s’approvisionne au marché d’Amé une fois par mois. Pour acheter de nouveaux sacs de charbons, Eya demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer un revenu favorable pour l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en: In the Gblinkomégan district, Eya lives with her four children. She is a married woman, 38 years old, and a retailer of charcoal, which earns her daily income in this business of hers. She stocks the charcoal in her house and then delivers it to customers who come looking for some. She gets her supplies at the Amé market once a month. To purchase new sacks of charcoal, Eya is asking for this loan to make her purchase and to derive the revenues for her family to thrive.

loans.use: to purchase 16 sacks of  charcoal

loans.name: Nouna Kadi Group

texts.fr: Nouna Kadi est un groupe de 5 membres. Awa, responsable du groupe est mariée et mère de 5 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle fait le commerce des oignons et de la tomate. Awa et les autres membres sont à leur 10ème prêt avec ACFIME et jusque là, les remboursements se font sans difficile. Ce prêt sera vraiment utile à Awa car, elle pourrait acheter plus d'oignon et de tomate pour vendre. A l'issue de ses ventes, les bénéfices lui permettront de continuer et de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Nouna Kadi is a group of 5 members. Awa, the leader of the group, is married and a mother to 5 children, all in school. She trades onions and tomatoes. Awa and the other members are on their 10th loan with ACFIME and so far the repayments have not been a difficulty. This loan will be very useful for Awa, as she could buy more onions and tomatoes to sell. As a result of her sales, the profits will allow her to continue on and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy onions and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Zoudeya

texts.fr: Il y’ a quelques années que Zoudeya a perdu son mari et demeure veuve. Zoudeya vit à Awatamé avec ses deux enfants. Pour aider ses enfants à réussir dans leurs études, Zoudeya vend des bassines en plastiques et des tonneaux au marché et livre ses produits à ses clients. Zoudeya s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Zoudeya souhaite commander des bassines pour répondre favorablement aux sollicitations de ses clients et avoir un profit pour bien nourrir ses enfants.
texts.en: Zoudeya lost he husband a few years ago and remains a widow. She lives in Awatamé with her two children. To help her children to succeed in their studies, Zoudeya sells plastic tubs and casks at the market and delivers her products to her customers. She gets her supplies twice a month at the big market of Lomé. She would like to order some tubs to respond to customer requests and to have a profit to do well in feeding her children.

loans.use: to purchase 2 dozen plastic tubs and 12 casks

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une femme mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est âgée de 40 ans et vit à Avédji pour exercer ses activités. Akouvi vend des produits d’alimentations générales et réalise son bénéfice par le revenu tiré de son activité. Akouvi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Afin de commander des sacs de maïs et d’haricots, Akouvi sollicite ce crédit pour acquérir son stock et développer son activité.
texts.en: Akouvi is a married woman and the mother of one child. Akouvi is 40 years old and lives in Avédji to operate her business. She sells grocery items and makes a profit from the revenues from her work. She gets her supplies twice a month at the big market of Lomé. To order sacks of corn and beans, she is requesting this loan to acquire her inventory and to develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of corn and 4 sacks of beans

loans.name: Jiguiseme Group

texts.fr: Kefa est la dame assise au milieu des 2 autres femmes aussi assises avec le sac juste devant. Elle âgée 44 ans,  mariée, mère de 10 enfants dont 6 filles, 2 sont scolarisés elle fait le stockage de céréales et réside avec son mari au Mali  dans la même localité. Son mari fait l’agriculture.  Kefa n’a pas été à l’école elle fait conjointement la couture de pagnes  avec son activité de stokage de céréales. Elle s’approvisionne en céréales (mil, sorgho et arachide) dans les différents marchés périphérique elle dispose un magasin en banco avec le prêt de RMCR elle a pu acheter d’arachide en quantité a temps et en  bon prix. Elle souvent confronté a un problème tel que la chute de prix. Le bénéfice généré prend certaines  charges de la famille telle que les frais médicaux des enfants, leur habillements.
texts.en:
Kefa is the woman seated in the middle of the other two seated women with the bag in front of her. She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of 10 children, 6 of whom are girls and 2 of whom attend school. Kefa stores cereals and lives with her husband in Mali.

Kefa's husband is in agriculture. Kefa did not attend school; in addition to her storage and sale of cereals, she also tailors "pagne" cloth.

Kefa stocks up on cereals (millet, sorghum, and ground nuts) in the different surrounding markets, and she runs her own small shop. With the loan she received from RMCR, Kefa was able to purchase ground nuts in bulk, at the right time, and at a good price.

Kefa is often confronted with the issue of falling prices. The income Kefa generates will help her to provide for her family, as well as for her children's medical expenses and their clothing.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cereals to restock and resell

loans.name: Allah Kafo Group

texts.fr:
Tiécoura est l’ hommequi a mis sa main sur le sac de céréale sur la photo. 
Il est âgé  de 60 ans, marié, père de 15 enfants dont 3 scolarisés. Il fait le stockage et a une expérience  de 10 ans il réside avec sa famille au Mali. Il a fréquenté l’école et ses  études sont arrêtées en  classe de 6 années. Avec le prêt de RMCR il a pu acheter beaucoup d’arachide et de mil à bon prix et à temps. Il s’approvisionne dans les différents marchés en mil, sorgho et arachide. Il garde son stock jusqu’à  ce que les prix augmentent, en ce temps il les revend dans les mêmes marchés. Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permet de couvrir les charges de la famille. Tiécoura aime le stockage  car cela lui permet de s’en sortir. Il n’a pas rencontré de problème majeur.
texts.en: Tiecoura is the man who has his hand on the sack of cereals in the photo. He is 60 years old and married with 15 children of whom three go to school. He works in storage and has ten years experience in this field. He lives in Mali with his family. He attended school and studied until the sixth year. His RMCR loan enabled him to buy a lot of groundnuts and millet for a good price, and at the right time. He buys his stock of millet, sorghum and groundnuts in different markets. He keeps his stock until the prices go up and then he sells the goods at the same markets. The profit from this activity enables him to provide for his family. Tiecoura likes working in storage because it enables him to make enough money to take care of his family. He hasn't had any major problems.

loans.use: to buy cereals for storage, then resell them.

loans.name: Jiguignouma Group

texts.fr:
Seba est l’homme assis par devant avec le bélier juste devant lui. 
Seba est  un éleveur d’ovins, âgé de 45 ans, marié, père de 3 enfants dont 01  est scolarisé  et qui fait la huitième année il réside avec sa femme dans la même localité au mali. Les études de Seba sont arrêtées en classe de huitième année. seba fait l’élevage il y’a plus de 10 ans de cela il  s’approvisionne en béliers (moutons) dans les foires locales et avec le prêt de RMCR il achète  plus de moutons  pour l’élevage. Les animaux sont internés dans un enclos en bois et il  ambitionne d’ériger son enclos en grillage. Les bénéfices générés par son activité sont utilisés pour supporter les charges de la famille et pour les soins médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Seba is the man sitting in front with a ram right in front of him. He is a livestock farmer of sheep, 45 years old, and the father of three children, including one in school. He has been living in the same town in Mali with his wife for 18 years. He halted his studies in the 8th grade. 

For over ten years, Seba has been raising livestock. He gets his supplies of rams (sheep) from local fairs. And with the RMCR loan, he is buying more sheep to raise. The animals are kept in a wooden fence. His ambition is to build a wire fence. The profits generated by his business are used to cover family expenses and his children’s medical care.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to raise and then sell

loans.name: Transito

texts.es:
Tránsito, está casada y vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo, sus hijos están estudiando en el centro escolar de su comunidad y su esposo se dedica a la albañileria.

Tránsito, se dedica a la agricultura, para poder subsistir con los granos básicos, ella cultiva granos para el consumo y vende una parte de la cosecha, para obtener ingresos y cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar mano de obra que le ayude a sembrar y recoger la cosecha.

Tránsito, les enseña a sus hijos, que con sacrifio se puede lograr tener lo que se desea.

Ella desea que en un futuro sus hijos sean personas de bien, que logren llegar a ser importantes en la vida y que jamás olviden lo que ella les está inculcando.
texts.en:
Tránsito is married and lives with her two children and husband. Her children are students at the community school and her husband is a mason.

Tránsito works in agriculture in order to be able to subsist on basic grains. She grows grains for consumption and sells part of the harvest for income and to cover home expenses. She wants a loan to buy agricultural products and to pay labor to help plant and harvest crops.

Tránsito teaches her children that you can obtain what you desire through sacrifice. She hopes that her children grow up to be good people who achieve significance in life and never forget the values she is instilling in them.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products and to pay labor to help plant and harvest crops.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel tiene 19 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida. Él se gana la vida trabajando como agricultor desde hace mucho tiempo lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Junto a su compañera de vida han logrado establecer un puesto de venta de pupusas en donde logran sacar los ingresos necesarios para equilibrar la economía del hogar. Manuel ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: maíz, queso, tomates, repollo, aceite, etc. para seguir elaborando y vendiendo las deliciosas pupusas que tanto prefieren sus clientes.
texts.en: Manuel is 19 years old and lives in his own house with his life companion. He has been making his living working as a farmer for a long time which has permitted him to provide for his household. Together with his life companion they have been able to establish a pupusa stand where they can get the income needed to stabilize the household economy. Manuel has made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of the necessary ingredients like: corn, cheese, tomatoes, cabbage, oil, etc. to continue to make and sell the delicious pupusas that his customers enjoy.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, tomatoes, cabbage, oil, etc. for his pupusa business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama est une femme mariée agée de 45 ans et mère de quatre enfants. Ama vit  à Ségbé pour entreprendre son activité. Elle vend des noix de palme au marché et se promène dans le quartier. Ama s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché de Gapé. Amah demande ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de noix de palme. Ama désire réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Ama is a married woman, 45 years old, and the mother of four children. She lives in Ségbé for operating her business. She sells palm nuts at the market and by hawking in the district. She gets her supplies twice a month at the Gapé market. Ama is asking for this loan to purchase sacks of palm nuts. She would like to make a profit to help her husband covering family expenses and to allow her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase 20 tubs of palm nuts

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 41 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su familia en el distrito de La Florida en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de San Miguel, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las principales actividades que se desarrollan en esta comunidad son la agricultura y la crianza de animales.

El se dedica a brindar los servicios de carpintería metálica contando con herramientas propias de trabajo, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 4 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos que brindan muy buenas referencias laborales de el. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de madera así como una máquina cortadora de madera para implementar su negocio, con esto Jorge espera poder elaborar más cómodas, repisas, camas, entre otros muebles y de esta manera satisfacer los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ventas y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 41 years old and single. He lives with his family in the district of La Florida in a rural zone. It is located in the province of San Miguel, Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru. The principal activities that take place in this community are agriculture and raising animals.

Jorge works offering wood and metal services. He has his own work tools and his business is located at his house. He has more than 4 years in the business and he has regular clients who provide very good work references for him.

The loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of wood as well as a machine to cut wood to use in his business. Doing this Jorge hopes to be able to make more chest of drawers, shelves and beds amongst other furniture. In this way he can satisfy the tastes and preferences of his clients. It will have a positive impact of his level of sales and in the end improve the quality of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of wood as well as a wood cutting machine to use in his business.

loans.name: Gamanfel

texts.es:
Gamanfel tiene 66 años de edad, es viudo y no tiene hijos. Él vive en el distrito de Pomahuaca el cual es un caserío pequeño con aspiraciones a superarse, sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

Gamanfel se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pequeña bodega donde ofrece la venta de arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros y está ubicada en su domicilio. Su negocio es estable, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos, por su buen servicio y experiencia cuenta con bastante clientela de la zona. El destino del crédito será para invertir en el negocio con la compra de una mayor cantidad de azúcar, arroz, entre otros productos, con esto Gamanfel desea aumentar y diversificar su stock de productos y poder adquirir mayores ingresos para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gamanfel is a 66 year old widower with no children. He lives in the district of Pomahuaca, which is a small village with aspirations to succeed. Its main activities are agriculture, commerce, and raising livestock. It is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

Gamanfel is engaged in commerce. He has a small store where he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, and more. It’s located in his home. His business is stable. He has over 10 years of experience in the business. He gets very good personal and professional references from his neighbors for good service and expertise. He has enough customers in his area. 

The loan is to invest in the business with the purchase of larger amounts of sugar, rice, and other products. Gamanfel wants to increase and diversify his stock of products and acquire higher incomes and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to stock his store with rice, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Crisantemo Group

texts.es: Crisantemo es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres y un varón, quien es el que coordina al resto de las socias, él es Oscar un hombre que desde muy joven aprendió lo que era la agricultura, y a sus 45 años se dedica a la agricultura y comercialización de flores naturales tiene un tramo en el mercado más populoso de la capital donde comercializa los productos que siembra además compra para diversificar y cubrir la demanda que tiene de los productos, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa para la comercialización de los productos,  es el décimo noveno ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento para su negocio y ha demostrado ser responsable y muy trabajador, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de rosas, palmas margaritas, crisantemos, etc. El resto de las integrantes son, Yesli una joven de 23 años que se dedica a la elaboración de flores artificiales, este negocio lo aprendió desde sus quince años y ahora es independiente y entrega en el mercado más populoso de la capital por encargo,  Anabelle que tiene la edad de 25 años su negocio es el destace de cerdo en su domicilio además entrega por encargo en Nindirí, y Karla una señora que a sus 69 años se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos a los pobladores de su comunidad desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en:
Crisantemo is a solidarity group comprised of three women and one male; the male member coordinates the rest of the members. Oscar learned agriculture from a very young age. At the age of 45, he works in agriculture and the marketing of natural flowers. He has a section in the most populous capital market where he sells what he has planted. He also purchases plants with the goal of diversifying and meeting the demand for his products. He counts on the help of his wife to sell products. 

This is the nineteenth cycle Kiva partner ADIM has provided financing for Oscar's business. He has proven to be responsible and hardworking. He is requesting the current loan for the purchase of roses, palms, daisies, chrysanthemums, etc.

The rest of the members are: Yesli, a young woman 23 years of age who arranges artificial flowers. She started learning the business at the age of 15. She now works independently delivering custom orders to the biggest market in the capital. Annabelle, who is 25 years old, works butchering pigs from her home. She also delivers custom orders in Nindirí. Karla, who is 69 years old, has marketed cosmetics to people in the community for the last four years.

loans.use: purchase flowers like daisies, chrysanthemums, palms, etc., in order to meet the demand for these products.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
LAS TRIUNFADORAS es un grupo antiguo y muy unido, tiene 18 integrantes, se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, son muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.
Una de las integrantes de  este comité es la señora Delia quien se dedica a la cría y faena de animales, su casa está localizada a pocos metros de una ruta asfaltada donde llega mucha gente a comprar carne de cerdo, gallinas faenadas entre otros, es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora. 
Delia pide este préstamo para la compra de animales, alimentos para ellos y también para la construcción de gallineros y corrales para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
“Las Triunfadoras” (The Triumphant Ones) is the name of an established and unified group with 18 members. They are participating in their fourth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. The members are hardworking and determined.

One of the committee members is Sra. Delia, who raises and butchers animals. Her house is located a few meters away from a paved road where many people come to buy pork, butchered chickens, and other products. Delia is a hardworking and determined individual. She is requesting a loan in order to buy animals and feed. She will also build chicken coops and pens so that she can continue her work just as before.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed and to pay for the construction of chicken coops and animal pens.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 34 years old and single. 

Edna has been engaged in cooking and selling snack foods within the school canteen for almost four years. She aims to continue and improve this business in order to gain a higher income and sustain her daily necessities. 

Having inadequate capital, Edna would like to avail an additional PHP 20,000 to buy rice, sugar, coconut, macaroni, milk, noodles and seasonings she needs to cook and sell. Having this financial assistance, Edna believes that she will satisfy her customers' demand and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coconut, macaroni, milk, noodles and seasonings

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 44 years old, married and had two children attending school.

She and her spouse are farmers. They plant and harvest vegetables and then she sells the harvested vegetables to the market. Aside from the farming business, she also raises hogs to sell upon their growth.

She is now asking for an additional loan to invest in her businesses. She will buy insecticides used in vegetable farming and feed for the hogs. Someday she hopes to increase her harvest so she can sell more vegetables and earn for educational purposes.

loans.use: to buy insecticides used in vegetable farming and feed for hogs

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

Carmelita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a cultured seaweed business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase materials like plastic rope, empty bottles, etc.  Jocelyn has been in this business for 15 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials like plastic rope, empty bottles, etc.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 74 years old and married with twelve children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

Conchita has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and a cafeteria.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Labban

texts.en: Labban is a married man aged 28 years and living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His business is buying and selling produce, mainly maize and beans. He ventured into business in order to meet his family's needs. His business vision is to expand to greater heights now that there is high demand for maize as a result of drought that has caused famine. He is challenged by changes in prices. Labban is requesting a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Jeoramy

texts.en:
Jeoramy is 29 years old and is married with six children.

Jeoramy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Jeoramy has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Jeoramy aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc to sell.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred lives in Hoima Uganda. He is aged 43, is married and has three children aged between 10 to 15. He operates a retail shop mainly selling  general merchandise, sugar and salt, among other items. He gets extra income from rentals. He hopes to build his own house and will use the credit to buy sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock like sugar, salt  and soap to sell.

loans.name: Fasodeme Group

texts.fr:
M’pene est assise sur la photo avec la chèvre en main.
M’pene est une malienne de 40 ans mariée mère de 3 enfants âgés de 18  à 11 ans. N’ayant pas été à l’école M’pene est une femme au foyer, mais a l’autorisation de cultiver son petit champ d’arachide pendant l’hivernage et pendant la saison sèche ,elle exerce le petit embouche  d’ ovin et le jardinage cela depuis plus de 6 ans .Le prêt RMCR lui permet d’acheter plus d’animaux pour l’embouche et des semences et intrants agricole pour le jardinage. Les animaux (chèvre, mouton) sont achetés sur le marché local. La vente des produit du jardinage et les animaux de l’embouche est effectuée sur le marché local en espèce .Le bénéfice lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins et d’aider son marie dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiaux.
texts.en: M’pene is seated in the photograph, holding the goat. M'pene is a 40 year old Malian woman. She is married and a mother to 3 children ranging from 11 to 18 years old. Never having been in school, M'pene is a housewife, but has permission to farm her small peanut field during winterization and during the dry season. She has been practicing rearing sheep and gardening for more than 6 years. The RMCR loan will allow her to buy more animals for rearing, seeds, and crops for gardening. The animals (goats, sheep) are acquired at the local market. The farming products and livestock are sold for money at the local market. The profits will allow her to support her own needs and to help her husband in managing the family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy sheep to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Manizha

texts.en: Manizha is 24 years old. She is very kind woman. She divorced her husband and currently lives with her parents. Manizha is a seamstress. She likes her work. She has been engaged in this activity for a year. Now Manizha plans to expand her activity. She wants to buy fabrics, thread, etc. for her business.  From the profit of her activity, Manizha wants to improve her life condition. She hopes for your help.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, etc.

loans.name: German Pascual

texts.es:
German es un hombre de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 3 años, y su negocio es el comercio de ganado vacuno.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, comprometido con su trabajo, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Condoriri’ que es una montaña en la Cordillera Real de unos 5.648 metros de altitud, en los pies se encuentra la comunidad del mismo nombre, la gente del lugar se dedica  a la agricultura, de clima frío y seco.
German es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, baja estaura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la comparte con su hermano que se dedica a la agricultura y con sus padres que son de avanzada edad y ya no pueden trabajar, viven en una casa construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado, él se dedica a comprar terneros mejorados y criollos los alimenta, les pone las vacunas necesarias y cuando ya están grandes y gordos los vende. “nuestro principal problema es la falta de forraje, en verano por época de lluvias existe bastante pero en invierno compramos totora y sembramos la tierra para que nuestros animales coman…” comenta. Su sueño es construir una casa de ladrillo para que vivan sus padres, él desea realizar la compra de terneros mejorados para su crianza y engorde. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que German solicita un préstamo para comprar terneros mejorados y con los beneficios construir una casa a sus padres.
texts.en:
German is a 24-year-old man who lives with his wife. He has a 3-year-old son. German makes a living selling cattle. He is an entrepreneur who is independent, dedicated to his work, responsible, and hardworking. German carries out his work in the community called "Condoriri," which is a mountain in the Cordillera Real mountain ridge located 5,648 meters above sea level. At its foot is a community that shares its name. The people in that community work in agriculture in the cold and dry climate.

German has dark skin, short black hair, and dark eyes. He is short and of medium build. His native language is Aymará, which he speaks at home. He also speaks Spanish in his community. German shares his life with his brother, who makes a living as a farmer. With their parents, who are now advanced in years and unable to work, they live in an adobe house with a roof made of corrugated iron. They have a well and electricity. 

German's business is selling cattle.  He buys young calves and raises them. He feeds them and gives them the necessary vaccines. When they have grown, he sells them. "Our biggest problem is a lack of fodder. The the summer, the rainy season, there is plenty, but in the winter we buy large reeds and plant those so the animals can eat," he says. His dream is to build a brick house for his family. German hopes to buy some calves to raise and fatten. 

This is German's first loan cycle in the seven years that he has been independently running his business. It is for these reasons that German is requesting a loan: to buy cattle and with the benefits of doing so, build a house for his parents.

loans.use: to buy better cattle and with the benefits of doing so, build a house for his parents.

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita is 56 years old and single. She is from Dapaon, Sindangan. She runs a grocery store and has been operating her business for 15 years. She earns a monthly net income of 3,500 PHP.

In 2008, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid her previous loans from PMPC. Her most recent loan was used for personal purposes.

Expedita is requesting her seventh loan of 12,000 PHP, which she will use to expand her existing business. She wants to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store

location.town: Sindangan - Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Solihamo

texts.en: Solihamo is a generous woman. She was born in 1962 and is living in a remote district. She is married. Solihama is an experienced and challenged woman and is a seller with a grocery store. She gets enough income from her business. Solihamo has a great number of customers every day. She attracts clients with her fresh nutritious products. She is planning to enlarge her assortment and buy products. She is asking financial support from KIVA project to buy grocery products for her store. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Perlie

texts.en:
Perlie, 42 years old, is married. She lives with her husband and four kids in Dapaon, Sindangan, in the Philippines. 

In order to survive, Perlie has found ways to attain income through her sari-sari (small grocery) store. It began with displaying a few inventories of canned goods, noodles, sugar, and a dozen packets of shampoo and soap. 

Perlie joined the Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in May of 2013. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received her second loan. 

Now, Perlie has applied for 14,900 PHP to pay for additional merchandise to draw more customers to her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise to draw more customers to her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rexel

texts.en:
Rexel is 34 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one school-age child.

She operates a motorcycle for hire, and she’s been in the business for four years already. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity.

Rexel has requested a loan that she will use to purchase spare parts and accessories for motorcycle repair and maintenance.

She has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Rexel hopes to acquire a PUV (public utility vehicle) for hire.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 38 years old and married with three children, who all currently attend school.

Alma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Alma has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF, and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is 41 years old and married with four children.

Ma. Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, eggs, snack food, groceries, etc.

Ma. Elena has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Ma. Elena aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, eggs, snack food, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juanita is 55 years old now.

Juanita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Juanita has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Juanita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fish, dry it and sell to market for her dried fish business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish, dry it and sell to market.

loans.name: Joset

texts.en:
Joset is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a fishing business in the Philippines for 21 years now.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy morel equipment and materials for her business. She successfully repaid a previous loan. In the future, Joset hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment and materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicken feed.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is 58 years old, a mother of one son and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a sound system business by which he provides entertainment and musical services to the people of his society on marriage parties, birthday celebrations, special occasions and festivals. He is also a trained musician and provides training for musical classes. He is very popular due to his musical art. He has built up very good relations with his customers. Now he wants to buy some musical instruments for his work, such as a sound system, but he does not have sufficient amount of money to buy these expensive musical instruments.

This the reason Nagina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will give the full amount to her husband so that he can buy the latest musical instruments. She hopes that through this amount her husband would be able to enhance the business.

Nagina is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy instruments for her husband's sound system work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank and a toilet in her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and a variety of fabrics for the business of making clothes.

loans.name: Celia Marleny

texts.es: Celia de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace 20 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Celia esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharon, frijoles, quesillo, maíz, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Celia is 50 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and child. For 20 years she has earned a living selling stuffed tortillas. Her business is located in her home and she has a lot of customers, especially her neighbours. With the earnings from her sales she manages to pay for some of her household expenses. Celia is asking for this loan to buy crackling, beans, tortillas stuffed with cream cheese, corn, etc. in bulk in order to continue with her sales and therefore earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy crackling, beans, tortilla with a cream cheese filling, corn, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, fizzy drinks, water, juices, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es: Teodolinda de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas todos los días, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharon, frijoles, quesillo, maíz, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Teodolinda, 49, lives in her own home with the husband and son.   She is engaged in daily sales of “pupusas” [stuffed tortillas], and her business is located in her home.  She has many customers, and with the sales she makes, she manages to pay some household expenses.  She is requesting the loan to purchase pork cracklings, beans, cream cheese, and other items wholesale in order to continue with her sales and thus be able to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase pork cracklings, beans, cream cheese, and other items wholesale.

loans.name: Marhobo

texts.ru: Мархобо молодая жительница района Вахш. Ей всего 20 лет. Она пока еще не замужем. Мархобо проживает вместе семьей. Она дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Мархобо начала деятельность 2 года назад. Она шустрая и активная девушка. Ей удобно заниматься дома, она ведет домашние хозяйство и параллельно занимается шитьем. У Мархобо большие планы на жизнь. Она обратилась за кредитом и за счет кредита она хочет купить швейные принадлежности. Ее мечта – в будущем открыть свое ателье. Мархабо верит в Вас и надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Marhobo is a young resident of the Vakhsh district.  She is only 20 years old and is not married yet.  She lives with her family and sews women's clothes from home.  She started this activity two years ago.  Marhobo is a smart and dynamic young woman.  She finds it convenient to work from home, as she can take care of the household and at the same time be involved in her sewing activity.  Marhobo has big plans for her life.  She has applied for a loan and will use this money to buy sewing supplies.  Her dream is to open her own workshop one day.  She relies on you and hopes to receive your support.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 58 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children who are now adults. 

For her means of living, Norma is engaged in managing a sari-sari store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has done this for three years and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

Norma has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional stock of groceries and other consumable goods for retail. Norma has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, she hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries and other consumable goods

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which she used to buy fruits and vegetables needed in her business. Her store earnings helped send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

Guadalupe would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more quantities of bitter melon, cabbage, carrots, jack fruit, bananas, and other locally grown fruits and vegetables to sell. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely fund the everyday and educational needs of her children.

Guadalupe dreams of having a bigger fruit and vegetable store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to offer for sale

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita works hard to support her family. Elenita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Elenita has been in this business for 19 years now.

Elenita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat such as wood, bamboo, etc.

In the future, Elenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat such as wood, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lita works hard to support her family.

Lita has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Lita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Lita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Reyna

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Reyna works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish business in the Philippines and also earns income from fishing.

Reyna is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fish for her dried fish business.

Reyna has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to use in her business

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 28 years old and has children who are in school. Operating a pig-fattening business in the Philippines for three years now,Ma. Theresa has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her enterprise. She has requested a new loan for PHP 12000 to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Ma. Theresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 49 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for them.

Criselda has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Iluminada works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store. Iluminada is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Iluminada has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama est femme mariée et mère de neuf enfants. Elle est âgée de 44 ans et vit à Ségbé avec sa famille. Pour venir en aide aux besoins de la famille, Ama vend de l’huile de palme en bidons et en détails à ses clients. Pour s’approvisionner, Ama achète ses produits au grand marché de Lomé. Afin d’avoir un bénéfice favorable et augmenter son épargne, Ama demande ce crédit pour commander des bidons d’huile et satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en: Ama is a married woman and a mother to nine children. She is 44 years old and lives in Ségbé with her family. To help her family, Ama sells canned palm oil at retail to her clients. To get her supplies, Ama buys her products at the large market in Lomé. In order to make favorable profits and to increase savings, Ama is requesting this loan to order cans of oil and satisfy her clients.

loans.use: to buy 4 cans of oil.

loans.name: Adzovi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de sept enfants, Adzovi est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Adzovi vit à Ségbé pour exercer efficacement son activité. Pour favoriser l’épanouissement de sa famille, Adzovi a ouvert une boutique dans son quartier pour vendre des produits d’alimentations générales. Cette activité lui procure un gain qui ne couvre pas suffisamment ses besoins. Adzovi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Adzovi nécessite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de riz afin d’alimenter sa boutique pour répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses consommateurs.
texts.en: Adzovi is a 31 year old married woman and a mother to seven children. Adzovi lives in Ségbé to effectively practice her business. To promote the growth of her family, Adzovi opened a boutique in her neighborhood selling general food products. This business provides her a profit that cannot sufficiently cover her needs. Adzovi resupplies three times per month at the large market in Lomé. Adzovi requires this loan to order sacks of rice to supply her store in order to favorably respond to the needs of her consumers.

loans.use: To buy three sacks of rice.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un padre de familia de 50 años de edad, es casado tiene una familia hermosa de 9 hijos, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Carlos para generar sus ingresos se dedica a la agricultura sembrando una diversidad de verduras, tales como arveja,  cebolla papa y entre otros, esta actividad lo realiza el desde hace 8 años lo emprendió porque trabajaba con los vecinos sembrando de sol a sol, gracias a esta actividad él ha logrado sacar adelante a sus familia, Carlos ahora ha decidido realizar su siembra pues ya es la época de sembrar en la región donde él vive, pero una de las limitaciones que Carlos tiene es que no cuenta con suficiente capital para hacerlo, entonces él solicita un préstamo de  Q.8000.00 para comprar sus semillas y fertilizantes y poder cultivar en esta época.
El anhelo de Carlos es poder contar con este préstamo para seguir cultivando y mejorar sus ingresos para que el poder algún día construir su casa de terraza.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 50 year old man. He is married and has a beautiful family of nine children. They live in the community of Sololá. To earn money, Carlos works the land, growing diverse vegetables such as peas, onion, potato, etc. He has been working like this for the last eight years. He learned this trade from working some neighbors planting from sunrise to sunset. Thanks to this work, he has been able to help his family move forward. 

Now, Carlos has decided to plant his crops since it is the planting season for his region. However, one of the limitations on Carlos is that he does not have enough capital to do it. Carlos is requesting a loan of 8,000 quetzales in order to buy seeds and fertilizers so that he can cultivate his crops during this season. 

Carlos' dream is to obtain this loan so that he can continue planting and improving his income. This way, we will be able to build a hillside house one day.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Tomas tiene 37 años de edad es casado tiene una linda hija de 4 años, vive junto a su esposa en una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
Tomas es un hombre muy amable y responsable, pues él trabaja de sol a sol para que a su familia no le haga falta nada, el desde hace 8 años se dedica a la albañilería, su trabajo es muy distraído pero cansado, pues es  una larga jornada pero para tomas lo mas importante es contar con un trabajo que sea la fuente de ingreso para su familia.
para Tomas no hay nada más importante que su familia, es por eso que se ha dado cuenta que con el paso del año la casa ya no se encuentra en buenas condiciones pues ya se acerca la época de lluvia  y su casa está en mal estado, entonces Tomas y su esposa han considerado remodelar la casa, pero uno de las limitaciones que Tomas tiene es que no cuentan con suficiente dinero para hacerlo entonces han tomado la decisión de  realizar un préstamo de Q.4000.00 que lo utilizaran para comprar tendales, puertas, laminas, pisos.
El sueño de Tomas es poder  realizar la remodelación este año y seguir trabajando para pagar el préstamo y poder llegar se un maestro de obra.
texts.en:
Tomas is 37 years old. He is married and has a beautiful 4-year-old daughter. Tomas lives with his wife in the community of Chichicastenango. Tomas is a kind and responsible man. He works from sunrise to sunset so that his family will not lack anything. For the last eight years, Tomas has worked in construction. He works very far away, which is tiring. It is a long trek to get to work, but to Tomas, the most important thing is to have a job from which to support his family. For him, there is nothing more important than his family.

With this in mind, Tomas has realized that by next year, his house will be in very bad condition for the rainy season. His house is in need of repairs and he and his wife have considered remodeling it, but they lack the money to do so. For this reason, Tomas decided to request a loan of 4,000 quetzales that he will use to buy doors, metal sheets, and floor materials. Tomas' dream is to be able to remodel his house this year and continue working to pay back the loan. Eventually he hopes to become a master builder.

loans.use: to buy doors, metal sheets, and floor materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies, school uniforms and shoes for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 26-year-old married mother of two children. She used to work in selling clothes, but her family's increasing needs led her to think of a better business with a daily income that will help in covering their daily needs.

She opened a Cafeteria in June 2014, where she provides her customers with tasty breakfast Manakish accompanied by a hot coffee and special drinks. 

She also has a special sector where she provides her customers with tasty sweets, chips and juices they might need after their requested meal.

Amani is proving to be smart and organized in developing and expanding her business through the diversified services and products she is providing her customers.

Through her acquired YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, she will make necessary maintenance to her Cafeteria through expanding her area with special tents that will help attract more customers.

She hopes that in the future she will have a better location and will work on introducing her customers to new products of her own.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance to her Cafeteria by expanding her area with special tents that will help to attract more customers.

loans.name: Em Hassan Group

texts.en:
Amira, at the far left of the picture, is a 37-year old married mother of three children. She has been selling beauty cosmetics from her house for ten years and is working hard on developing her business.

She is a member of Em Hassan group, who got together to qualify for loans from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. The members have always been neighbors and friends, and they work hard on developing their family's living. Amira will invest her loan in business merchandise for special Spring and Summer collections, which are popular especially before Mother's Day on March 21st.

Other group members include Kafa, the second lady from the left, a 38-year old married mother of three children. Kafa has a cooking business she has run from her home for the last 18 years. Ibtissam, second from the right with the red coat, is a 54-year old Syrian widow and mother of two children. She has worked as a maid, providing cleaning services to several working women, since she was seventeen years old. Wadad, at the far right of the picture, is a 57-year old married mother of four children. She has run a cooking business from her home for the last forty years and still has the same old talents. 

All of the group members seek to develop their businesses and family's living for a better future.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for seasonal sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 20 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Miguel, 40, lives in his own home with his wife and three children.  For twenty years, he has owned a bakery, which is located in his home, and he has many customers due his quality bread-baking.  With the profits he earns, he manages to get ahead with the household expenses.  He is requesting the loan to purchase wheat, sugar, flavored jellies, molds, and other items to continue with his work and thus have better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, sugar, flavored jellies, molds, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of perfumes and body lotions to sell.

loans.name: Ana Doris

texts.es: Ana de 32 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de  antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc. que vende cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, gracias a las ventas que realiza y con la ayuda del esposo han logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar. Ana vive en casa propia con su esposo, y está solicitando un crédito para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maíz para los tamales, plátanos y todos los ingredientes para su elaboración y así poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en:
Ana, age 32, makes and sells food like French fries, fried yucca, empanadas, and tamales, etc.  She sells close to where she lives in a heavily traveled area.  Thanks to the sales that she makes, and with her husband’s help, they have managed to pay for the household expenses.  Ana lives in her own house with her husband.

She is requesting a loan to buy products to use making her food.  She will buy things like cooking oil, potatoes, corn for the tamales, bananas, and all of the ingredients to make the food.  This way she will be able to continue maintaining her household, and she will be able to pay for the expenses that may come up.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, potatoes, corn for the tamales, bananas, and all of the ingredients to make the food.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a 22-year-old married man from Khanyounis. He works selling kids candy using his rickshaw. Adham wants to improve his business and rent a small store in the future to sell food.

Adham took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his business to sell. By taking this loan, Adham will be able to improve his business and increase his sales. 

Adham appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell for his business

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es una mujer de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de cd’s, DVD’s y bluray.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, alegre, amable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en un mercado en la zona de ‘Irpavi’ que es un barrio de la zona sur, aquí se encuentra el cine más grande de la ciudad, la iglesia castrense, la universidad militar y la unidad educativa del ejército, de clima templado y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 12-18 grados centígrados.
Daniela es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, ojos obscuros, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es al Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la venta de refrescos y su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en casa de sus suegros que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el comercio de cd’s de música y películas en DVD y bluray, el comercio que realiza es constante porque por la zona existen varios colegios y los jóvenes son sus mayores clientes que compran música y películas de todo tipo. “me inicie trabajando en una empresa, manejando el equipo copiador, luego me retire e inicie mi negocio…” comenta. Su sueño es tener otro negocio en la zona central, ella desea amoblar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y vitrinas, donde pueda exponer su mercadería. Este es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Daniela solicita un préstamo para amoblar su negocio mejorando sus ventas para el beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Daniela is a 24-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 6-year-old son. She works selling CD's, DVD's, and blu-ray discs. Daniela is a good mother, entrepreneurial, friendly, kind, responsible, and hardworking. She carries out her business in the market in a zone called "Irpavi," which is a neighborhood in the southern zone. The biggest cinema in the city is located there, as well as the military church, the military university, and the educational unit of the army. This area has a temperate and dry climate, with temperatures that vary during the day between 12-18 degrees Celsius. Daniela's native language is Aymará, which she speaks around her family, though she speaks Spanish outside of her home, especially in her business. 

Daniela shares her life with her husband, who makes a living selling soft drinks, and her son who studies in the local school. They live in Daniela's mother and father-in-law's house, where they have potable water, electricity, and a sewage system. In her business, Daniela sells CD's, movies on DVD and blu-ray. Her business is consistent because there are several high schools in the area. Young people are her biggest clients buying all kinds of movies and music. "I started out working in a business, making copies, then I quit and started my own business," she said. 

Daniela's dream is to have another business in the central region. She hopes to furnish her business, buying tables and display cases on which she can show her merchandise. This is Daniela's first loan cycle with the institution in her first year of working independently. For these reasons Daniela is requesting a loan: to furnish her business and improve her sales, which will benefit her family.

loans.use: to furnish her business, improving her sales to benefit her family.

loans.name: Sokning

texts.en:
Sokning, 19, comes from Kampong Cham, a province of Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of one little child. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small piece of farmland located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice, which she sells to the local dealers. She has been in this type of business for five years so far. On average, she can earn an income of USD 2.50 per day.

In this harvesting season, she would like to have some people with a harvesting machine to assist her in harvesting her crop, yet she doesn't have sufficient money to do so. Therefore, she would like to apply for a Kiva loan to pay for this rice harvesting service. She would like to thank all of the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for a rice harvesting service

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es: Maria de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de comida,  su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, verduras, arroz, frijoles, refrescos, huevos, entre otras cosas que necesita para la elaboración de los alimentos y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old, she lives in her own house with her family.

She has made a living selling food for 5 years now. Her business is located in her house in a very busy area and she has many customers. With what she earns from her sales, she manages to get by.

She requests a loan to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, rice, beans, eggs and soft drinks among other things she needs to prepare her dishes so that she can go on with this job that allows her to make good profits.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, rice, beans, eggs and soft drinks among other things

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Due to the hardships of living, Zenaida has been engaged in a vegetable vending business to help her husband gain income. 

She aims to further improve this business in order to gain a higher profit to provide the necessities of her family. 

Due to capital insufficiency, she is asking for an additional PHP 15,000 to buy more beans, seeds, onions, garlic, ginger, eggplant and tomatoes to resell in the local community. 

Being a patient and hardworking mother, she believes that someday she will make her business more viable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more beans, seeds, onions, garlic, ginger, eggplant and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Glory Jean

texts.en:
Glory Jean signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (variety) store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

She was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Amador

texts.en:
Amado is thankful that he was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which he used to purchase barrels of fish to sell at the town market. Through his earnings he is able to send his children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

He would now like to apply for a 17,000 PHP loan which he will use to buy various kinds of fish from a wholesaler; he will sell them at retail. He is encouraged by a good turnout of his sales. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him, for it will surely help cover their daily needs and the schooling of his children. 

Amado dreams of having a vehicle of his own to easily transport his fish from the fish port to the town market. He prays for healthy food, and to be more successful in his business to give his children the best education possible. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which he studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fish to be sold at the market.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is from the village of Poblacion, Sindangan, in the Philippines. She is 59 years old and is married. 

Ma. Fe owns and manages a retail store business, operating a retail store selling shoes, sandals, bags and school supplies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 11 years, and earns a good income each month, enabling her to provide for the needs of her family. Ma. Fe, also owns a photocopier machine for additional earnings. 

In 2012, Ma. Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid her previous loans from PMPC. 

Ma. Fe  is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase an additional inventory of various used items to sell. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of various used items to sell

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie 36 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with two school age children. She has been selling eggplants to her neighbors that she harvested from her garden. 

She requested a loan to buy bags of fertilizer to get more produce to sell. 

She has been a member of PMPC for two years. 

In the future, Jessie wants to be successful in her business for her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia makes a good living with every part of her coconut farm in Oroquieta, in the Philippines. This is her means of supporting her family. Gaudencia has been able to provide for her family doing this type of work for more than a decade after she was widowed. 

Now she wishes to plant a good variety of bananas on the coconut farm for additional farm yield. However, Gaudencia is in need of working capital. 

She presented her project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP in order to pay for the labor to prepare and plant banana seedlings. 

Gaudencia hopes to increase her farm's yield and be able to save enough for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for the labor for the preparation and planting of banana seedlings

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marietta works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income.  Marietta is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to  purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. from her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Marietta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 59 years old and married. She has 13 children, one of whom is in school.

Elena is in the agricultural business in the Philippines, where she raises pigs. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Elena has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Shirley works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Shirley is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 41 years old and a widowed woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Jessica has a buy and sell root crops business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more root crops to sell.

Jessica has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jessica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more root crops to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 59 years old now. She has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy frozen foods to sell. She has been in this business for 34 years. 

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear.  Editha is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 25 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between one and five years. One of them goes to school.
