She owns a shop and she has been running this shop for the past two years while her husband is a motorcyclist.With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, salt, rice and washing soap to sell.Claudine would like to improve her standard of living with the profits she hopes to make. In the future she wishes to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more soap, salt, Colgate and rice to resell.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marciana works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Marciana is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marciana has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva Lenders, meet Caroline. Caroline is a smallholder mixed farmer from Terige, a village in the North Rift area of Kenya. She has been blessed with a lovely family. She has been a farmer for five years, producing milk, eggs and maize for both consumption and sale. Caroline's entrepreneurial spirit extends outside agriculture: She is involved in other personal businesses for extra income.

Caroline is very ambitious. She enjoys making more and more returns but lack of adequate capital puts her on a leash. It is for this reason that she is turning to Kiva lenders for a loan. Caroline is seeking KES 30,000 to purchase a cow. With more cows, she will be able to utilize the pasture on her farm and increase milk production.

Your loan will help Caroline to pull herself out of poverty through constantly growing her asset base. The cow you will finance will reproduce, and with time Caroline will produce many litres of milk and other dairy products. This improvement in her business will enable her to realize profits that are currently cut due to the high cost of inputs. It will impact the rest of her family in a very meaningful way.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Pierre Celestin

texts.en: Pierre Celestin is 47 years old. He is married with four children aged between 9 and 17 years. His wife is a teacher. He is an artist and has been in business for seven years. With the loan, he would like to buy more scissors and paints to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.In the future, he aims to earn at least 70,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more scissors and paints to sell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 26 years old. She is married with two children, aged 3 and 7 years, and they both go to school. Her husband is a businessman. She owns a shop which has been running for the past two years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy rice, sugar and salt, and maize flour to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and salt to resell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  

Melanie is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to  buy additional items like pants, t-shirts, dress and etc. for her buy and sell ready to wear business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like pants, t-shirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Manisura

texts.en: Manisura is 26 years old, married with two children aged 1 and 6 years old, one of whom goes to school. She sells clothes and has been in business for one year. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en: Marie Louise, aged 40, is married with three children aged between 17 and 22 years. They all go to school. She sells clothes and has been in business for eight years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy bedsheets and bed covers to sell. With the profits from the business, she would like to increase her business and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy bedsheets and bed covers to sell.

loans.name: Isabelle

texts.en: Isabelle, aged 24, is not yet married. She sells clothes and has been in business for four years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more women's clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings. In future, she aims to earn at least 15000 per month.

loans.use: to buy more women clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elia

texts.en:
Elia is 30 years old and lives in Lui town in the eastern part of South Sudan. 

Elia runs a big shop in Lui town. A loan of 600 SSP will help Elia to buy a greater amount of different types of clothing to stock his shop and sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy good quality new clothing to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Precious Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 32 years old and a mother of three children. Rehema owns a grocery that she depends on for the provision of her family's basic needs and other necessities. Despite owning a grocery, she still finds it difficult to pay school fees for her children. As such, she is requesting this loan in order for her to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to see her children excel up to the university level and plans to construct a better house for her family.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a new client with the institution who is applying for a loan of UGX 1,500,000. He is aged 50 years and married with four children with a stable family. His main source of income is agriculture, especially matooke and coffee. He is also a primary school teacher who gets additional income to sustain himself and his family. He has been waiting to expand his agricultural activity but capital has been a limiting factor. He hopes that with this loan facility he will help him buy bananas in bulk and therefore increase his income after sales. He thanks Ugafode for that financial support and he looks forward to more continued support.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Angelika

texts.en:
Angelika is a fifty-year-old hardworking married woman with ten children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She operates a general store and has been in that business for ten years, from which she has managed to pay school fees for her children and look after her family. 

Angelika dreams of educating her children. She is faced with limited capital and weather changes as her main challenges. 

She is requesting money to buy sugar, sodas, water, cooking oil and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sodas, water, cooking oil and salt to sell.

loans.name: Ira

texts.en:
Ira is 49-year-old married woman. She lives in the small village of Zugdidi district with her husband and 16-year-old son. 

Ira is involved in agricultural activities. Specifically, she trades nut and dairy products. The family grows nuts on their agricultural land, and sells the harvest regularly. 

Ira decided to start an additional business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 500 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase food products and will sell them from home. 

This will give Ira a chance to increase her income in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to begin selling food products

loans.name: Turdiniso

texts.ru: Турдинисо проживает на районе под названием Вахш. Турдинисо 44 лет. Она замужем мать четверых детей. У нее 2 дочери и 2 сыновей. Турдинисо проживает вместе со своей семьей. Она в родном районе занимается земледелием. Ей в работе помогает муж и дочери. Она готовить почву, обрабатывает с минеральными удобрениями и сажает урожай. В этом году Турдинисо приобрести минеральные удобрения и семян овощей, без которых она не сможет закончить посев и собрать урожай на следующем сезоне. Она очень надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Turdiniso lives in the Vakhsh district. She is 44 years old, married and a mother of four children. She has 2 daughters and 2 sons. Turdiniso lives together with her family. She is involved in farming in her native district. Her husband and daughters help her with the work. She prepares the soil, treats it with mineral fertilizers and plants the crops. This year Turdiniso needs to buy mineral fertilizers and vegetable seeds, without which she would not be able to complete her sowing and gather a harvest next season. She really hopes for Your help.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Maty

texts.en:
Maty is a 22-year-old single university student who is from the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in accounting; she is in her second year. Her father is a construction foreman, and her mother makes some income from selling porridge and Khmer noodles. 

Maty is requesting a loan because she is short of finances to pay her tuition fees from the second to the fourth year. 

This loan will help her have enough finances to earn a bachelor’s degree. 

Her dream after graduation is to work in any company or institution.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Shosanam

texts.ru: Шосанам 34 летняя женщина. Она жительница района Джоми. Шосанам замужем и имеет одного сына. Шосанам имеет магазин, где продает детскую одежду, косметику и на другую половину магазина продает продукты питания в том числе и фрукты. Этой деятельностью она занята уже более 5 лет. Ей в работе помогает муж. Шосанам хочет расширить деятельность. Она берет кредит для купли ассортимента товаров, продуктов, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. С помощью Вашего кредита  она может улучшить бизнес и привлечь больше клиентов.
texts.en: Shosanam is a 34-year-old woman. She is a resident of the Jomi district. Shosanam is married and has one son. Shosanam has a store, where she sells children's clothing, cosmetics and food products, including fruits, at the other half of the store. She has been involved in this business for over 5 years. Her husband helps her with this work. Shosanam wants to expand her business. She is requesting this loan to buy a selection of goods and products in order to increase her goods turnover. With the help of Your loan, she will be able to improve her business and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a selection of goods and products in order to increase her goods turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bicycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for his transport business.

loans.name: Abdel Rahman

texts.en:
Abdel Rahman is a 27-year-old single man from Deir El Balah. He works in distributing clean water for the homes using his rickshaw. 

He wants to improve his business and buy a car in the future for distributing water.

Abdel took a USD 1,746 Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to do some maintenance on his rickshaw and also to buy a new water tank. 

By taking this loan, Abdel will be able to improve his business and increase his sales. He appears in the photo taken while he was working.

loans.use: to do some maintenance on his rickshaw and also to buy a new water tank.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 35-year-old married man from Khanyounis. He is a father of three kids; two sons and one daughter. 

Anwar works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also works in transferring goods from the wholesalers to the local traders using his old rickshaw.

Anwar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw instead of the old one. 

By taking this loan, Anwar will be able to improve his business and increase his productivity.

Anwar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom, 46, is a married woman and lives in a small community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has only one child.

To make a living and support her family, she has been a farmer for almost thirty years. She manages and operates a farm on a small piece of land that is located near her house. She grows cassava and sells her harvest to local dealers. On average she can make 3 USD a day.

The land she owns now is small in area, and she would like to enlarge it. But as she cannot afford to do so herself, she is applying for a 1,100 USD loan to buy a plot of farmland on which to grow rice. She hopes this additional farmland will bring her more money and so help to improve her living conditions. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland on which to grow rice.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la venta de ropa y elaboración de serigrafía en ropa desde hace 12 años, tiene clientes ya establecidos que lo buscan por la calidad de sus productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa y pintura de diversos colores para elaborar la serigrafía y así seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rodolfo, 63, lives in his own house with his wife and child.  He has been selling clothing and silk screening clothing for 12 years. He now has established customers who seek him out for the quality of his products and the good prices, and he is able to pay for some of his home’s expenses with what he makes from his sales. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase clothing and inks in various colors for silk screening, and in this way, continue with his work in order to have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, and inks in various colors.

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Norn, 33, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has only one child who is currently in school. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming process, primarily growing rice and selling her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in the market. So far, she has been in this business for 15 years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 5.00 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from KIVA now to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seeds and insecticides.  

She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Julia Del Rosario

texts.es: Julia de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar ella se dedica desde hace 25 años a la venta de panes con pollo su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Julia está solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de panes, pollos, verduras, mayonesa, mostaza y demás ingredientes que utiliza para hacer sus alimentos y así poder continuar con su trabajo para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Julia, 60, lives in her own home with her family.  For twenty-five years, she has been selling “panes con pollo” [a traditional Salvadoran chicken dish].  Her business is located in the town market, and she manages to pay some household expenses with her sales.  Julia is requesting a loan from Integral to purchase bread, chicken, vegetables, mayonnaise, mustard, and other ingredients used in making her food.  In this way, she will be able to continue with her job and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase bread, chicken, vegetables, mayonnaise, mustard, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Aileen works hard to support her family.

Aileen has a meat shop business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Aileen is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy meat to sell in the market.

Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell in the market

loans.name: Denyse

texts.en: Denyse is 28 years old and not yet married. She rents clothes and has been in business for one year. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for the bridegroom to rent. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the bridegroom to rent.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is 28 years old, married with three children aged between 4 and 10 years. They all go to school. He owns a salon and has been in a business for two years. With the loan requested, he would like to buy more materials such as lotions, combs and machines for using them in salon. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as lotions, combs and machines to sell.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 58 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in Zugdidi district, West Georgia. Her husband is unemployed. 

In spite of having a higher education, Marine is not able to work and have a regular salary because there is a high unemployment rate in the region. Marine decided to sell used clothes and generate income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,500 USD. 

With the received credit, she will purchase a stock of used clothes and will sell them among her neighbors, as well as in different villages. Marine is a very hardworking woman, and very motivated to generate income. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin selling used clothes

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Amalia is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like garments, etc. for her tailoring business.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like garments, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy steel and a welding machine for his business.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She runs a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income by operating a general store. 

Amalia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Amalia has sustained her business activities with five previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream; to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food production.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is 28 years old. She lives with her parents in the Zugdidi district. Her family runs an animal husbandry business. They have cows and produce dairy products to sell. 

Maka's parents receive a retirement pension from the government and Maka does her best to help her parents and increase her family income. 

Maka decided to start her own business selling clothing. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1700 GEL. Maka will purchase clothes and resell her stock at a marked up price. 

Maka thinks her business will be profitable and that she will increase her family income.

loans.use: to begin trade clothes.

loans.name: David

texts.en: This is David, a small scale farmer. He is married with two children. He has been farming potatoes and he desires to expand his business and grow more potatoes. He sells his produce in his local market and with his income he manages to take care of his family plus educate his children. He farms together with the wife who takes care of the family dairy cattle. With the KIVA Loan he will be able to buy pesticides and fertilisers that will help improve his crop yield.

loans.use: to pay for pesticides and fertilisers for his crops

loans.name: Nakuru East Mulembe Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Fredric, a member of Nakuru East Mulembe Self Help Group. He is thirty seven years old, married and has four children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

Fredric runs a dry cleaning business. With the training he got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he has been able to commercialize his cleaning business and now able to get more profits. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to service his machine and buy more detergents to use in the business thus satisfy his customers. This will improve his income and, hence, he will be in a position to educate his children and provide for his family's needs.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy dry cleaning detergents and pay for service of a dry cleaning machine.

loans.name: Boymat

texts.ru:
Боймат мужчина 40 лет, женат, отец четверых детей. С раннего возраста Боймат трудился на поле, помогал родителям ухаживать за домашним скотом, выращивал овощи и фрукты. В 18 лет после женитьбы Боймат решил продолжить дело отца и начал заниматься животноводством. Ему приходилось трудно, потому что ему нужно было обеспечивать и свою семью, и пожилых родителей. Ему помогает жена во всех его делах. Сейчас у Боймата на участке земли находятся 2 коровы и пять баранов, за которыми он ухаживает.
Боймат планирует купить два молодых барана,но ему не хватает денег. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Он благодарен  за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Boymat is 40 years old, married, and the father of four children.  Since his youth, he has been working as a farmer (growing fruits and vegetables) and helping his parents to take care of the livestock.  Eighteen years after he got married, Boymat has now decided to continue his father's business and to start his own animal husbandry business.  Boymat has had some difficult times, because he has had to provide for his family and also take care of his elderly parents.  His wife helps him with everything.  Boymat currently owns and takes care of two cows and five sheep.  He is planning to buy two lambs, but he doesn't have enough money for this purchase.  For this reason, he has requested financial assistance from MDO Arvand.  He thanks you in advance for your financial support.

loans.use: to increase his livestock headcount.

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en:
Frederick is a pastor at Efforf Baptist Church on Weaver St. He hopes selling SE4ALL products like
the CH-2300 clean cookstoves  will be very profitable and add to the success of the church.														
The Kiva loan allows him to obtain this SE4ALL product to sell and make a profit, allowing him to easily repay the loan.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 28 years old married man, from the Tsalka district. He lives with his wife, who has a stable job and gets a 300 GEL monthly salary. 

Giorgi was unable to find stable work and started working as a private driver. Also he works on his family owned agricultural land, where he cultivates potatoes and sells it seasonally. 

He does hard work to make his family more financially stable.

Giorgi sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts was unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

The Start Up program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables people like Giorgi to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved. He will receive a loan of 3000 GEL to renovate a business space and then rent it at a good price.
 
This new business will help stabilize his family's income and improve their living conditions. Giorgi relies on the goodwill of lenders and will truly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to renovate a business space and rent it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Bibihol

texts.ru: Это Бибихол. Она вместе семьей проживает в районе Джоми. У Бибихол трое детей в возрасте 25, 24 и 20 лет. Бибихол ответственная и серьезная женщина. Она 10 лет своей жизни занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Ей в работе помогает муж и дети. Они является главными помощниками Бибихол. Ей надо готовить землю для нового посева урожая, купить семена и минеральные удобрения. Но так как  у Бибихол нет достаточных денег, чтобы приобрести минеральные удобрения, она обратилась за кредитом. Это кредит поможет ей во время провести новый посев и получить урожай.  Она ждет Вашу поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Bibihol lives with her family in the Jomi district of Tajikistan.  She has three children who are 25, 24 and 20 years old.  Bibihol is a responsible and serious woman.  She has been involved in crop farming for the past 10 years.  Her husband and children work with her and are her main source of help.  Bibihol needs to prepare her land toward the next planting season and she wants to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.  However, she doesn't have enough money to buy mineral fertilizers and, for this reason,  she has applied for a loan.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to sow her land on time and get a good harvest.  She is awaiting your support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Nde

texts.en:
He is married with four children, and the family lives in a four-room-house in Bamenda, in the North West region of Cameroon. He has faced a lot of problems in his life, including accidents, sickness, dropping out of school due to inadequate finances, and theft.

He is very optimistic that the loan will go to buy piglets, goat, feed, and medicine for the pigs. Also he will repair his pigsty. With the new loan, his work would be a success since he has been doing it for some time now and has been very successful. He has perfect knowledge of the techniques, as well as heavy special orders from his steady customers.

With the profit made from this loan, he intends to expand the size of the business by buying more piglets, help the community to provide manure for farming, and provide a ready market for pork meat. He prefers a loan from Ghape because it has lower interest rates, and the interval of repayment is really encouraging and so UN-stressful, not to mention the non-financial services offered, which include loan management and social-life issues.

loans.use: To buy piglets, goats, and feed, also extend pigsty

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a engine for his rickshaw.

loans.name: Raynakhon

texts.ru: Райнахон 60 летняя жительница района Хуросон. У нее не очень большая семья. Муж, 2 сыновей и 1 дочка. Старшием сыновьям 30 и 22 года, они взрослые и работаю. Дочка учится в университете. Райнахон преподает в школе русский язык в уже 25 лет. Она решила сменить деятельность. Райнахон хочет начать новый бизнес. У нее есть торговая точка, но не имеет товара. Она берет кредит, чтобы купить авто запчасти. Из-за нехватки денежных средств Райнахон обратилась за кредитом. Это кредит поможет ей начать новый бизнес. Райнахон очень нужно Ваша помощь. Помогите Райнахон начать бизнес.
texts.en: Raynakhon is 60 years old and she lives in the Khuroson district of Tajikistan.  Her family is not that large, consisting of herself, her husband, two sons and one daughter.  Her sons are 30 and 22 years old.  Her daughter is a university student.  Raynakhon has been teaching Russian in a school for 25 years already, but she has now decided to do something else.  She wants to start her own business.  She already has a retail outlet, but no merchandise yet.  She is taking a loan to buy auto spare parts.  This loan is important to her because she doesn't have enough money to start her new business.  She really needs your help.  Please help her start her new business.

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts and start a new business.

loans.name: Farah Aley Group

texts.en:
Sawsan (center of photo) is the featured borrower for the Farah Aley Group. She decided to partner with friends to take out an Al Majmoua loan. They work hard to develop their businesses and lives at the same time.

Sawsan is a 39-year-old married mother with three children. She started working as a cosmetics saleswoman 14 years ago to help raise money for her family.

Sawsan is a hard working, ambitious lady who is trying desperately to develop her business. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a new collection of customer requested cosmetics.

Amani is on the left of the photo and Nabila is the lady on the right.

loans.use: to increase her cosmetics merchandise.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is a 28-years-old married man from Deir El Balah. He is a father for one son. 

He transfers goods from wholesalers to local traders using his old rickshaw.

Osama took a loan from FATEN to buy a new rickshaw.

Osama hopes to improve his business and increase his productivity.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw.

loans.name: Al Mahabba 1 Group

texts.en:
Joumana is the featured borrower of Al Mahabba 1 group. She got with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they are neighbors and friends and work hard to develop their businesses and families living standards.

Joumana is a 36-year-old married mother of three who has run her grocery store and agriculture business for seven years. Her income is on the rise. She is the second lady from the far left side of the picture. Her loan will pay for her children's school tuition fees, to make sure they benefit from the best education and a brighter future.

As for the other group members, Layla (married mother of three) the second from the right, and Aida (married mother of two) the first at the far left side of the picture, also requested loans to pay for their children's school tuition fees. While Khadija, the first lady at the far right side of the picture, is a 25-year-old married mother of one child. She works as a tutor from her house, and acquired a loan to make necessary repairs to her house especially, after the hard winter season they are experiencing in their region.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Edinah

texts.en:
Edinah is 41 years old, married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with two children. She has been running a retail shop in Nakuru town and it has been profitable since the income she makes helps her to provide for her family's needs and also buy more retail goods.

She will use the loan to buy more stock of retail goods like sugar, wheat flour, and soft drinks to sell and increase her income which will help her to pay school fees for her children.

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and she paid the previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to grow her business, be prosperous, and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar, wheat flour and soft drinks for sell and increase her income which will enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 52 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with three adult-age children.

She has a food stall near the school area and has had this business for twenty years. She requested a loan to restock her stall with basic commodities like junk foods and candies to sell.

She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Alicia hopes to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to restock her stall with basic commodities like junk foods and candies.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family.

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of adding more head of pigs for commercial sale, she thought of creating a bigger pigpen for swine production.

Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cows and goats for rearing and later sell at a profit which will enable him to educate his children.

loans.name: Nadupoi

texts.en:
Nadupoi is 55 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children. She has been rearing livestock. She has been in this business for 14 years and it has been profitable. 

She plans to use this loan to buy cows and goats for rearing. This will enable her to get milk for sell and also supply goats to butchery shops in the area. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her seventh loan term from Vision Fund Kenya and she paid back his previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to grow her business, be prosperous and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy cows and goats for rearing and get milk to customers and goat to butchery shops.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita, 35, is a married woman with seven children. Five attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cristita has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fruit to sell in her stall.

Cristita has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 47 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, beverages, etc.

Elena has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income by buying and selling charcoal.

Elena aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs and beverages.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 55 years old and a widow with six children, one of whom is in school. For the past twenty years she has worked hard running a sari-sari, or general store in the Philippines.

Thelma is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock such as bread, canned goods, eggs and milk to sell in her store. She is working to save enough money to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en: While many young people in Africa dream of getting well-paying jobs, Erick, from the Nyamira area of Kenya, has never secured one and has opted to be a smallholder farmer. He decided that he will be independent and contribute to his community by practicing mixed farming. Erick is blessed with two beautiful children whom he refers to as his "heart beat.” His primary sources of income are milk and poultry farming, as well as some personal business that he does to supplement his meager income (Donkey business). Deciding to practice poultry farming for Erick was not difficult. “I was brought up with chickens raised by my grandfather and grandmother,” Erick said. “It is in my blood.” For the past five years, Erick has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and he wants to increase his poultry, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds. He is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates business opportunity for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Erick is going to make more income that will enable him to take care of his family's expenses. As times keep getting harder, Erick is doing all he can do to ensure that his family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 35-year-old hardworking single woman with three children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. She mines and sells crude salt and owns a salt pan; she has been in that business for five years. She gets additional income from motorcycle transport, rentals and also owns a salt pan. She has a dream of educating her children, though she is faced with the challenge of weather changes that affect the water levels hence reducing the salt levels, especially during the rainy season salt disolves and they produce more salt in dry seoson. Lydia is looking for financial support so that she can raise her children and provide them with basic needs. Lydia needs a loan to buy crude salt from other salt  miners to sell.  

NB She buys from other salt processors and also owns her own salt pan.

loans.use: to buy crude salt  from other salt  miners to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a forty-one-year-old hardworking married man with three children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. For eleven years, Patrick has been running a retail shop selling general merchandise and textiles in order to support his family since his salary was so low and unreliable. He earns additional income from farming and bricklaying. Price fluctuations and ever-changing customer preferences are his major challenges.

Patrick has a dream of owning a modern boutique. Like most good fathers, he desires to educate his children up to the university level and build a commercial house. Patrick intends to use the loan to buy sand, cement, and bricks to construct his commercial house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and bricks to construct his commercial house.

loans.name: Assoupi

texts.fr: Assoupi est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans qui vit à Adamavo avec ses quatre enfants. Assoupi est une femme entreprenante qui vend du jus préparé à l’aide du sucre grillé. Assoupi parcoure les marchés, les établissements scolaires et les quartiers de son environ pour vendre du jus à ses clients. Pour ne pas perdre la confiance de ses consommateurs, Assoupi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché d’Akodessewa. Assoupi désire ce prêt pour financer l’achat du sac de sucre pour la préparation de son jus.
texts.en:
Assoupi is 30 years old, married, and lives in Adamavo with her four children. She is an entrepreneur who sells juice made with grilled sugar. 

Assoupi visits markets, schools, and her surrounding neighborhoods to sell the juice to her customers. So as not to lose the confidence of her customers, Assoupi procures [ingredients] once a month at the Akodessewa market. 

Assoupi wishes to have this loan to finance the purchase of a sac of sugar needed to make her juice.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace her husband's auto-rickshaw's body.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 44 ans, Afi est une femme mariée et vit à Mayakopé avec ses trois enfants à sa charge. Afi parcoure les marchés de la ville où elle vend des savons préparés à l’aide de la soude à ses différents clients. Son activité lui est rentable et elle s’approvisionne au marché d’Akodessewa une fois par mois afin de ne pas manquer de stock. Afi veut acheter de la soude et de l'acide pour la préparation du savon et nécessite ce crédit pour atteindre son objectif  et favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afi is 44 years old, married, and lives in Mayakopé with her three dependent children. 

Afi wanders the city’s markets where she sells soap made with caustic soda to her various clients. Her business is profitable and she buys her supplies in the Akodessewa market once a month so that she does not run out of stock. Afi would like to buy caustic soda and the other ingredients she needs for soap. 

She needs this loan to achieve her goal and to support her children’s education

loans.use: to buy 4kg of soda and two boxes of acid

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a hardworking man who operates a drug shop in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with two children ranging in age from two to four years. 

Paul hopes to develop and expand the drug shop into a pharmacy. He will use the loan to buy more drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more drugs to sell in his drug shop.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 24 years old, married and having an only child aged 3 years old. Her husband works as a driver before, earning only PhP 300 - 400 per day which could hardly suffice for their family's most basic needs. 

In order to help her husband earn their keep, Analiza took consigned dried shrimps and fish from a friend and sold it to her community. In the beginning, she was entrusted with 100 kilos of dried shrimps and fish and sold it at PhP 70 per kilo which she is able to sell out at PhP 100 per kilo in a week's time. On her first week of sales, Analiza was able to gain a net of PhP 3,000, of which she used PhP 1,000 as initial capital to directly buy dried shrimps and fish from her friend's suppliers. With this important step, Analiza is able to have a net of PhP 50 per kilo compared to only PhP 30 per kilo under consignment terms. 

Analiza came to know of SEED through a neighbor and was invited to attend an orientation seminar. She decided to try availing a loan to finance the demanded volume increase of the dried shrimps and fish she is selling. Analiza consequently availed a first loan which helped her to increase her stocks and sales. Now, Analiza was able to deliver dried shrimp and fish not only in their community market but also to other neighboring town markets. From this, her income also grew and she was able to gain a net income of PhP 15,000 a week. With the improved business and income, Analiza's husband resigned from his job and helped her instead in the business by taking charge of delivery of goods. 

Analiza, being a mother and having a kind heart, and through the improvements in her business over time was able to employs a helper who repacks the dried shrimps and fish for retail selling. Her helper is a neighbor who is also widow with 2 children to support. 

Today, Analiza is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 50,000 to buy 10 sacks of dried anchovies and 3 sacks of dried shrimps to fill the orders of her customers. With this she is confident of further increasing her income and plans to provide employment and livelihood opportunities to other unemployed neighbors in the community. She says that with increased volume of inventories, she will be needing helpers for repacking as well as be able to offer consignment to other neighbors for their extra income.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of dried anchovies and 3 sacks of dried shrimps to fill the orders of her customers

loans.name: Jamilah

texts.en:
Jamilah is 32 years old with 4 children in which the oldest is 12 and the youngest is 6 mo’s old. Her husband Abal is an ambulant food vendor. They used to have an eatery in the front of their house but because the place is own by the government, they are force to leave their place by demolition and live with their relative in Cavite. They tried to sell food like lunch and breakfast but there were few customers because the location is remote. With their children in schooling and daily expenses they had difficulty in budgeting their money. So they decided to rent a house near the place they used to live and start again their business. Using the money they save amounting to PhP 2,000 they cook and vend food in the area which gains a net of PhP 500 a day. She wanted to open an eatery in front of the house to increase their income but they have no capital.

Jamilah came to know SEED from a friend who is also a member and joined SEED training and skills program. Her first loan amounting to PhP 5,000 bought meats and vegetables and other seasonings needed for cooking breakfast and lunch. Half of the menu are displayed in the front of their house while half of it is ambulated by her husband and with their combined effort they gain a net of PhP 1,500 daily.

Jamilah now has a small sari-sari store (small grocery store) in addition to her eatery. The revenue helps paid the bills and save a little for the continuing education of her children. She still wanted to expand her mini grocery store and eatery and sell meryenda (snack, dinner) so she may increase her income.

Jamilah is requesting a re-loan amounting to PhP 25,000 to 5 kilos of pork, 5 kilos of chicken and other ingredients to cook meryenda (snack) and buy coffee, snack foods, candies for her store, to fill the growing demand of her customers.
Jamilah still attending orientation and training skill because she wanted to open an eatery near a market in their area. Where the potential of gaining more customers and increasing her income is higher.

loans.use: To buy 5 kilos of pork, 5 kilos of chicken and vegetables to cook meryenda (snack) and coffee, snack foods, candies for her sari sari store (small grocery store)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Esther, fifty-two years old and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

Esther operates a food kiosk, where she sells beverages and meals. Having gone through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's training in enterprise development and financial management she is now able to manage her business well. 

She is borrowing a loan to expand her business by buying wheat flour, sugar, and more stock of soft drinks such as soda. This will ensure she supplies a variety of foods and thus can meet her customers' demand. She looks forward to more income that she will use to support her children's education and provide family basic needs.

She is happy with Kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, sugar, and soft drinks such as sodas for food kiosks.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 48 years old, a widow with 3 children ages 24, 23 and 20 years old.  Her husband a tricycle driver died 9 yrs ago leaving her 3 children to support. She started to sell school supply right after her husband died, using the money she carefully saved from her husband income when hes still alive, amounting to PhP 2,000. She at first sell notebooks, pencils, ball pens, erasers papers and bond papers which yield a net of  PhP 250 daily and since she knew how to sew she bought used fabrics by 50 per kilos sew small rugs and sell it by 2 pesos per rug which gains her a net of PhP 150 daily. Though the business helps her with her daily expenses it’s not enough for the education of her children. 

In 2008 Amelia came to know SEED because her neighbor whom is also a member invited her to attend an orientation. She joined the business and skills training and other programs. Her first loan amounting to PhP 3,000 bought her additional supplies like sharpeners, pencil boxes, pins, crayons and to increase number of items she have in which gain her more students customer for the variety of items she sells.

Through a series of loans Amelia store became a sari sari store (general store) and school supply store and gaining a net of PhP 400 to 500 daily. Also her rug making business flourish and she has now customer ordering in bulk of her rugs gaining an income of PhP 2,000 a week. The revenue of the income helps them in their daily expenses and her children to finish their education in public colleges.

Amelia still has one more child in college and she wanted to expand her store to generate more income and help with their expenses, though her 2 children are willing to help, she doesn't want to oblige her children to help her in her expenses.

She now requesting for a re-loan amounting to PhP 30,000 to buy 1 sack of rice, 3 cases of soft drinks, 3 boxes of canned goods, 2 tray of salted eggs, biscuits and soaps for her sari sari store (general store) and to buy used fabric for her rug making business. The additional items will help increase her income because of the new items she sells to her customers which are their daily needs. 

Amelia is still active in attending SEED training and seminars. She wanted to maintain her growing business so that she can save not just for the education of her youngest but also for her old age.

loans.use: To buy papers, ballpens, pencils, bond papers, toys, sack of coals, softdrinks, shampoo and noodles as an additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Bernandita

texts.en:
Bernandita is 62 years old, married and with 4 children. The oldest is 34 and the youngest is 19 years old. Her husband is a retired Philippine Navy, now working as a repairman in his own electrical appliances repair shop. Bernandita used to have a sari-sari (small grocery store) store back in their hometown, but later closed it when they moved in Manila for her husband's work re-assignment. 

At that time,  with all her children still attending school and with the house rent and other expenses, her husband's salary is not enough. To help her husband, she decided to build a sari-sari store in front of their rented house. She also brought processed and frozen meat goods (hotdogs, sausages and sweetened pork meat) in her husband's workplace and sold it to her husband's co-workers where she earns a net of PhP 300-400 daily. Because of the flourishing income, she wanted to expand her business but the lack of capital prevents her from doing so.

Bernandita came to know SEED from a friend whom is also a member and invited her to attend an orientation. Her first loan amounting to Php 5,000 were invested on additional stocks (canned goods, laundry powders, soft drinks, coffee, snack foods and additional frozen goods (hotdogs, sausages, preserved sweetened pork meat. 

Through a series of loan, Bernandita's business improved. She was able to expand her store's place to hold much larger stocks. She now has 1 tricycle with a hired driver and a new freezer for her processed frozen goods. She also bought another motorcycle and most of all, with the revenue of her income she was able to help finance her children education until 3 of them graduated in college. Now at the age of 62, she still has 1 child in college, though her husband received pension from his former job, it’s still not enough to cover the education of her child and their expenses. She does not want to oblige her other children to help them with their expenses.

Now Bernandita is requesting for aloan in the amount of PhP 30,000 to buy additional stocks (soft drinks, sack of rice, and prepaid load for cell phone) for her store which are demanded by customers. Partly, she also plans to buy materials for fabricating the sidecar of the motorcycle she has just recently availed. With the sidecar, the motorcycle can be converted for public transport which will bring Bernandita and her family extra income.

Bernandita is still active in participating SEED programs and training because she wanted to expand her store for the continuing  education of her youngest child and saves enough for their health and old age.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sack of rice, and prepaid load for cell phone which are demanded from her store and partly to buy materials for fabricating a sidecar for her motorcycle to be used as public transport service

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Afiwa est une mère de trois enfants qui vit à Adamavo. Afiwa est veuve et travaille activement pour assurer un bon avenir à ses enfants. Afiwa prépare de la bouillie faite à base du maïs et la commercialise  dans une école du quartier  pour tirer le gain nécessaire à leur survie. Afiwa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché d’Akodessewa. Afiwa demande ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de maïs et de sucre pour la cuisson de sa bouillie et favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants grâce au bénéfice tiré.
texts.en:
Afiwa is a mother of three children and lives in Adamavo. She is a widow and works hard to ensure a good future for her children. 

Assiba makes corn porridge and sells it in a local school to earn a living. 

She procures her ingredients four times a month from a market in Akodessewa. She is asking for a loan to buy sacs of corn and some sugar for making corn porridge.

Thanks to the earnings [from this work], she will promote her children's education.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of corn and 10 bowls of sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and a toilet in their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Andy

texts.en:
Andy is 41 years old with 3 children ages 22, 21 and 20. Her wife Nanette is a secretary in an office. He drive their own van as a public vehicle for a living, though he gain a net of PhP 400-550 a day in driving it’s still not enough with the children in schooling and their daily expenses. In order increase his income as main provider in the family he open up a school supply store in front of his house using his savings of PhP 3,000 and employ a helper to watch the store while he's driving the van. The store gains a net of PhP 300 a day because the location in just in front of the school. He wanted to expand his business to increase his income but the capital is not enough.

In 2013 He came to know SEED from a friend whom also a member and invited him to attend and orientation. He also joined the seminars and business and skills training and other programs. His first loan amounting to PhP 10,000 added to his savings bought him 5 second-hand computer units and started a computer shop business in the empty room of their house. Since it’s near the school, student with assignments and projects became his regular customer. He also employs a helper to watch his computer shop while his driving the van. The computer shop gains a net of PhP 300 to 500 daily. 

From a series of loan Andy computer shop now has 17 units which gain a net of PhP 1,200-2,500 daily. It helps them with the education of his children and now 2 are already graduated. He still has one child in college and he wanted to expand his computer shop and improve his School supply store to generate more income and helps them in their daily expenses.

Andy is requesting for a re-loan amounting to PhP 20,000 to buy new key boards, mouse, flask disk, cables( for the computer shop), papers, notebooks, ball pens, pencils for the school supplies and 2 new tires for the vehicle to improve the business to it may generate more income.

Andy is still attending SEED seminars and training because he wanted to expand his computer shop and add another branch in the future. All of these hard works are for his children to finish their schooling and for them to save up for their future old age.

loans.use: To buy key boards, mouse, flask disk, cables( for the computer shop), papers, notebooks, ballpens, pencils for the school supplies and 2 new tires for the vehicle

loans.name: Kande

texts.en:
Kande is 42 years old. She is a single parent with four children. The oldest of her children is a first year student in a tertiary institution in Accra. 

For five years now she has been selling water to cater to the needs of her family. She owns a kiosk by the roadside where people usually buy her water. 

Kande wants to expand her business. With this loan, she will be able to buy more bags of water to resell. She believes this will help her to pay for her daughter's tuition fees and take care of her younger children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of water to resell

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a married woman with four children living in a two-room apartment house in Bamenda, in the North West region of Cameroon. She has faced many problems in life, some of which are the shocking deaths of her brothers, sister, and mother, as well as hardship bringing up her children.

With the loan requested, she will buy pigs for rearing, feed, airtime transfer that is credit retail, and provisions such as biscuit, sweets, and magi. She feels her business will succeed because buying more credit will give her more profit; she has steady supplies in all of the networks used by her customers. She has been in the business for a long time and also has a strategic location. This loan will help the community by reducing costs.

The profit realized from this project will be used to educate her children, cater to her family's needs, and expand her business. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rate and the trainings GHAPE provides before disbursing loans, Borrowers also benefit from a social network, that is, ideas exchanged through their weekly and monthly meetings, not leaving out the fact that they do follow-ups for proper utilization.

loans.use: To buy four piglets, feed, and petty store items such as biscuits, and airtime that's communication credit retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tyres and perform maintenance to his car.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el posee un taller de carpintería en el cual fabrica y vende variedad de hermosos y finos muebles, tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio y  muchas personas lo prefieren ya que él ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus muebles, el está  solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 43, lives in his own house with his wife and daughter.  He has a carpentry workshop where he makes and sells all types of beautiful and fine furniture.  He's had this business for many years.  People prefer his business because of the quality and good prices of his furniture.

Guillermo is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in his business.  He will use the funds to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, reeds, and other items.  This will help him to attract more customers so that he can achieve his goal of improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, reeds, and other supplies

loans.name: Furqatjon

texts.ru: Фуркатчону 30 лет. Он проживает на районе Дж.Руми. Он примерный семьянин. Фуркатчон женат и растет двоих детей. Он, к сожалению сейчас не работает. Фуркатчон старательно искал работу и в итоге решил создать свой бизнес. Он будет предоставлять услуги по ремонту домов. Фуркатчон мастер на все руки, он сам делает ремонт у себя дома и решил, что справиться с работой в чужом доме за деньги. Фуркатчону необходимо купить инструменты, но так как строительные инструменты стоят дорого, Фуркатчон обратился за кредитом.  Он верит, что сможет получить кредит, начат бизнес, и приносить в дом доход.
texts.en: Furqatjon is 30 years old and lives in the J.Rumy district of Tajikistan.  He is an exemplary family man.  He is married and raising two children.  Unfortunately, he is not working at the moment.  He has tried very hard to find a job but, in the end, he has decided to start his own business and to offer his services as a handyman.  He has many skills.  He has renovated his own house, so he believes that he will be able to do the same for other people, and get paid for it.  Furqatjon needs to buy construction tools, but because those are expensive, he has applied for a loan.  He believes that thanks to this loan, he will be able to start his business and bring an income home.

loans.use: to buy construction tools.

loans.name: Che Mbegha

texts.en:
He is married with five children living in a three-room house at Bamenda in the Northwest Region of Cameroon. He hates thinking about the death of his family member, the sickness, and the poverty he has tasted. He is very confident that the business will be successful because he has grasped perfect knowledge about the business, the motor bike park is in a strategic location,  and because he has high optimism of success in anything he does.
The loan will be used to purchase a new motorcycle and other spare parts for the motor bike. The community will benefit from easy transportation to their distinct destination.

With the profit from the business, he will be able to expand his business. He will also improve on the piggery, and add his piglets,he will buy a filling machine for motor bike repairs, and take care of his children’s education and medication.

He prefers a loan from GHAPE because it has low interest rates, and a new loan can be given as soon as you finish the old one, coupled with the fact that GHAPE offers non-financial services including training and social networking during bi-monthly Centre meetings.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle and spare parts

loans.name: Hashimu

texts.en:
Hashimu, who is in his late 40s, is a divorcee with two children who are still in school.  He has been selling lubricants since 2000.  He works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hashimu's 15th loan taken from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the stock of lubricants, bought his stock from different companies and has paid back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  He used the profit to pay school fees, to build his house, buy a TV set, a deck, a sofa set, a radio and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to  buy lubricants from different companies to resell.  He dreams of making his business big.

Hashimu will make sure he pays back his loan according to the scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy lubricants from different companies to resell.

loans.name: Justiniano

texts.es:
Justiniano es un hombre de 43 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es el comercio de ganado.
Él es independiente, emprendedor, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su comercio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Palcoco’ ubicado a 40 kilómetros de la ciudad, cercana al lago sagrado Titicaca, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados.
Justiniano es de tez morena, ojos obscuros, cabello corto negro, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la realiza en compañía de sus padres que son muy mayores de edad y no trabajan, viven en una casa construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado; él se encarga de viajar a diferentes ferias en varias comunidades para realizar la compra de ganado vacuno como toros, terneros y vacas, para después transportarla hacia otra feria y venderlo, es una actividad que requiere mucho conocimiento de las condiciones del ganado. “viajo constantemente a las ferias de ganado, compro ganado mejorado y criollo también, les administro vacunas y a veces cuido de ellos por temporadas, luego los vendo…” comenta. Su sueño es contar con un camión dónde pueda transportar el ganado, él desea realizar la compra de ganado lechero por ser la época de vacas gordas y la mejor oportunidad de este tipo de ganado. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 16 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Justiniano solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para venderlo en época de vacas gordas.
texts.en:
Justiniano is a 43 year old man, single, no children, and his business is trading cattle. He is independent, enterprising, steadfast, responsible and hardworking. 

His business is located in the Palcoco community, located 40 kilometres from the city, near the sacred lake Titicaca, with a cold, dry climate and a temperature which varies during the day of around 2-12 degrees centigrade.

Justiniano has a dark complexion, dark eyes, short black hair, a thin physique, his mother tongue is Aymará which is spoken in his area and he speaks Spanish because it is the main culture and for the trading that he does. His life is shared with his parents who are elderly and don't work. They live in an adobe house with a roof made of corrugated iron which has electricity and water from a well.

His business is cattle trading. He travels to different markets in various communities to make purchases of cattle such as bulls, calves and cows, then transports them to other markets to sell. It is a job which requires a lot of knowledge of livestock conditions. 

"I travel constantly to livestock markets, buying bred cattle and regional breeds also, I give them vaccinations and sometimes care for them for a period of time, then I sell them..." he says. 

His dream is to have a truck to transport the cattle, he wants to make the purchase of dairy cows because they are fat in this season and the best opportunity is this type of cow. This is his 2nd loan cycle with this institution in the 16 years he has been in this business.

It is for these reasons that Justiniano is requesting a loan to purchase a dairy cow, to then sell it in the time of plenty.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and maize and wheat seedlings for planting as harvest more as well as increase his income.

loans.name: Gor

texts.en:
This young man is 25 years old, and his name is Gor. He lives in one of the most beautiful suburbs of Yerevan, in Echmiadzin. This is a very small city, but unbelievably nice. Usually Armenians call this suburb a city of churches, the center of the masterpieces of Armenian architecture, which belong to different epochs and include a lot of information about Armenian history. This is the seat of the Catholics of all Armenians.

Here Gor lives with his lovely family: with his parents and brother. Many years ago Gor’s father built a small workshop near their house, where he used to make furniture by order. He also taught this craft to his sons, and today they continue their family business.

The main part of the work is Gor’s duty, and as he says, he likes this craft the most. He takes orders for all kinds of furniture: living room, kitchen, bedroom furniture, wardrobes, sofas, tables, and chairs. He works cutely and with very good taste.

Since Gor is not married, he spends all his time in their workshop, and he also manages to work as a driver at a private company. Gor is asking for this loan because he has a new order, but the lack of materials makes him very worried that he will not manage to complete it on time.

He will use this loan amount for the purchase of materials for making kitchen furniture and to manage to deliver this order on time.

loans.use: to buy materials for making kitchen furniture.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 52 years old and married to Nancy, and together they have been blessed with four children aged 10, 14, 15 and 24 respectively. He has been running a retail shop for the past three years and earns and it has been profitable.

He plans to use this loan to buy more stock of sugar, sweets, packets of salt and cooking fat. He will plow the anticipated profits back into his business.

This is his third loan term from Vision Fund Kenya and he repaid the previous loans successfully. His future hopes are to grow his business, be prosperous and be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy more stock  of sugar, sweets, packets of salt and cooking fat as this will increase his income.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans qui vit à Adamavo avec son mari et ses quatre enfants. Pour contribuer à l’épanouissement de sa famille, Afi vend de la bouillie qu’elle prépare à l’aide du maïs et des beignets dans son quartier. Afi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois auprès des fournisseurs du quartier pour disposer en permanence ses ingrédients. Pour acheter du sac de maïs,de l'huile et de la farine, Afi demande ce crédit pour financer son achat et développer favorablement son activité pour avoir plus de rentabilité.
texts.en:
Afi is 40 years old, married, and lives in Adamavo with her husband and four children. To contribute to her family's development, Afi sells corn porridge in her area that she prepares from corn and beignets.

Afi procures ingredients four times a month so she doesn't run out from suppliers in the area. In order to buy a sac of corn, wheat flour, and oil, Afi is seeking this loan to finance her purchase and to develop her business so it is more profitable.

loans.use: to buy one sac of corn, one sac of wheat flour, and nine liters of oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, etc. to resell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Mary operates a vegetable-selling stall, selling at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale to get money and pay school fees for her children . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 45 years old. He is married with four children aged between four and 14. Three of them go to school. He sells clothes and has been in the business for 20 years. His wife is a businesswoman.

With the loan, he would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house. In future, he wishes to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret needs a credit facility to buy produce such as maize to sell. She is a hardworking married woman with 6 children and 4 are able to acquire education. She lives in the town of Masindi-Uganda selling produce such as groundnuts, maize and beans among other things. She does this business to generate income to support her family. Margret wishes to have a good future and a healthy family. However, she faces a challenge of inadequate capital to buy enough stock.

loans.use: to buy produce such as maize to sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est mariée et âgée de 46 ans. Avec ses quatre enfants, Afi vit à Ahadzikpota dans la ville de Lomé. Afi vend de la farine au marché, dans les rues et fournit particulièrement les revendeuses de nourriture. Afi s'approvisionne  au marché de Notsè deux fois par mois pour avoir sa marchandise. Pour acheter de nouveaux sacs de farine et revoir sa marge de bénéfice à la hausse, Afi nécessite ce microcrédit pour financer son activité.
texts.en: Afi is 46 years old and married with four children. Afi lives in Ahadzikpota in the city of Lomé. Afi sells flour at the market, in the streets, and particularly supplies women food resellers. Afi buys her merchandise at the Notsè Market twice a month. In order to buy more sacks of flour and to see her profit margin increase again, Afi requires a microloan to finance her activity.

loans.use: to buy 18 bowls of flour.

loans.name: Eveline.

texts.en:
The borrower is married with five children and living in a seven-room house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She had a lot of problems, amongst which include a fire accident and the death of her parents in the same season.

With this new loan, she will strengthen the business by buying food items like cocoyam, beans, maize, Irish potatoes, and plantains, as well as buying seedlings and fertilizers, and buying piglets and chicks for the purpose of rearing them.

She knows it will succeed because she is full of experience; she has a strategic location, her loyalty to customers, her optimism and full enthusiasm about her business.

She will help the community in providing raw food items to the entire neighborhood and also will provide manure at relatively lower prices.

With the profit made from this business, she will pay for her children’s school fees, and will use some for the family's wellbeing and health care.
 
She rather prefers to take his loan from Ghape because the interest is low and the duration of repayment is really convenient, not withstanding the non-financial services offered, which include loan management and social networking.

loans.use: to purchase food items like cocoyam, beans, maize, Irish potatoes, and plantains, and buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase zinc sheeting, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es: Ana de 49 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan dulce desde hace 13 años, su panadería la tiene ubicada en su lugar de residencia, con las ganancia que obtiene logra salir adelante, Ana esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de toda la materia prima para elaborar el pan y también mejorar su horno artesanal que es el que muestra la fotografía para poder seguir trabajando y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana, 49, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her daughter. She has been making and selling pan dulce [sweet bread] for 13 years. Her bakery is located in her place of residence, and with what she earns, she manages to get ahead. 

Ana is requesting a loan for the purchase of all the raw materials for making the bread, and also for improving her traditional oven, which is shown in the photograph, so that she can continue working and thus have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase all the raw materials for making bread, and to improve her traditional oven.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy powdered milk and lengths of African print cloth

loans.name: Oymunos

texts.en:
Oymunos is a hardworking woman who was born in 1975. She grew up and lives in remote district. She is widow with three children. 

Oymunos is a seller who trades women's clothing and accessories at her local market. 

Her standard of living is not good and she cannot cover her family's needs, or make living conditions better for her family. She needs support. 

Oymunos requested a 4000 TJS loan to improve the conditions for her family and to cover family expenditures. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Agape Group Musoma

texts.en:
Sylvia, who is in her mid 30s, is married and has three children who are still in school. She has been running two projects selling paraffin and polythene bags for 15 years now. She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sylvia's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her polythene bags and paraffin stock to serve more customers. She is doing fine and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, reinvest in her business and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, flour, paraffin and polythene bags. She dreams of owning a retail shop.

Sylvia will share this loan with her loan group "Agape Group Musoma," which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, flour, paraffin and polythene bags.

loans.name: Mourice

texts.en:
Mourice is a married man. He has five children, with ages ranging from 4 years to 16 years. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a competitive place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of timber. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more timber. 

His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be successful in business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more timber

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Komlan un jeune homme de 34ans se bat chaque fois pour apporter le meilleur de lui même à sa famille. Il a 02 enfants de 08 et 03ans dont 01 scolarisé. Sa femme est accoucheuse de profession. Il a démarré son activité en 2005 et s'approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé. Avec son quatrième crédit, il souhaite acheter des marchandises afin de revendre aux clients. Il souhaite augmenter son stock de marchandises et bien prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Komlan, a young man of 34 years old, endures every time to bring the best of himself to his family. They have 2 children, 8 and 3 years old, one of which is in school. His wife is a midwife by profession. He started his business in 2005 and gets his supplies at the Grand Marché (large bazaar) in Lomé. With his fourth loan, he wishes to buy merchandise for resale to clients. He wishes to increase her merchandise supplies and to take care of his family.

loans.use: To buy paint for resale

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 58 years old residing at Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with two adult age children. 

She joined PMPC on June 30, 2011 to access the programs and services of the co-op. 

Recently, Carmelita accessed her third loan in the amount of PHP 14,990 to buy a variety of commodities to sell in her local community.

loans.use: to buy commodities to sell.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock of soft drinks in bulk to sell to satisfy the demand of  her customers

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, flour, bread and other items.
