She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a suitable place, and her primary customers are the general public. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items. 

Her business goal is to expand to a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have a successful family business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 49 years old and married with three children. One child attends school, Elvira works very hard to provide for them.

Elvira runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Elvira hopes to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Narsiana

texts.en:
Narsiana is a 74-year-old shosho (grand mum) from Kilibwoni, a remote location in Eldoret, Kenya. She has spent the past thirty years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. 

Narsiana is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals. Narsiana wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. 

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES, which she will use to buy additional poultry. With your loan, Narsiana will be able to expand the poultry section of her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. Narsiana is very concerned about her  grandchildren’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Narsiana dreams of a secure future for her grandchildren. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emeliana is 59 years old and has one child in school.

Emeliana has a farming vegetable business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Emeliana has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard, a progressive farmer from Litein, has been doing dairy farming for the last five years. He is particularly passionate about dairy farming. His main sources of income are milk, eggs and other personal business. 

Like any serious dairy farmer, Benard takes animal health very seriously. He drenches drugs to his dairy animals from time to time, an activity he really enjoys. However, he says the major challenge to dairy farmers in his area is lack of quality breeds of animals. 

Benard is seeking a loan to purchase a good-quality dairy cow. This cow produces more than 20 litres of milk daily. Milk sold from this cow will provide Benard with a significant amount of income on a daily basis and enough to clear the loan repayments on time. 

Benard has a clear business plan. Juhudi Kilimo smallholder farmers’ microfinance has been very encouraging and supportive to such progressive farmers. We want his farm to be an example to other farmers who have potential but are constrained by funds. Benard says the extra income he will generate will enable him to save enough money to buy a pedigreed dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a good-quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 23 years old. She is married with one child, who is one year old. She owns a shop, and has been in a business for two years, while her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as soap, sugar and salt to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In future, she aims to earn at least 90% of her business.

loans.use: To buy more items such as soap, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Love Group

texts.en:
Love is a group made up of five, very happy, hardworking people, who stand ready to improve themselves. They all do their best to expand their businesses, and that is why they request loans from ID Ghana through Kiva. They are into the sale of eggs, fruit, rice, fish, groceries and charcoal. 

Comfort is a very kind, very chatty lady. She's 60 years old and married to Ernest, a pensioner. All her children are grown up and are taking care of themselves. Comfort is originally from another state in Ghana, but she started up her business of egg sales when she arrived in the community eight years ago. "I've always liked to have my own money to buy my things and also to help meet my family expenses," she says.

With this new loan, she will buy 15 crates of eggs, which she will supply to her customers. She loves her work because she gets her own income and she has clients who are always buying from her without exception.

Comfort is standing first from right in the photo, which was taken in the municipal garden.

loans.use: To buy 15 crates of eggs, which she will supply to her customers.

loans.name: Christopher's Group

texts.en:
Christopher is a 60 year-old proud father of seven children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District. 

Since joining the One Acre Fund in 2012, Christopher has noticed that he has been able to save more money.

Christopher described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to purchase a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore save more money. 

With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Christopher’s group will be able to plant a total of six acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and access cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 35 years old. She is married with three children between seven months and six years old. One of the children goes to school. She sells Irish potatoes and she has been in business for five years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan, she would like to buy more Irish potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and to the pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 32 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 10 and 15 years old.  All of her children go to school.  She has owned a shop for 11 years, while her husband has been a business man.  

With the loan, Odette would like to buy more items such as: cooking oil, radios, and soap for sell.  The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: To buy more items such as cooking oil, radios, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr: Pierrette est une femme divorcée  qui vit à Adidogomé avec son enfant. Elle est âgée de 43 ans  et œuvre activement pour apporter sa contribution à l’épanouissement de sa famille. Pierrette vend des produits d’alimentation générale. Grâce à son petit commerce, elle trouve une épargne pour favoriser son enfant et subvenir aux charges de la famille. Pierrette s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Dans le but de réaliser plus de bénéfice et commander des sacs d’oignons, Pierrette demande ce crédit pour atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en:
Pierrette is a divorced woman who lives in Adidogomé with her child. She is 43 years old and works hard to bring her contribution to the well-being of her family. 

Pierrette sells foodstuffs. Thanks to her little business, she is able to put aside money to help her baby and cover family expenses. 

Pierrette buys her goods four times a month in the Grand Marche in Lomé. Wishing to make more profit and order some sacks of onions, Pierrette is asking for this loan to meet her objectives.

loans.use: to buy one sack of onions.

loans.name: Zinalikuti Group

texts.en:
Melifa thanks Kiva for her previous loan, which she used to purchase different items for her market stall. The loan helped her to improve her family's living standards, as she is now able to provide adequate basic needs for her children.

Melifa's aim is to open a grocery store, and she will use the loan obtained in this cycle to open a grocery. She hopes to further expand her business by opening a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy assorted items.

loans.name: Watipaishe Group

texts.en:
Patience is turning 30 this year, and she is the mother of 2 young children who are going to school. In 2010, Patience’s life took a tragic turn, when she was widowed at the tender age of 24. She was left with two children: one barely a toddler, and the other only 6 years old. This necessitated that Patience take the bull by its horns and fend for her children. She started a cross-border business going to neighboring South Africa and Botswana to sell clothes and shoes. 

At first Patience plied her trade from home. She now operates in a bustling flea market in Mbare, Harare. She now specializes in buying and selling babywear, and she also sells at the tobacco auction floors seasonally, as there are quick returns there. 

Patience is a member of Watipaishe Group. Watipaishe Group is composed of 4 enterprising ladies based in Glen Norah, Harare. The group joined Thrive in January 2014, facing a need to grow their businesses through loans. Patience, together with her group members, received business training, which they feel will go a long way in improving their businesses. 

With her current loan from Thrive, Patience wants to buy more wares for resale in her flea market and electrical gadgets to sell at the tobacco auction floors. In the future she has plans to open a babywear boutique and build a home for her children.

loans.use: To increase her stock of goods for sale.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is a 19-year-old single lady, who has worked as a hair dresser and makeup artist from her house since 2012. She was only 16 when she started this business to support her family in their living.

Today, Mariana is well known in her region with her special talents and prices she sets. She is recommended by her customers and is working hard on 
developing her career.

She is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a special laser machine that will attract more customers, increase her income, and develop her business properly.

She is working hard on developing her skills and talents, through attending special technical colleges and benefiting from vocational trainings related to her domain development.

She is working hard to move her business outside her house in the future to provide her customers with the privacy they need and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a special laser machine that will attract more customers, increase her income, and develop her business properly

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en:
37-year-old Chreb is married with a son who is her dependent. They are living in a rural village of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. To support the family, she has been a rice farmer for 17 years, while her husband is a construction worker. Together they can save roughly 4 USD per day. 

Chreb is a new member of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is seeking for a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to buy a piece of land for farming. She hopes to keep expanding her rice field so that she can have more yields.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old single man who works as a chef in a restaurant with a limited salary to cover his needs and expenses.

On the other hand, Mohammad's work isn't affecting his university studies. He is a hard worker and ambitious man who wants to finish his studies and build a better future for himself, thus he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his university tuition fees. 

He hopes to start his own business in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps Feroza's husband purchase a new rickshaw body for transportation services.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y su nieta, ella posee desde hace 15 años un negocio de venta de comida ubicado en el mercado municipal, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios de los platos de comida, con lo que obtiene de sus venas ella puede salir adelante con su familia, Manuela está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos como: pollos, carnes, arroz, frijoles, verduras, vegetales, frutas entre otros todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Manuela, 56, lives in her own house with her son and her granddaughter. She has had a business selling food in the municipal market for 15 years, and she has many customers because of the good prices of the meals.  With what she earns from her sales, she and her family are able to get ahead.

Manuela is requesting a loan for the purchase of basic ingredients for making the meals, such as chicken, meat, rice, beans, green vegetables and vegetables, and fruit, among other items, at wholesale.  In this way, she can continue with her work in order to have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, meat, rice, beans, green vegetables, vegetables, and fruit, among other items, at wholesale.

loans.name: Samson's Group

texts.en:
Samson, pictured above, has been a farmer for 18 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 9 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 43 years old, is married and has 7 children.

Samson likes to think of himself as a very experienced farmer. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Samson plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Samson’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Pamphlys's Group

texts.en:
Pamphlys, pictured above, has 11 children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Pamphlys is representing his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Pamphlys has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Pamphlys is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 5.25 acres will be planted by Pamphlys's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Aun's Group

texts.en:
Aun is a married woman that lives in Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district. 35 years old, Aun has a son who is under 6 years old. To finance her family, she has been a rice farmer for 15 years. Her secondary source of income is from her husband being a factory worker. They are able to save almost 6 USD daily. 

Leading her group and as a third time borrower from VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, Aun is requesting for a 1,000,000 KHR loan to purchase rice seed for her rice farm. 

She hopes that she will always have enough capital for her rice farm.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed for her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for Solar Home Solution to keep her shop open for longer hours

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy portable solar home solutions to cater to clients during load shedding hours

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Solar Home Solution to support his sisters stitching work and provide comfort for his ailing mother

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for solar home solution

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase Solar Home Solutions to be able to work at night and provide for her daugthers

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.ru: Юлдош 50 летний житель района под названием Дж.Руми. У него большая семья. Юлдош духовно-богатый и верующий человек. Он заботится о своих пожилых родителях. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Юлдош должен кормить свою большую семью и заботиться о них. Он ищет хороший доход, покрывающий расходы семьи. Юлдош принял решение начать новый бизнес. Он собирается заниматься продажей детской одежды. Он нашел торговую точку, и ему осталось купить товар и реализовать продажу. Из-за нехватки капитала он обратился за кредитом, с надеждой на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Yuldosh is a 50-year old man living in the J.Rumy family. Yuldosh is a spiritual and religious person. He takes care of his aged parents. He is married and has four children. Yuldosh needs to provide for his large family and support it. He is searching for a good source of income that would cover family expenses. Yuldosh decided to launch a new business. He plans to sell children's clothing. He has found a sales stand, and needs only to stock up on merchandise and start selling. Because lacks the necessary starting capital he applied for a loan and is hoping for your support.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing and launch a new business.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en: Florenda is 60 years old and widowed. She was blessed with four children and they live happily in a rural community. She earns their living through farming and hog-raising. She aspires to improve her hog-raising business in order to earn a higher income and overcome financial hardship. Due to inadequate capital, she would like to ask for a loan of PHP20,000.00 to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs. With this financial assistance, Florenda believes that she would be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Racha

texts.en:
Racha is a 24-year-old single woman who works as a tutor to cover her needs and expenses. She is acquiring this loan to pay her university's tuition fees.

The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. 

Racha hopes to finish her studies and improve her situation.

loans.use: to pay her university's tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and other supplies she needs in her variety store and also to buy new stock of gallon jugs for her water distribution business.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 45 years old, married to Nicholas and they are blessed with five children.  For the last eight years she has been running a posho mill and gets a monthly income of KES.30000, which she uses to support her family.

She has applied for her fifth loan of KES 80,000 which she intends to use to buy dried maize to grind and sell to her customers.

Angeline hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy dried maize to grind and sell to her customers

loans.name: Fredeswinda

texts.en:
Fredeswinda is 62 years old and has five children. Fredeswinda is widowed woman.

Fredeswinda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Fredeswinda has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Fredeswinda has been in this business for 36 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Fredeswinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a45-year -old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jessica has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jessica has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
As a parent of five children, Joan works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling beverages in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Joan is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy purified water and soft drinks to sell for her beverage business.

Joan has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy purified water and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, 45-year-old Sopha is married with one school-aged child.  

For 25 years, Sopha has been farming rice to make a living and her husband is a construction worker.  Generally, they can keep around 4 USD for savings each day.  

This is her second loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is the leader of her group of two and she is applying for a loan of 100,000 KHR to buy rice seed. 

The profit from this harvest will be used to invest in her rice farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Goderdzi

texts.en:
Goderdzi is 42 years old and lives in the small village in the Zugdidi district of West Georgia.  He lives with his pensioner parents. 

He has a cow and a horse, and also grows nut trees on the family-owned land.  His mother milks the cows every day and produces dairy products.  Goderdzi sells the produced dairy products with the nut trees locally at a good price.  Goderdzi wants to open a mill and has requested a loan. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1000 GEL.  With the received credit he will open a mill and will serve local people to mill corn. 

He will have a good number of clients, as there is a need for a mill in the village.

loans.use: to open a mill

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 46-year-old woman living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Naseem’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years. It has depreciated with the passage of time. He sold his old rickshaw and wants to buy a new rickshaw. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been feeding his children. Now his children are growing older, and their needs are growing as well. 

Naseem has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing she was short some money. Therefore, Naseem has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings. 

Naseem hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income. She is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 57 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school.  Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for 13 years now. 

In the future, Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Gladys's Group

texts.en:
Gladys is a 54-year-old proud mother of nine children. She is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Gladys has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Gladys described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Gladys’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en: Forty-six-year-old Savy is married and has two children. One of her children is still living with her in a small village of Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. For 28 years, she has been a rice farmer in order to finance the family. This is her first time as a client of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Leading her group, Savy is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy potash and rice seed for her rice farm. She hopes that her family's standard of living will be upgraded.

loans.use: to buy potash and rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en: Being a responsible housewife, Analisa engages in a business raising hogs for sale. This is her way of helping her husband in earning income. Due to financial hardship, she aims to make her business profitable in order to provide for her family's needs and save for future emergencies. Having insufficient capital, she would like to avail an additional loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 31-year-old married mother of two children. She is acquiring this loan to pay for her children's school transportation and stationery. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. 

By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Hanan hopes to stay capable of providing her children with the necessary living needs, and developing their social situation.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school transportation and stationery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a biogas system for clean cooking fuel for his family

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Joyce, pictured above, has seven children and is always described as a very trustworthy person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Joyce is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Joyce has been a farmer for 15 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Joyce is planning to invest in a business.

A total of six acres will be planted by Joyce's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medication and pay for medical examinations, ultrasounds, and travel expenses

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could further improve her business if you will let her borrow again, for an amount of 10,000 PHP. This new loan will also go towards purchasing additional supplies that she needs for making 'yema' (a traditional Filipino candy made with a custard center covered with a caramel shell). Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Erlinda wants to have business expansion so that she will be able to give her family a good life in the coming years. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and purchase raw ingredients she needs in making yema.

loans.name: Eang's Group

texts.en:
Living in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Eang is a widow with no children. 

To earn a living, she has been farming rice for 25 years. Apart from farming rice, she is also a paid worker. She manages to save around 5 USD a day. 

Eang is the leader of her group which contains two members. She has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner once before. Currently, she is pursuing a 1,600,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm. She hopes that she can earn more profit from it.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 55 years old and married with three children.

Leonora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like cigarettes, junk foods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Leonora has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from coconut wine vending.

Leonora aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like cigarettes, junk foods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en: Originally from Kampong Cham Province, 51-year-old Yat is now living in Snoul district of Kratie province with her husband and five of her seven children. For the past eight years, her main sources of income have come from rice farming and a cassava plantation. She can also earn additional income from being a paid worker. She is able to earn almost 6 USD per day. For her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR to buy potash and cassava stems for her plantation. Her wish is for her family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy potash and cassava stems

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, cigarettes and candies.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, cigarettes and candies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her economic activity and invest in her business.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 26 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es el comercio de ganado.
Él es emprendedor, decidido, fuerte, luchador, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Palcoco’ área ubicada a 40 kilómetros de la ciudad, cercana a orillas del lago sagrado Titicaca, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados.
Juan es de tez morena, cabello castaño corto, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con sus familiares que se dedican a la agricultura, viven en una casa construida de adobe con techo de paja y otro de calamina y cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la construcción, actualmente cambio de rubro y se dedica al comercio de ganado, actividad que conoce desde niño y con ayuda de sus familiares emprendió el negocio de comercio; dirigiéndose a diferentes ferias de ganado para realizar la compra criarlo, engordarlo y venderlo. “anteriormente trabajaba en construcción, tuve la suerte de recibir un apoyo económico y me decidí a volver a la agricultura, es una labor sacrificada a la que ya estoy acostumbrado desde toda mi vida…” comenta. Su sueño es contar con varias cabezas de ganado, el desea realiza la compra de ganado lechero para incursionar en la lechería. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Juan solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para incursionar en la producción de leche.
texts.en:
Juan is 26 years old, single without kids and his business is cattle commerce.  He's entrepreneurial, decided, strong, hard working and responsible.  He develops his business in the community of Palcoco, an area located 40 kilometers from the city, near the shore of the sacred lake Titicaca where there is a cold and dry climate with a temperature between 2-12 degrees Celsius.  
Juan is dark skinned, short brown hair, dark eyes, short height, and slender complexion.  His native tongue is Aymara and speaks Spanish because of the general culture and his business.  His lives with his family who all work in agriculture and share a house made of adobe and a straw and zinc ceiling.  They use well water and have electricty.  
He used to work in construction but he changed jobs and now he works raising cattle, a profession he's known since he was a kid and he's been doing with his family to start his business at differente cattle fairs to buy the cattle, fatten it and then sell it. "I used to work in construction but I received some economic support and decided to go back to agriculture.  One has to scarifice a lot but I'm used to it from my whole life."  
His dream is to have a few heads of cattle.  He wants to buy dairy cattle to start working in the milk production industry.  This the third succesive loan with the institution in 6 years since he started developing this activity. This is why he requests a loan to buy dairy cattle to start working in milk production.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle to start his milk production business.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie always has enthusiasm when managing his rice farming activities, from which he earns an income that primarily supports his family. At the age of 64, he busies himself to sufficiently provide for the family. He grabbed the opportunity to become a fully fledged member of PMPC. He credits the cooperative with his capital in supporting his farming activities. Recently, he applied for a loan to buy bags of fertilizer to increase the crop yield on his rice farm. In the future, Josie wishes to own a hauling truck for easily transporting his produce to any marketplace in the province.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer to increase the crop yield on his rice farm.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is a 65-year-old proud mother of 10 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of eight farmers in Kakamega North district. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Rose has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Rose describes her harvest as poor due to the effects of MLND (maize virus) last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, as well as the fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Rose’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.25 acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is 61 years old and married with five children.She works very hard to provide for them. Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as soap, canned goods, tooth paste, groceries, etc. Letecia has been in this business for 37 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soap, canned goods, tooth paste, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Borey's Group

texts.en: Twenty-five-year-old Borey is a resident of a rural village of Kratie province. She is married and has two children who are under the age of six. To support the family, she and her husband have been growing cassava for four years. Sometimes, they work as paid workers to earn extra. Borey has been a client of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, twice now. Leading her group, she is pursuing a 1,400,000 KHR loan to buy a piece of land to expand her cassava plantation. She hopes that it will financially help her family.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his truck.

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es: María tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos. Es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora de los corrales de los pollos y para comprar más pollos para la crianza y venta. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y de esta forma hacer la inversión en su negocio que es su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her 2 sons.  She's an entrepreneurial woman who raises and sells chickens to earn a living and support her home.  
With the desire to improve her quality of life, she's requesting this loan to FUSAI to invest in the improvement of the chicken corrals and buy more chickens to raise and sell them.  She hopes to receive this loan and invest in her business which her main source of income.

loans.use: to buy zinc panels and cement posts to improve her chicken corrals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand and cement and pay for labor expenses.

loans.name: Dora Elena

texts.es: Dora de 39 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas en su lugar de residencia desde hace 15 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, frijoles, etc. todo por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Dora is 39 years old and a single mother who lives with her 2 children in her own home.  She sells tortillas and pupusas from her home for the last 15 years.  She has many clients because of her good prices and amability when selling her food.  She obtains enough earnings to pay for some of the home expenses.
She's requesting a loan to buy wholesale corn, cheese, prok rinds and beans to continue with her sale and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn, cheese, pork rinds and beans.

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es: Luis de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee un taller de calzado,  repara y elabora calzado, su taller lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 22 años, posee mucha clientela por la calidad del producto, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Luis está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cuero, hilo, pega, tela, etc. para seguir con su elaboración ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo  y así tener junto con su esposa una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his wife.  He has a shoe workshop where he makes and repairs shoes.  He's had his shop at his residence for the last 22 years.  He has a lot of clientele because of the quality of his products.  From his sales he's able to move forward and cover his house expenses.  
Luis is requesting a loan to buy leather, string, glue, and fabric, among other things to continue making shoes since it's his only source of income allowing for a better quality of life with his wife.

loans.use: buy leather, string, glue and fabric.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 53-year-old divorced woman and mother of one child.  She spent 25 years of her life working and raising her child alone with no one's help. She has to work hard in her clothing shop to cover her family's expenses.

Souad is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying desperately to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business capital with a new collection of winter clothes to satisfy her customers' needs in this cold weather.

Souad aims to expand her trade by opening another branch in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business capital with a new collection of winter clothes.

loans.name: Safeena

texts.en:
Safeena is a 39-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 3 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For many days, her husband's rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any income. Safeena wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Safeena has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
To have additional income, Erlinda has been engaged in a rice retailing business within their community. She is 50 years old and has only one child. 

Despite the hardship of living, she and her husband aspire to improve their status of living to give their child a better life. With this regard, she aspires to improve more of her business in order to earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional PHP 18,000 to buy more stock of rice to resell. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that someday, she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to resell.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Fifty-three-year-old Thol is residing in a rural village of the Prey Prorsorb district of Kratie province. She is married with 12 children. Six of her children are still living with her. Her main source of income is from growing cassava. Her secondary sources of income are from planting vegetables for sale and a fishery. She is able to earn approximately $5 USD per day. 

This is her second loan with Kiva’s partner (VisionFund), and she is borrowing 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her vegetable plantation. She hopes that her family living standard will be improved from the profit she will gain. 

*Note: The man in the picture is her husband.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her vegetable plantation

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
A resident of Ek Phnom district, Battambang province, Mao is 50 years old and married with four children that are no longer her dependents. Her sources of income have been from rice farming and growing beans for 22 years. 

This is Mao's second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is requesting a loan to buy pesticide for her bean plantation. She wishes for her plantation to be fruitful so that her family can earn more.

loans.use: to buy pesticide for her bean plantation

loans.name: Kimsan's Group

texts.en:
Kimsan is living in Sangke district, Battambang province. She is 30 years of age and is married with two children who are primary school students. 

To make a living, Kimsan has been a rice farmer for three years. Her secondary source of income is from a fishery. She is able to earn just above $5 USD every day. 

She is a leader of her group that consists of three people. She is applying for a loan of 1,600,000 KHR in order to buy rice seed and to hire a worker to plough the land for farming rice as well as to buy a motorcycle in order to transport the fish to sell. She wishes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and to hire a worker to plow the land for farming rice, as well as to buy a motorcycle in order to transport the fish to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Naledi is a school in Lusaka Zambia that was founded in 2000 and is run by Beatrice and her daughter Nchimunya who have made it their mission to provide an education for children in their community. The slogan of their mission is; To provide children with an education that focuses on the head, heart and hand. Naledi is a school that strives to be result oriented to ensure that they produce well educated future leaders by providing quality education using a combination of the Accelerated Christian Education (ACE) system and the Zambian curriculum.
 Naledi also caters to the vulnerable children in the society that are unable to receive a decent education by providing 10 school places with free education ranging from primary to Secondary School. These pupils are given free meals and free uniforms.
Beatrice requests for a loan to purchase ICT educational resources which will help the children receive quality education using modern education technology in the form of the ZEduPad, a revolutionary e-learning educational tablet designed for children with preloaded content mapped to the Zambian Primary School curriculum. This educational tablet is now being used in schools throughout Zambia and many parts of Africa.

loans.use: To purchase ZEduPads which are ICT educational resources which will help the children in her school receive quality education using this form of modern education technology.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 50-year-old proud mother of eight children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of nine farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Mary has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Mary described her harvest as very good last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Mary’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Lewelyn

texts.en:
Lewelyn is 52 years old and widowed with five children. Lewelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Lewelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, junk foods, groceries, etc..

Lewelyn has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, eggs, groceries, etc.

In the future, Lewelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, snack foods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Temwani which means ‘Love’ is a nursery and lower primary school stuated in Lusaka, Zambia. It was started in January 2013 by Nellie who set a mission to serve children in the community of Ng’ombe compound by providing affordable education to them. Temwani school initially started with an enrollment number of only four children and has in the last year risen to ninety six children catering for the education of much of the community’s young children.  
Temwani’s  mission is to equip future leaders who will soar like eagles through the development of talent, building of Godly characters and imparting knowledge through love, integrity and excellence.
Nellie requires a loan to purchase ICT educational resources which will help the children in the community receive quality education using modern education technology in the form of the ZEduPad, a revolutionary e-learning educational tablet developed in Zambia which is designed for children. The ZEduPad has preloaded content mapped to the Zambian Primary School curriculum approved by the Ministry of Education. This educational tablet is now being used in schools throughout Zambia and also other parts of Africa.

loans.use: To purchase ICT educational resources which will help the children in the community receive quality education using modern education technology

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ICT educational resources which will help the children in Maggie's school receive quality education using modern education technology.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago de 56 años de edad, esta felizmente casado y tiene 3 hijos que viven con el.

Santiago se dedica a la siembra de frijol, maíz y sandia, se levanta a las 4.00 am para irse a trabajar a sus terrenos y sus hijos le ayudan a llevar a cabo el trabajo.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para la preparación del terreno donde sembrara sandia y maíz y para el pago de la mano de obra.

Su sueño es poder darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia, apoyar a su esposa ya que actualmente la han operado de la vista y también desea apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Santiago is 56 years old, happily married and has three children who live at home. Santiago works growing beans, corn and watermelon. He gets up at 4am work in his fields and his children help him to get the work done.

The money from the loan is needed to clear a field where he will plant watermelons and corn and pay for manual labor.

His dream is to be able to give a better lifestyle to his family, support his wife who has just had an operation on her eyesight and also he wants to support his children in their studies.

loans.use: to clear some land and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Carla Roselin

texts.es:
Carla tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo en el distrito de Nueva Arica, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 3 años contando con experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos que brindan buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como para realizar mantenimiento del lugar donde los cría. Con esto Carla espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carla is 33 years old, a single mother, she lives with her son in the Nueva Arica district, a rural zone which is located in the Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque region, northern coast of Peru. Life in the community is peaceful, the villagers work in agriculture, trade and ranching.

She works raising and selling animals. She has been in this line of work for more than 3 years, relying on her experience in the business and regular customers who give her good personal and work references. 

The loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of animals, and to do repairs on the place where she raises them. With this, Carla hopes to offer a greater variety of animals to her customers which will enable her to improve her income and consequently better her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy animals and maintain their coups.

loans.name: Rita Alejandrina

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen se destaca en la agricultura, se cultiva el plátano barraganete, café, cacao, maíz y gran variedad de frutas (piñas, naranjas, maracuyá, etc.). En la ganadería se destaca la cría de ganado vacuno, equino, porcino y aves de corral, en este lugar hermoso se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Santa María
En este lugar vive la señora Rita, tiene 63 años de edad, hace varios años falleció su marido pero  de esta relación tienen  dos hijas las mismas que ya son  mayores de edad e independientes. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Rita es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para salir adelante, ella  con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que saben de la calidad de sus trabajos y les piden confeccionar sus prendas. Trabaja todos los días  pero no tiene horario establecido ya que cuando es mucho el trabajo se queda hasta tarde en la noche, de esta forma ella logra ganarse el sustento diario.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar una máquina de coser y materiales para la costura. Está en el grupo de crédito 6 años, le gusta las charlas educativas, el seguro de salud. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The El Carmen canton stands out for its agriculture, barraganete variety bananas, coffee, cacao, corn and a great variety of fruit (pineapples, oranges, passionfruit, etc) which are grown there. In livestock farming it is known for breeding cattle, horses, pigs and poultry. The members of the Santa Maria Communal Bank meet in this beautiful place.

This is where Rita lives, 63 years old, her husband passed away some years ago but from the marriage she has two daughters who are now adults and live independently. Many years ago she learnt dressmaking at an academy in town. 

Rita is a woman who has had to work very hard to make it. She with the aim of having her own income and taking advantage of her dressmaking skills, she set up a small tailoring workshop in her house. There she works in all types of dressmaking for women, men and children. She does orders for people who know the quality of her work and ask her to make garments. She works every day but she doesn't have fixed hours as when there is a lot of work she stays up late at night, this is how she manages to earn a livelihood.

This new loan will be used to buy a sewing machine and dressmaking supplies. She has been in the communal bank for 6 years, she likes the educational presentations and the health insurance. Her dreams are to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Ramona Dioselina

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen se destaca en la agricultura, se cultiva el plátano barraganete, café, cacao, maíz y gran variedad de frutas (piñas, naranjas, maracuyá, etc.). En la ganadería se destaca la cría de ganado vacuno, equino, porcino y aves de corral, en este lugar hermoso se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Santa María
En este lugar vive la señora Ramona, tiene 59 años de edad, esta separada, pero de esa relación  tiene 7 hijos, 5 de ellos fallecieron lo cual dejo un profundo dolor en el corazón pero gracias al apoyo de sus dos hijos que aun tiene sale adelante, los dos son  mayores pero siempre están cerca a pesar de que no viven con ella.
Doña Ramona se dedica  a lavar ropa en diferentes casas, también la cría de cerdos  y  aves de corral en una pequeña granja en su casa, cría pollos durante tres meses que es el tiempo que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los vende por libras y en pie a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa, los cerdos de la misma forma entrega a comerciantes, ella también vende en su casa cervezas ya que tiene cerca una cancha donde llegan muchas personas,  lleva 34 años dedicada a esta labor con la cual se gana la vida.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, cerdos,  alimentos y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para los cerdos. Tiene 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y  le gusta porque le han ayudado los servicios de salud. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The El Carmen canton stands out for its agriculture, barraganete variety bananas, coffee, cacao, corn and a great variety of fruit (pineapples, oranges, passionfruit, etc) which are grown there. In livestock farming it is known for breeding cattle, horses, pigs and poultry. The members of the Santa Maria Communal Bank meet in this beautiful place.

This is where Ramona lives, 59 years old, separated but from the marriage she had 7 children. 5 of them died, which left her with a deep sadness in her heart but thanks to the support of the two children she still has, she is moving ahead. The two are the oldest but they are always nearby despite not living with her.

Ramona works washing laundry for different families. She also raises pigs and chickens in a small farmyard at her home, she raises chickens for three months until the time they are ready for sale, after that time she sells them live by the pound to dealers who come to her house, in the same way she delivers pigs to the traders. She also sells beers from home as she has a [soccer] field nearby where many people come. She has been working for 34 years in these lines of work from which she earns a living.

This new loan will be used to buy chickens, pigs, feed and medicine for both the chickens and pigs. She has been in the Communal Bank for 5 years and she likes it because the health services have been beneficial. Her dreams are to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, feed and medicine for both the chickens and pigs

loans.name: Marlen Gabriela

texts.es:
Ayudar al prójimo es una de las cualidades más valiosas que pueden tener las personas, porque se hace una entrega desinteresada, sólo con el incentivo de haber sido útil. Marlen es una de esas jóvenes, bondadosas y hospitalarias que con una sonrisa ofrece la mano amiga aquel que la necesita. Por ello, decido estudiar la licenciatura en enfermería, de esta manera contribuye a la sociedad y crece como persona. 

Marlen cursa su último año universitario gracias al apoyo de su familia. Por lo que, solicita el financiamiento a MiCrédito para pagar la titulación, y así poder ser egresada oficialmente. Esto le será útil porque podrá iniciar su vida laboral lo antes posible. Entre los planes a futuro que ella posee está obtener un buen empleo, comprar una vivienda y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Helping others is one of the most valuable qualities that people can have. They commit selfless acts with just the incentive to have been useful. 

Marlen is one of those youth, kind hearted and hospitable, who offers a helping hand with a smile to whoever needs it. For this reason, she decided to study nursing and to in this way contribute to society and grow as a person. 

Thanks to the support of her family, Marlen is studying for her final year at university. This is why she is requesting a loan from MiCredito, to pay diploma costs and to formally graduate. This would be helpful to her  because she can then begin her working life as soon as possible. Amongst the future plans that she possesses are to obtain a good job, buy a home and help her family.

loans.use: to pay graduation costs.

loans.name: Lidia De La Cruz

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen se destaca en la agricultura, se cultiva el plátano barraganete, café, cacao, maíz y gran variedad de frutas (piñas, naranjas, maracuyá, etc.). En la ganadería se destaca la cría de ganado vacuno, equino, porcino y aves de corral, en este lugar hermoso se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Santa María
En este lugar vive la señora Lidia, tiene 48  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen  un hijo mayor de edad e independiente. Su esposo es chofer, tiene una camioneta y hace fletes a donde lo requieran. 
Doña Lidia se dedica a la cría de  aves de corral en una pequeña granja en su casa, ella en temporadas compra una gran cantidad de pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a algunas tiendas en la localidad y también vende por libras en su casa y en pie a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa, también tiene ganado vacuno y cultiva plátanos, naranjas, etc. En su tiempo libre también realiza trabajos de costura con unas amigas y  les ha ido bastante bien ya que es una forma de ganar algo desde su casa.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, cerdos, alimentos y medicinas para los mismos. Ella tiene 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito, le gusta la Fundación por el apoyo que les da en cada reunión y la responsabilidad que tiene  todo el personal. Sus sueños son tener salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The El Carmen canton stands out for its agriculture, barraganete variety bananas, coffee, cacao, corn and a great variety of fruit (pineapples, oranges, passionfruit, etc) which are grown there. In livestock farming it is known for breeding cattle, horses, pigs and poultry. The members of the Santa Maria Communal Bank meet in this beautiful place.

This is where Lidia lives, she is 48 years old, married and from the relationship has an adult son who is grown up and independent. Her husband is a driver, he has a light truck and does deliveries wherever needed.

Lidia works raising poultry in a small farmyard at her house. She buys a large quantities of chickens in season and raises them for three months, which is the time they are ready for sale. After that time, she delivers them to some stores in town and also sells them by the pound from home and live to traders who come to her house. She also has cattle, and banana and orange plantations, etc. In her free time she also does dressmaking with some friends and they have done quite well as it is a way of working from home.

In this new loan she will purchase chickens, pigs, feed and medicines for them. She has been in this communal bank for 7 years. She likes the foundation because of the support she gets every meeting and the responsibility that the staff have. Her dreams are to be healthy and keeping moving forward.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, feed and medicines.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria una mujer dedicada y generosa es soltera, ella tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad bastante lejana y poco poblado de Chichicastenango.
Candelaria es una muchacha trabajadora que para generar sus ingresos desde hace 20 años se dedica a la elaboración de hermosos trajes típico de su región, ella cuenta que esta actividad para ella es bastante rentable  pero requiere de mucho tiempo y dedicación, ella es muy feliz  elaborando ropas típicas pues es lo único que sabe hacer y porque esto lo aprendió de su madre quien también se dedicaba a esta actividad.
Ahora uno de los anhelos de Candelaria es modernizar sus tejidos en la ropa pero para  poder hacerlo necesita de un buen capital, capital que ella no tiene, pero Candelaria es una mujer que lucha por sus sueños y para realizar este cambio esta solicitando un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar hilos de diferentes colores y marcas.
El sueño de Candelaria es poder conseguir el préstamo lo más pronto posible y así poder seguir realizando ropas típicas hermosas, y con los ingresos que ella logre, poner una tienda donde pueda exhibir sus trajes.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a dedicated and generous woman. She is single, 39 years old and lives with her parents in a sparsely populated and very distant community in Chichicastenango. 

Candelaria is a hard working woman who has earned income for 20 years by working to make beautiful garments traditional to her area. 

She notes that this work is very profitable for her but requires a lot of time and dedication. She is very happy making traditional clothing since it is all that she knows how to do and because she learned it from her mother who also worked in this business. 

Candelaria now longs to modernize her clothing styles but in order to do so she needs more capital. Capital which she does not have. Candelaria is a woman who fights for her dreams and in order to make this change she is requesting a loan to buy yarns of different colors and brands. 

Candelaria's hope is to receive the loan as soon as possible. In that way she can continue making beautiful traditional clothing and start a store to exhibit her garments with the earnings she receives.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Carmen Graciela

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen se destaca en la agricultura, se cultiva el plátano barraganete, café, cacao, maíz y gran variedad de frutas (piñas, naranjas, maracuyá, etc.). En la ganadería se destaca la cría de ganado vacuno, equino, porcino y aves de corral, en este lugar hermoso se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Santa María
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen,  tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos pero uno de ellos fallecido, los que aun tiene son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es agricultor y comerciante de mariscos.
Doña Carmen es una muy  buena esposa que trata de ayudarle a su esposo con la dura carga del hogar y es para esto que ella realiza los créditos, para que el lo utilice en su negocio, el se dedica a la venta de pescado, concha, camarones, entre otros mariscos, el todos los días se desplaza a un lugar donde compra al por mayor estos mariscos para luego salir a vender por la ciudad y sitios cercanos por donde tiene muy buenos clientes,  ella también vende  en su  casa a las vecinas del lugar. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pescado, conchas y camarones. Lleva tres ciclos en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la organización y responsabilidad de la fundación. Sus sueños tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The El Carmen canton stands out for its agriculture, barraganete variety bananas, coffee, cacao, corn and a great variety of fruit (pineapples, oranges, passionfruit, etc) which are grown there. In livestock farming it is known for breeding cattle, horses, pigs and poultry. The members of the Santa Maria Communal Bank meet in this beautiful place.

This is where Carmen lives, 46 years old, married and with 4 children but one died, those she still has are grown up and independent. Her husband is a farmer and seafood trader.

Carmen is a very good wife who tries to help her husband with the heavy burden of the household and that is the reason she takes out loans, so he can use them for his business. He works selling fish, oysters, shrimp amongst other seafood, and he goes out every day to buy seafood wholesale to then sell it in the city and its environs where he has very good customers, she also sells it from home to their neighbours.

This loan will be used to purchase to buy fish, oysters and shrimp. This is her third loan cycle in this communal bank and she likes it because the foundation is organized and responsible. 

Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy fish, oysters and shrimp.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 36 years old, married and has five children. Her children are currently studying. She is selling vegetables and her spouse is a farmer. She is now asking for an additional loan of P19,000 to buy eggplant, tomatoes, string beans and squash to sell. This will help increase her sales capacity and will continuously sustain her children's needs. She hopes to become a succesful vegetable vendor someday.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, tomatoes, string beans and squash to sell

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en: Reynaldo has operated his wild duck raising business for more than 15 years. With his business he is able to generate income to sustain his family's needs. Reynaldo is happily married with six children. He wants to improve his wild duck raising business, that's why he is asking for financial assistance amounting to PHP 5,000. He will utilize this loan to buy stock feeds for his wild duck business. Reynaldo will be grateful if his loan request is granted.

loans.use: to buy stock feed for his wild duck raising business

loans.name: Rosa Belgica

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa,  tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres  hijos, dos mayores de edad e independientes y uno de 16 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Rosa para ayudarle a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar hace 5 años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa en el cual prepara deliciosos encebollados (El encebollado de pescado es una sopa típica ecuatoriana de la región costeña). Esta deliciosa receta se prepara con albacora o atún fresco, yuca, cebolla, tomate, cilantro y condimentos), trabaja el día Domingo  desde las 06h00 hasta las 18h00 a veces más tarde hasta que se termine los alimentos que preparo, también venden colas,  cervezas y aguas, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio cuando él puede.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar  pescado, unas sillas y víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 15 años  y le gusta porque le dan seguro de salud para ella y su familia. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
The La Sequita communal bank meets in the La Sequita parish belonging to Montecristi, a prosperous Manabi community. It is full of hard working, dedicated people  who are proud of their heritage. 

La Sequita is a parish whose inhabitants are honest people who know only how to work and to dedicate themselves to their families. 

Rosa lives in this place. She is 54 years old, married and from this relationship has three children, two independent adults and one 16 year old studying in high school. Her husband is a farmer. 

Rosa started a business 5 years ago to help her husband with the household costs. She has a small eatery in her home where she prepares delicious encebollados [stews] (the fish stew is an Ecuadoran soup common to the coastal region). 

She prepares this delicious recipe with fresh albacore or tuna, cassava, onion, tomato, cilantro and spices. She works on Sunday from 6am to 6pm and sometimes longer, until all the food she prepared is finished. They also sell soda, beer and juices. Her husband helps her with her business when he can. 

She will use this loan to buy fish, some chairs and foodstuffs for preparing the food. She has been with the communal bank for 15 years and likes it because they give her and her family health insurance. Her goals are to move forward with her business and to fix up her home.

loans.use: to buy fish, chairs and cooking  supplies.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liza is 47 years old and has one child in school.

Liza has a food vending business in the Philippines. Liza requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Liza has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Liza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 44 years old and married with eight children.

Lourdes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, beverages and groceries.

Lourdes has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lourdes aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, beverages and groceries.

loans.name: Leakhena's Group

texts.en: Leakhena is a resident of a rural village of Thmor Koul district, Battambang province. She is 28 years old and married with two young children. One of her children is now studying in primary school. Her sources of income are from growing corn and farming rice, which she has been doing for 8 years. Her first time being a client of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and the leader of her group, Leakhena is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer, corn and rice seed for her plantation. She hopes that the profits from both plantations will enable her to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, corn and rice seed for her plantation

loans.name: Tom's Group

texts.en: 49 year old Tom is married and has three children who are her dependents. Together with her husband, they are living in a rural village of Tbaung Khmum district in Kampong Cham province. For 31 years, Tom has been planting cassava in order to support her family. This is her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she is the leader of her group. She is seeking a 400,000 KHR loan to hire workers to harvest her cassava. She wishes for her family's financial status to be improved.

loans.use: to hire workers to harvest her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
Ezequiel tiene 42 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela debido al poco interés de sus padres, hoy  en día esta casado y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando, por lo tanto don Ezequiel día a día sale al campo a trabajar para poder ayudar a sus hijos.

Ezequiel toda su vida ha trabajado en la agricultura, ya que fue el rubro que sus padres le enseñaban, hoy en dia cultiva dos hectáreas de maíz para garantiza la alimentación de su familia.

El crédito lo solicita para comprar dos novillas ya que tiene un terreno con mucho pasto donde cuidarlas y un en un año espera venderlas para sacarles ganancia.

Su sueño es tener un corral con seis vacas lecheras ya que de esa manera podrá obtener mejores ingresos y por supuesto ayudar a sus hijos a que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ezequiel is 42 years old, he didn't have the opportunity to go to school due to the little interest his parents had in it, now he is married and has two children who go to school, so Ezequiel goes into the fields to work day after day to be able to help his children.

Ezequiel has worked his whole life in agriculture, as this was the trade his parents gave him. Nowadays he farms two hectares of corn to secure food for his family.

The loan he is requesting is to buy two heifers as he already has a field with a lot of grass to raise them and in a year he hopes to sell them at a profit.

His dream is to have a shed with six dairy cows to be able to get a better income and of course help his children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Al Hasan

texts.en:
Al Hasan is a 22-year-old single man and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He has worked in farming for three years, as he is continuing his university studies in the same domain. He gained experience in farming from his father. 
Al Hasan is a hard worker and ambitious man who has a good reputation among his customers. He is trying hard to develop his business, thus he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to prepare for the eggplant and tomato growing season.
Al Hasan hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to prepare for the eggplant and tomato growing season

loans.name: Gul Nisa

texts.en:
Gul Nisa is a 46-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and five children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 2 years; he is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.
Gul Nisa's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints he is not in a suitable financial condition to buy these items for his business purpose. Therefore Gul Nisa has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
