With the help of this loan she will financially assist her husband to buy these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income.
Gul Nisa is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy items for her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Herchel

texts.en: Herchel is engaged in a fish selling business. She has been running this business for one year. Aside from selling fish, she also sells foam, curtains, cabinets, chairs and cultivates her 2.5 hectares of rice farm land and runs a hog raising business. With her husband's support they are able to maintain their businesses well. For now, Herchel would like to focus on her fish selling business, that's why she's seeking financial assistance amounting to PHP30,000.This amount will be used to buy more milk fish, frozen foods and other kinds of seafood to sell. She hopes to obtain the loan for the betterment of her family's lifestyle and to save an amount for future emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase more milk fish, frozen foods and other kinds of seafood to sell

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Pascual es un hombre de 59 años de edad es casado, vive junto a su esposa en una comunidad de Sololá.
Pascual cuenta que gracias a los préstamos a los que ha tenido acceso logro mejorar sus ingresos, como también  prosperar en su pequeña farmacia y a logrado aumentar sus cultivos, ahora él ya cuenta con un molino de nixtamal en su casa donde sus vecinos llegan con él para preparar su nixtamal,  Pascual es muestra de que con sacrificios y un poco de voluntad se puede prosperar, en la comunidad donde vive Pascual no cuentan con ofertas de farmacia, es por eso que a pascual desde que creo su farmacia ha logrado que la gente de su comunidad se beneficie, por eso pascual ahora quiere seguir mejorando sus servicios como farmacéutico y solicita un nuevo préstamo de Q.5000.00 para comprar más  medicamentos farmacéuticos.
El anhelo de Pascual es poder conseguir nuevamente  un préstamo, para invertir en su negocio ,y para mejorar sus ingresos así seguir ayudado a sus hijos para que se gradúen.
texts.en:
Pascual is a 59-year-old man, married, and lives with his wife in the community of Sololá.

Pascual says that thanks to the loans to which he has had access, he has managed to increase his income and also prosper with his small pharmacy and has managed to increase his crops. Now, he also has a cornmeal mill in his house where his neighbors come to him to make their cornmeal. Pascual is an example of how with sacrifices and a bit of will, one can prosper. In the community where Pascual lives, there aren't any pharmacies. For this reason, Pascual, since he made his pharmacy, has managed to benefit the people in his community. For this reason, Pascual now wants to continue improving his services as a pharmacist and asks for another loan of Q.5000.00 to purchase more medicines.

Pascual's desire is to be able to get another loan, to invest in his business, and to improve his income and in this way continue helping his children so that they graduate.

loans.use: to purchase medicines.

loans.name: Ma. Sonia

texts.en:
Ma. Sonia is 45 years old and married with four children.

Ma. Sonia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as purified water, sliced bread, canned goods and groceries.

Ma. Sonia has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing.

Ma. Sonia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as purified water, sliced bread, canned goods and groceries.

loans.name: Maria Milagros

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS CORAZONES VALIENTES DE MORRO SAN JUAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maria Milagros se dedica al negocio de farmacia,la socia vende medicamentos ,la socia trabaja en su farmacia desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de farmacia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar medicamentos para la botica.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Milagros belongs to the communal bank “LOS CORAZONES VALIENTES DE MORRO SAN JUAN”. This bank is located in the district of Santa Ana, in the province of La Convención in Cusco.

Maria Milagros works in the pharmacy business. She sells medicines and works in the pharmacy from 8:00 am until 3:00 pm. She wants to use this loan to move forward and she is very pleased about it. Her dream is to expand the pharmacy business. She is asking for the loan to buy medicines for the pharmacy. 

She is happy about the loan and she promises to make all her repayments.

loans.use: to buy medicines for the pharmacy

loans.name: Genny Esperanza

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.
En este lugar vive la señora Genny,  tiene 38  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 12, 10 y 6  años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante de legumbres.
Doña Genny  es una ama de casa que para ayudarle a su esposo realiza los créditos para que el lo invierta en su negocio,  el se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras  y legumbres,  sus ventas las realiza de forma ambulante, el tres días por semana se desplaza a la  ciudad de Manta lugar en la cual recorre en su triciclo vendiendo sus productos que son frescos y recién salidos del campo ya que les compra a agricultores de la zona, lleva 20  años en esta actividad y a que a pesar de que el trabajo es sacrificado tiene que hacerlo por el bienestar de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por el seguro médico familiar que ofrece la fundación de forma gratuita. Sus sueños son mejorar su hogar.
texts.en:
The Credit Group 'La Sequita' meets up in the parish of La Sequita, which is part of Montecristi in the prosperous canton of Manabita, a region full of hard working and devoted people very proud of their roots. In the parish, the people are honest and know only how to work and take care of their families.

Genny lives there. She is 38 years old, she is married and she has three children aged 12, 10 and 6 who are in school. Her husband is a legumes retailer.

Genny is a housewife who aids her husband by requesting loans for him to invest in his business. He works selling fruits, vegetables and legumes as a street vendor. Three days a week he goes to Manta city where he sells his products in his three-wheel bike. The products he sells are always fresh and just harvested from the fields, as he buys them from farmers of his area to then bring them to Manta. He has had this job for 20 years and, despite its harshness, he has to do it for the welfare of his family.

They will use this loan to buy fruits, vegetables and legumes.

She is a founding member of her Credit Group and she likes it because it provides the family with a free health insurance. She wishes to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and legumes

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.
En este lugar vive la señora María Isabel, tiene  53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 11 hijos de los cuales 7 son mayores de edad e independientes, 1 fallecido, y 3 menores de 16 y 11 años que estudian en colegio  y el de 13 años que les ayuda a trabajar. Su esposo es ebanista y viven en casa propia.
Doña María Isabel es una muy  buena esposa que trata de ayudarle a su esposo con la dura carga del hogar y es para esto ella realiza los créditos, para que él lo invierta en su taller de ebanistería que lo tiene por 18 años, él trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su esposa y su hijo de 13 años, el taller lo tiene en su casa, realizan mesas, puertas, sillas, etc. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar madera, pinturas, herramientas, etc. para la ebanistería. Lleva dos años con el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque el  grupo es muy unido y los créditos son rápidos y sin tanto papeleo. Sus sueños son tener su casa más cómoda y bien arreglada.
texts.en:
The communal bank group La Sequita meets in the Sequita parish, part of the prosperous canton of Montecristi, Manabí province, full of hard-working, dedicatd people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parish where the inhabitants are honest people who only know how to work and care for their families. 

María Isabel lives in this place. She is 53 years old, married, and in this relationship, has 11 children, of whom 7 are adults and independent, 1 died, and 3 are minors, the ones ages 16 and 11 go to secondary school, and the 13-year-old helps them work. Her husband is a woodworker and they live in their own home. 

María Isabel is a very good wife who tries to help her husband with the hard responsibility of the household and it is for this reason that she takes out loans, so that he can invest them in his woodworking shop which he has had for 18 years. He works every day with the help of his wife and their 13-year-old son. The workshop is in their house, they make tables, doors, chairs, etc. 

This loan will be used to purchase wood, paint, tools, etc. for woodworking. She has been in the communal bank group for two years and she likes it because the group is very close and the loans are quick and without so much paperwork. Her dreams are to have a more comfortable and neat house.

loans.use: to purchase wood, paint, tools, etc.

loans.name: Genny Amparo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.
En este lugar vive la señora Genny, tiene 49  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis  hijos de los cuales cinco son mayores de edad e independientes y uno de 13  años que estudia en séptimo año básico. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Genny para mejorar sus ingresos y ayudarle a su marido se dedican a la  venta de frutas y verduras. Trabajan tres días a ala semana en la ciudad de Manta desde las  06h00 hasta las 16h00, ellos se desplaza en la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista a comprar los mejores productos para sus clientes, tienen este negocio 18 años.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres para surtir su negocio. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque es muy unido el grupo. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y mejorar su casa que necesita ciertos arreglos.
texts.en:
The communal bank group La Sequita meets in the Sequita parish, part of the prosperous canton of Montecristi, Manabí province, full of hard-working people who are dedicated to and proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parish where the inhabitants are honest people who only know how to work and care for their families. 

Genny lives in this place. She is 49 years old, is married, and from this relationship has six children, of whom five are adults and independent, and one, 13 years old, is in the 7th grade. Her husband is a businessman. 

Genny, to increase her income and help her husband, works selling fruits and vegetables. They work three days each week in the city of Manta from 6:00 to 16:00. They go in the early morning to the wholesale market to purchase the best products for their customers. They have had this business for 18 years.

This loan is to purchase fruits and vegetables to stock her business. She has been in the communal bank from the beginning and she likes it because the group is very close. Her dreams are to continue onward and improve her house which needs certain repairs.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Roger Aurelio

texts.es:
Roger Aurelio tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de piqueos y bebidas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, cuenta con clientela considerable por los exquisitos platos que ofrece, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de diversos tipos de pescado para la preparación de sus piqueos y cerveza y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le va a permitir incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Roger Aurelio, 37 years old, lives with his parents in the district of Cayaltí, a community that works in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry, located in Chiclayo province, Lambayequye region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

He works selling snacks and drinks. His business is located in his home. He has a considerable customer base due to his exquisite dishes that he offers. He has asked for a loan to purchase a variety of fish to prepare his snacks, and beer, and in this way generate more income for his family, which will allow him to increase his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish to prepare his snacks and beer.

loans.name: Rolando Tito

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 53 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Rolando se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 8 años de experiencia, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, él solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales para poder surtir su stock de animales que ya posee, ya que dicha inversión le servirá para tener una mejor y más grande variedad y productividad en animales, pues de esta forma el podrá atender los diversos gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, logrando de esta manera generar mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias, y por ende una mejor calidad de vida para él y para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Rolando is 53, is married and has one child. He lives with his family in the district of Oyotún, in a rural area located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque on the north coast of Peru. The population of this district work in agriculture, trade and livestock farming. 

Rolando raises and sells animals and has more than 8 years of experience. His business is located in his own home. He is asking for a loan to buy more animals to add to the livestock that he already has. This investment will allow him to have a better and greater variety of animals and products. In this way he will be able to cater for his customers' different tastes and needs and will make more income, better profits, and will therefore improve his quality of life and that of his whole family.

loans.use: to buy more animals to add to the livestock that he already has

loans.name: Delfino Antonio

texts.es:
Delfino   es un hombre casado de 48 años de edad, tiene una linda familia de 3 hijos, vive junto a su esposa en una comunidad de Sololá.
Delfino es un hombre muy trabajador pues para generar sus ingresos  el desde hace 9 años trabaja como policía municipal de transito contribuyendo con su comunidad para una buena administración vial, su trabajo es bastante alegre pero muy cansado, pues es un trabajo donde tiene que estar bajo el fuerte sol durante todo el día, según cuenta Delfino que para el este trabajo es bastante rentable pues gracias a ello a logrado  mantener a su  familia.
Pero Delfino es un padre de familia que busca la manera de obtener otros ingresos, es por ello que desde su casa él ha construido pequeños locales y tiene a personas alquilando estos locales, pero estos puestos para que se vean atractivos y las personas puedan vender mejor, necesitan algunas remodelaciones, pero Delfino en este momento no cuenta con suficiente dinero para poderlo hacer, por tal  motivo solicita un préstamo de Q.10000.00 para comprar puertas, pinturas, pisos.
El sueño de Delfino es poder contar con este préstamo para que pueda realizar la remodelación y obtener ingresos de los locales y mantener a su familia
texts.en:
Delfino is a married man, 48 years old, and has a lovely family with three children. He lives with his wife in the community of Sololá.

Delfino is a very hard-working man since, in order to generate income, he has worked as a municipal traffic police officer for 9 years, contributing with his community to good traffic administration. His work is rather happy but very tiring, since it is a job where one has to be under the strong sun all day. According to Delfino, this work is fairly profitable since, thanks to it, he has managed to support his family. But Delfino is a father who looks for a way to get other income, and for this reason from his house he has built small stalls and has people renting these stalls, but in order for these stalls to be attractive and so the people can have better sales, they need some renovations.  But at this time, Delfino doesn't have sufficient money to be able to do it, for which reason he asks for a loan of Q.10000.00 to purchase doors, paint, and flooring.

Deflino's dream is to be able to have this loan to be able to do the renovations and get income from the stalls and support his family.

loans.use: to purchase doors, paint, and flooring.

loans.name: Rahmonali

texts.ru:
Это Рахмонали. Он молодой парень района Вахш. Ему всего 21 лет. Его семья проживает в районе Вахш. Рахмонали сейчас находится в городе Душанбе. В городе он учится в Университете на втором курсе. Его родители в районе занимается сельскохозяйственной культуры и выращиванием скота. У Рахмонали большие планы на будущее. Он ради учебы покинул родной район, приехал в город учиться и стать большим человеком. Рахмонали в городе проживает в общежитье.  
Сейчас на его пути стомт большая проблема. Ему необходимо в скором времени оплатить учебный контракт, но для оплаты обучение у него нет денег. Родители каждый месяц отправляет ему деньги для еды и для транспорта, но для учебы никак не могут накопить денег, потому что его родителям также надо кормить его братьев. Рахмонали обратился за кредитом. Он планирует найти работу после учебы, зарабатывать и копить денег, чтобы оплатить кредит. Рахмонали очень нуждается в Вашей поддержке. Вы можете помочь ему с финансовыми трудностями. С  Вашей помощью его не будут исключить с университета. Рахмонали  заранее выражает свою благодарность и обещает, что он будет выплачивать кредит в срок.
texts.en:
This is Rahmonali.  He is a young man from the Vakhsh region of Tajikistan.  He's all of 21 years of age, and his family lives in Vakhsh.  Rahmonali is now in the city of Dushanbe.  He studies in the university there, and is in his 2nd year of study.  His parents in the region are farmers and raise livestock.  

Rahmonali has big plans for the future.  He left his home region and went to the city to study and become a successful person.  Rahmonali lives in a dorm within the city.  Currently, there's a big problem standing astride his path; he needs to pay his tuition soon, but he lacks the money to do so.  His parents send him money for food and transportation every month, but have trouble saving money for his tuition as they also need to feed his brothers.  

Rahmonali has requested a loan.  He plans on finding work after his studies are over to earn and save money to pay off this loan.  Rahmonali really needs your support.  You can help him with his financial difficulties.  With your help, he'll be able to stay in school.  Rahmonali expresses his thanks in advance, and promises to make his loan payments on time.

loans.use: pay for his university tuition and his expansion of knowledge

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en: Rat is living in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She is 32 years old and single. To earn a living, Rat has been planting cassava for 14 years. She is also a paid worker to earn extra money. She manages to save around 4 USD a day for future uses. This is her second cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Leading her group, she is seeking a 1,500,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer for her cassava plantation. Her goal is to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
Cristeta is 60 years old and widowed. She lives with one of her children in a rural community. 

Aside from planting and selling vegetables, she also raises chicken and ducks for sale. She wants to strengthen this business in order to earn a higher income. Having insufficient capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy cracked corn and additional ducks and chickens to raise. 

Having this financial assistance, Cristeta believes that she will further improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy cracked corn and additional ducks and chickens to raise.

loans.name: Varsenik

texts.en:
Varsenik lives in the frontier village Vazashen of the Tavush region. She lives in a cute house and has a small farm, which all her life has been her only occupation. Varsenik is married and she has three children. Her elder son and daughter are married and they live with their families. Her smaller son passes his military service at the army. 

Varsenik, with her beloved husband, is engaged in farming and agriculture. She has cows, pigs and chickens. For her farm’s milk, pork, beef and eggs she finds customers at the city's wholesale market. Varsenik is a master in agricultural activities and thanks to her and her husband’s hardwork, they have a rich orchard from which they gather and sell the harvest of apples, figs, cornels and dewberries. 

Varsenik all the time is busy with the care of farm cattle, cultivation of the land, and the sale of farm products. She says she is happy with all these, since, thanks to farming, they managed to cover the expenses of their children's education and the expenses of their weddings.
 
Varsenik asks this loan for the development of her farm. With the help of the Kiva loan, she wants to buy a pig, two calves and a lot of animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a pig, two calves and a lot of animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Lyna's Group

texts.en:
Lyna, 21 years old and married, is residing in a rural village of Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She has a daughter who is under the age of 6. 

Her primary source of income has been from planting cassava for three years, while her secondary source is from being a paid worker. She manages to save almost 4 USD per day. 

Lyna is leading her group of three members. It is her second loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and she is seeking a loan of 1,600,000 KHR to buy potash for her cassava plantation. She hopes to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy potash.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's Group is formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Mary, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 56 years old, is married and has one child. Mary has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Mary isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. 

This year, Mary will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Mary's Group will purchase a total of 15 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov has been selling children's clothes and toys for 17 years. 

Thanks to Kiva loans, she was able to increase her assortment of products. That helped Lubov to get more regular customers. 

Lubov is an active and hardworking person. She wants to develop her business further.

Lubov is asking for a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase merchandise for spring season, such as jeans, jackets, skirts and sweaters.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothes for spring season.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old, married, and has nine children.

Maria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, cigarettes, groceries, etc.

Maria has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Maria aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, cigarettes, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is 54 years old. She lives in Gori district with her son, sister-in-law and brother-in-law. The only source of income for the family is the salary of her brother-in-law, working as an artisan. Lili's son and sister-in-law are provided invalid pension from the government. The pension is enough for only medicines. 

Lili stopped her trading business and looks after her son and sister-in-law. As the family lives in poverty, Lili decided to restart her trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,000 USD. With the received credit, Lili will purchase a stock of fruits and will start her trading business. This will give her a chance to generate income and improve the living conditions of her pensioner son and sister-in-law. Lili awaits your support.

loans.use: to restart trading fruits.

loans.name: Hezron's Group

texts.en:
Hezron, pictured above, has been a farmer for 12 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 40 years old, is married and has six children.

Hezron likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. Hezron plans to use the profits from this coming season to repair his home.

In total, Hezron’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate seven acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Mabelle

texts.en:
Mabelle is 33 years old, married, and has three children in school. She works very hard to provide for her children.

Mabelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, salts, groceries, etc. Mabelle has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Mabelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, salts, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Yeang's Group

texts.en:
Yeang is a Prey Chhor district villager. She is 45 years old, married, and has seven children. Five of her children are still living with her. 

Her main source of income is from rice farming. The secondary source of income is from fishing. 

She is a leader of her group that consists of two women. She had never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now she is seeking a loan of 600,000 KHR to buy fishing net. She hopes her fishing business will have a higher yield.

loans.use: to buy fishing net.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Magdaleno

texts.es:
Magdaleno es un hombre de 49 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de 9 hijos de las edades de entre 5 y 28 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Sololá, él es un hombre muy trabajador  y luchador por la vida, el para generar sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos de mostacia, en su propia comunidad, el realiza esta actividad desde hace 23 años, a Magdaleno le gusta realizar este negocio porque comparte con mucha gente, pero ahora Magdaleno quiere surtir más su mercadería de mostacia comprando una variedad de colores estilos pero una de las limitaciones que Magdaleno tienen es que en este momento él no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder hacer esta inversión el a evaluando sus ingresos y sus egresos y él ha considerado que puede realizar un préstamo de Q. 3000.00 para comprar más mercadería de mostacia.
El sueño de Magdaleno  es  poder  contar con este crédito y pode invertirlo en su negocio y conseguir buenos ingresos para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Magdaleno is a 49 year old man. He is married and has a beautiful family of 9 children who range between 5 and 28 years of age. He lives in the community of Sololá. He is a very hardworking man who struggles in life to generate income. He works buying and selling items with beads in his own community. He has worked doing this for 23 years. Magdaleno likes working in this business because he is able to socialize with many people, but now he wants to have more merchandise by buying a variety of styles and colors. One of the limitations Magdaleno has is that, currently, he does not have enough capital to buy these beads. Assessing his income and expenses, he has calculated that he can obtain a loan of Q. 3000.00 to buy more merchandise (beads). Magdaleno's dream is to have this loan and invest it in his business and get good income to give the best to his family.

loans.use: to buy and sell beads.

loans.name: Kumpheak's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Stoeng Sen district of Kampong Thom province, Kumpheak is a 31 years old wife and a mother of three young children. She has been a rice farmer for 13 years in order to earn a living. Her husband is a construction worker. She also raises livestock to earn extra income. She is able to save around 4.5 USD every day. 

Kumpheak is the leader of her group and she is seeking a 400,000 KHR loan to build a toilet. She hopes that her family will be healthier with a proper toilet.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: World Group

texts.en:
Sawsan is the featured borrower of World group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they've always been neighbors and friends and they work hard to develop their families' living.

Sawsan is the first lady at the far left side of the picture. She is a 45-year-old married mother, who has been running her mouneh (preserving food in jars) business from her house for 11 years to provide her husband with an additional supporting income. At the same time she has taken good care of her beloved children.

Sawsan's loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise through buying special season's raw materials and conserving them for the coming seasons when they aren't available.

As for the other group members, Nour is the lady at the center, a married mother of two who also works in a mouneh business from her house. Her loan will be used for medical expenses. Rabiaa, the lady at the right, is a married mother of two who has been working as a teacher for 30 years. Her loan will be invested in one of her children's wedding expenses.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise through buying special season's raw materials to conserve for the coming seasons when they aren't available.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Máxima es una mujer de 58 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo varón de 16 años, y su negocio es la confección de vestidos para niñas.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Punata’ se halla ubicada en la parte media del departamento, la mayoría de la población es católica, y los idiomas que se hablan son el español y quechua, de clima templado en verano y en invierno los fríos son intensos y húmedos.
Máxima es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al transporte libre y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Su negocio es la confección de vestidos para niña, negocio que emprendió hace varios años con la ayuda de su nuera, actualmente trabaja de manera independiente y necesita algunos equipos para realizar su labor. “comencé este negocio con el impulso que me dio mi nuera, ella ya conocía del negocio, actualmente me independicé y realizo ventas por mayor y menor…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un taller amplio y contar con una tienda para la exposición y venta, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina de coser overlock y una máquina de coser recta; para mejorar sus diseños de vestidos y aumentar sus ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de manera independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Maxima solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser overlock y otra recta para mejorar sus diseños de vetidos y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en: Máxima is a 58 year old woman, married, with a 16 year old son. Her business is the make dresses for girls. She is a good mother, enterprising, patient, with a good attitude, responsible and hardworking. She has her business in the community of "Punata" which is located in the middle part of the department. Most of the population is Catholic, and the languages spoken are Spanish and Quechua. It is mild in the summer, and the cold in the winter is intense and humid. Maxima is dark skinned, with long braided black hair, dark eyes, short and stocky. Her native language is Quechua which is spoken in the community, and she also speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband who works in transportation, and with her son who goes to school. They live in their own house, built of adobe, with calamine roof, which has well water and electricity. Her business is to make dresses for girls, a business she started many years ago with help from her daughter-in-law.  Currently, she works on her own and she needs some equipment to keep on working. "I started this business thanks to the motivation my daughter-in-law, who knew the business already, gave me. Currently, I am independent and I sell wholesale and individually...", she comments. Her dream is to have a bigger workshop and a store from where to exhibit and sell. She wants to expand her business through the purchase of an overlock sewing machine and a straight stitch sewing machine, in order to improve the design of her dresses and increase her sales. This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the two years since she has been working independently. These are the reasons why Maxima is requesting a loan in order to buy an overlock sewing machine and another straight machine in order to improve the design of her dresses and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy an "overlock" sewing machine and a straight stitch sewing machine to improve the design of her dresses and increase her sales.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is a 44-year-old mother who has been gifted with four children. They are currently residing in a rural community and make their living through farming.

Due to the hardship of living, she also engages in a hog-raising business to have additional income. She wants to improve this business, but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional 25,000 PHP to buy hog feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs.

Rose Marie is hoping that someday she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 41 years old and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, beverages, groceries, etc.

Marichu has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling coconut wine.

Marichu aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ana Lorena

texts.es:
Ana, desarrolla la actividad de crianza de cerdos, vive con su compañero de vida y dos hijos, su negocio lo tiene hace dos años, los cerdos los adquiere pequeños los engorda y luego los vende para tener ingresos, los cueles son de ayuda para apoyar a su pareja en los gastos familiares, su negocio le permite cuidar de sus hijos ella misma.
El capital lo invertirá en cerdos, para tener más animales con los que cubrirá las demandas de sus clientes, espera seguir trabajando para mejorar su situación económica y cancelar su deuda.
Sus aspiraciones son ayudar y apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien una carrera universitaria y que vivan en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Ana’s business activity is raising pigs.  She lives with her life partner and two children.  She has had the business for two years.  She gets the pigs when they are small, she fattens them, and then she sells them in order to get earnings.  These earnings are helpful in supporting her life partner with the family expenses.  The business allows her to care for her children herself.

She will use the loan to buy pigs in order to have more animals, which will meet her customer demand.  She hopes to continue working in order to improve her financial situation and to repay her debt.

Her aspirations are to help and support her children so that they can study for a university degree and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Rusudani

texts.en:
Rusudani, who is a 62-year-old woman, lives in Gurjaani district. She has a son, daughter-in-law and 2 grandchildren.

The family gets income from her son's activity working at the local sausage factory. In order to increase her family's living conditions, Rusudani has started work as a nurse for elderly people and gets a small income from this activity. However, the family finds it hard to meet all daily costs and requires an additional source of income.

Rusudani requested a loan from Credo to startup a business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provisions for business startups and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products.

With the received credit, Rusudani will purchase a car. She will start the distribution of sausages with the help of her son. They will purchase products from the factory at wholesale prices and sell them in nearby towns with a price markup. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income. Their income will double, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a family business of sausage distribution

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli is 53 years old. She lives in the small village of Orulu in the Zugdidi district with her husband, son and his family.

Nanuli is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a plot of agricultural land where she grows different kinds of fruit and nut trees and sells the harvest locally. In addition, she has a cow and a pig. She milks the cow every day and produces dairy products to sell locally.

Nanuli decided to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,400 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of clothes and will start a trading business. Nanuli will increase the income of the family and thus she will provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes

loans.name: Pring's Group

texts.en:
Pring is a resident of Banteay Meas district of Kampot province. She is 39 years old, married, and has three young children. Two of her children are school students and another one is under the age of 6. 

To support the family, Pring has been a rice farmer for 19 years, and she also raises livestock for sale. Her daily income is almost 4 USD. As a new member of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and the leader of her group, Pring is applying for a 1,000,000 KHR loan to build a toilet. She believes that her family will have a better life if they are living in a more hygienic environment.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una mujer de 34 años de edad, esta simplemente unida de hecho con su esposo con la que tiene 6 hijos de las edades de entre 1 y 16 años, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Margarita es muestra de fortaleza y perseverancia pues a pesar de  sus limitaciones económicas a logrado mantener a su familia, debido a la  limitación de trabajo su esposo a tenido que migrar a los estados unidos, pero ella también para contribuir con su esposo ahora tiene una tienda en su casa con esta tienda ella genera sus ingresos y mantiene a su familia, pues aunque su esposo se encuentre en estados unidos, tampoco cuenta con un trabajo fijo, pero ella es una madre de familia muy admirable porque ahora ella ha tomado la decisión de hacer de la tienda algo más grande pero lamentablemente ella no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder hacerlo, ella ahora solicita un préstamo de Q. 10000.00 para comprar más mercaderías tales como: Aceite, Arroz, refrescos y todo lo relacionado con abarrotes.
El sueño de Margarita es poder contar con este préstamo para mejorar su negocio y también mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 34 years old.  She and her husband have six children between the ages of 1 and 16.  She lives in the Sololá community.
Margarita is an example of strength and perseverance.  In spite of her financial limitations, she has managed to support her family.  Due to her husband’s work limitations, he has had to emigrate to the United States.  However, in order to also contribute with her husband she now has a store at her house.  With this store she generates income and supports her family.  Even though her husband is in the United States, he does not have a fixed job.  

She is a very admirable parent because she has now made the decision to make her store bigger.  Sadly, she does not have enough capital to be able to do so.  She is now requesting a loan for 10,000 GTQ in order to buy merchandise like cooking oil, rice, soft drinks, and all types of groceries.

Margarita’s dream is to be able to have this loan in order to improve her business and to also improve her children’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice, soft drinks, and all types of groceries.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una mujer amable y sincera, tiene 53 años de edad está unida de  hecho con su esposo tiene una familia de 6 hijos de las edades de entre 24 y 35 años, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
María es una madre de la familia que ama y cuida a su familia y para la generación de sus ingresos desde hace 10 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida en la plaza de su comunidad, a ella le gusta esta actividad, pues a través de ella convive con toda la gente, María  prepara unas delicias de comida gracias a la receta de su madre, ella ha logrado que sus deliciosas comedias se puedan vender muy rápidas, pero ahora María se enfrenta ante una situación muy difícil  porque su mama se encuentra muy delicada de salud, María a pesar de todo su esfuerzo no ha logrado que su mama se cure es por eso que ella solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprarlas medicinas de su mama y así pueda seguir viviendo por mucho tiempo con ella.
María tiene las esperanzas de poder conseguir el préstamo y así poder comparar las medicinas de su madre y algún día construir la casa.
texts.en:
María is a very friendly and sincere woman. She is 53 years old and is married to her husband. They have a family of 6 children between ages 24 and 35 years old, and live in the community of Sololá.

María is the mother of the family that she loves and cares for. To generate an income for the past 10 years she has made a living in the making and selling of food in the plaza of her community. She likes this activity and she coexists with everyone. María prepares delicious food thanks to a recipe from her mother, and has succeeded in making delicious meals that sell very fast. But now María faces a very difficult situation because her mother is in delicate health. Despite all of her efforts, María has not been able to cure her mother. It is because of this that she asks for a loan which she will use to buy medicines for her mother and be able to continue living with her for a long time.

María has dreams to be able to continue the loan and so be able to buy the medicines for her mother and some day build a house

loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 45 years old, married to Joyce and together they are blessed with four school-going children. He has been in a taxi transport business for the last 10 years and earns a profit of 40,000 KES which he uses to support his family.

He has applied for his third loan of 54,000 KES, and he intends to use the entire loan amount to repair his vehicle and also buy a spare wheel so that he will be able to serve his customers well. David will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children.

In future he desires to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and buy one spare wheel so that he will be able to serve his clients well

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, age 50, is married to a farmer. Together, they’re blessed with three children. She owns and manages a direct personal products selling store in their town. 

Josephine has been in this business for almost ten years and earns a net income of PHP 7,000 a month. To generate more income she also farms rice and raises hogs and and goats. 

Due to insufficient capital for her business Josephine would like to avail a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase lotion, deodorant, detergent powder and other items to sell.  

Josephine looks to do more business this year.

loans.use: To purchase various items to resell in her store.

loans.name: Abou-Ghoneima

texts.en:
Abou-Ghoneima is 53 and from Baniswef. He is married with three sons and takes care of his aged father.

He used to work as a part-time construction worker but he could not keep his job as construction work requires exhausting physical effort. Thus, Abou-Ghoneim decided to start a small grocery and vegetable project in front of his house, especially because he won't have many competitors.

He requested a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy some fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, oranges, onions, bananas, and apples.

loans.use: to buy some fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, oranges, onions, bananas, and apples

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 25 year-old married father of two children who has repaired car tires for the last nine years. He also manages a scrap shop that he acquired from his father and uncles, who trained him in the field. 

Since Mouhamad is a Palestinian refugee and lives in a refugee camp with limited work opportunities and wide competition, he has faced and mostly overcome many obstacles in managing his shop.

Mouhamad is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying his best to improve his family's living conditions, thus he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate and expand his house.

Mouhamad hopes to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to renovate and expand his house.

loans.name: Al Taawon Group

texts.en:
Reem is the featured borrower of Al Taawon group (far right in photo). The group consists of two other members. Zahiya, age 58, is married and the mother of three children (center of photo) and Rossowa Marie Sole, who is 45 years old. She is married and has to children (far left side of photo).

They decided to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they work hard to improve their families living standards.

Reem is a 24-year-old married mother of one child, who has worked in cosmetics sales from her house for two years. About 14 months ago she started working in a doctor's clinic to earn additional income to help her family.

Reem is a hard worker who is well known in her region. She has a good reputation and known for selling special products with affordable prices. Her loan will be invested in new merchandise to meet customer needs for Mother's Day gifts, as wells as the upcoming spring and summer seasons.

She hopes to expand her business in the future so she can provide her family a better living.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Roseli

texts.es:
Roseli es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene una hija mujer de 3 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de chicharrón de pollo.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, trabajadora, humilde, responsable y comprometida con su trabajo. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ un área rural situada a 13 kilómetros al este de la ciudad, famosa por sus comidas basadas en carne de conejo cuy y es famosa por sus numerosas chicherias, que producen la chicha de maíz,(Que es un fermento de la misma) de un agradable sabor, se cita al pueblo con picardía como "Sacaba - donde la chicha no se acaba" de clima cálido y medianamente seco. 
Roseli es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su negocio es la venta de chicharrón de pollo. Hace 3 años que ella heredó un terreno de tierra, donde comenzó a construir su casa de adobe, esta consta de 1 habitación, una cocina, baño, lavandería y con el servicio de electricidad, recibe agua de un pozo mediante una bomba eléctrica que extrae el líquido, su sueño es terminar de construir su casa, ella desea realizar la instalación de agua en su cocina, baño y lavandería para darle un futuro mejor a su niña. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Roseli solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para darle un futuro mejor a su niña.
texts.en:
Roseli is a young 19-year-old woman. She lives with her partner, and she has a daughter who is 3 years old. She has a business selling fried chicken.

Roseli is a good mother, and she is entrepreneurial, hardworking, humble, responsible, and committed to her work. She started her business in a place called 'Sacaba', a rural area situated 13 kilometers east of the city. This place is famous for its cuisine, which is based on rabbit and guinea pig meat, and it's famous for its numerous shops that produce and sell good-tasting chicha (a fermented purple drink derived from corn). This place is mischieviously cited as being "Sacaba - where the chicha never stops". The weather here is warm and moderately dry.

Roseli is dark-skinned, with long black hair that she wears braided. She is short with dark eyes and a robust physical build. She dresses in traditional clothes (hat, blanket, skirt), and her native language is Quechua, which she speaks at home. She also speaks Spanish for general purposes and in her business.

She has a business selling fried chicken. Three years ago, she inherited a plot of land where has began to build an adobe house. This house consists of 1 bedroom, a kitchen, a bathroom, and a laundry area. There is electricity and water that is extracted by an electric pump from a well.

Roseli's dream is to finish building her house. She wants to install water in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry area to give a better future to her daughter. This is the first series of loans with the institution in the nearly 3 years she has been building her house. For these reasons, Roseli is requesting a loan to install potable water in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry area to give her daughter a better future.

loans.use: to install potable water in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry area to give her daughter a better future.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 44 years old and married with four children.

Marissa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like coffee, shampoo, condiments, groceries, etc..

Marissa has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has run her general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marissa aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like coffee, shampoo, condiments, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger griddle and corn in order to make and sells tortillas everyday.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 53 years old and married with five children.

Marita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like coffee, canned goods, biscuits, groceries, etc..

Marita has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from bicycle transport.

Marita aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like coffee, canned goods, biscuits, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Mary Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Mary Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Petronilla's Group

texts.en:
Petronilla is a 50 year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader representing 16 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Petronilla noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family. She is described as a very friendly person.

Petronilla says her harvest was good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by working with One Acre Fund. 

She is very excited to purchase a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Petronilla’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 14 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials to renovate her house inside.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is 41 years old, and from Baniswef. He is married to a housewife, and has four school children. Ashraf takes care for his diseased and aging parents. He has a small grocery store, and it is the only source of income to the family. 

But, he doesn't have enough products to meet the demands of his customers, so he requested a 8,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy a fridge and some products such as rice, oil, and pasta for his store in order to increase his family income.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and some products such as rice, oil and pasta for his store.

loans.name: Good Life Group

texts.en:
Tracey, 46, is a member of the Goodlife Group. She is a cross-border trader who specializes in buying clothes and shoes for resale. Tracey sadly lost her husband when her fourth youngest child was just three months old. This was devastating to her and her family as they were left destitute and with nowhere to turn to. 

With the help of her friend, who is also a member of the Goodlife Group, Tracey got a passport and started cross-border trading to South Africa and Zambia in 1999. The economic hardships made it difficult for her to maintain her business. She faced difficulties in taking her children to proper schools, clothing them, feeding them and providing decent shelter for them. It was during this time that Tracy was introduced to Thrive. She received training on savings and how to work together in groups with other business women. 

With this loan that she received from Thrive, Tracey is now able to continue with cross-border trading. She hopes to grow her business and continue working with her group members, who have been a source of inspiration and encouragement to her. Tracey also plans to start selling her goods in Mozambique.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 43-year-old married mother with five children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. For the past ten years, she has sold clothing to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their beloved kids. Hala is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is trying desperately to develop her business.

Hala is requesting a loan from the Kiva field partner Al Majmoua to purchase a new collection of clothes to satisfy customer requests for upcoming Mother’s Day. She will also purchase a new toolkit for her husband to facilitate his work. Hala’s loan will increase her business merchandise. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes and buy a toolkit for her husband

loans.name: Povsothida

texts.en:
Povsothida is a 21-year-old single student who is from the Battambang province in Cambodia. She is in her first year at a university and is majoring in banking. Povsothida also works at a resort in her province and earns around 3 USD daily. Her mother is a farmer who also earns income from selling cooked chicken. Povsothida does not have finances to pay university fees after her first year. 

Povsothida is requesting a loan to pay her university fees. Her loan will help her to earn a bachelor’s degree. After her graduation, Povsothida is going to find better job with a decent salary to help her mother improve the family’s living standards.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 37-year-old married mother who started selling fruits and vegetables five years ago to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Souad is an ambitious lady and a hard worker who has a good reputation among her customers. 

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to develop her convenience section with newly requested products to satisfy her customers' needs. 

Souad hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to develop her convenience section with newly requested products to satisfy her customers' needs

loans.name: Las Bandoleras Group

texts.es:
Eliana es una mujer  de 26 años, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de desayunos. 
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, constante, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona sur de la ciudad un área caracterizada porque los suelos de esta parte, son predominantemente arenas, arenas finas y arenas limosas, de clima cálido subtropical donde los meses de mayor precipitación pluvial son enero y febrero. 
Eliana es de tez trigueña, ojos obscuros, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, estatura mediana, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada en la silla, usa blusa rosada).  Su vida la comparte con sus padres que trabajan, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida tradicional, tienda de barrio, venta de pollo, venta de empanadas, venta de ropa de segunda mano, elaboración y venta de gelatina y venta de artículos de limpieza, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de desayuno, como; Api (bebida caliente o fría a base de maíz morado) acompañado con cuñapés (masa de harina con queso al horno); tojorí (leche con maíz), ó zonzo (yuca con queso), entre otros. “por las mañanas realizo la venta de desayunos, luego por la tarde hasta la noche me ocupo de mi segunda actividad; trabajo como peluquera…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un kiosko en su casa para la venta de desayunos, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor como; api, tojorí, cuñapes, yuca y otro. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Eliana solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de desayunos  para atender a mayor número de clientes.
texts.en:
Eliana is a 26 year old woman. She has no children and her business is selling breakfasts. She is entrepreneurial, a fighter, stable, responsible and hardworking. She runs her business in the southern part of the city characterized by its soil, which is predominantly fine and silty sand. It has a warm, sub-tropical climate. The two months that have the most rain are January and February. 

Eliana has golden brown skin, long black hair she wears in a pony tail, and a thin build. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks in her family, and she speaks Spanish in the general culture and for business (she is seated, wearing a pink blouse). She shares her life with her parents, who work. They live in a rented house made of brick with a sheet metal roof. It has potable water, electricity and plumbing. Her desire to get ahead led to her leading a bank for people with businesses such as selling traditional food, a neighborhood store, selling chicken, selling empanadas, selling second hand clothes, making and selling gelatin, and selling cleaning products. The bank was started so they could ask for a loan and expand their activities. Her business is selling breakfasts, such as api (a hot or cold drink made with purple corn), accompanied by cuñapés (baked flour dough with cheese), tojorí (milk and corn), or zonzo (yucca with cheese), among others. “In the morning I sell the breakfasts, later from the afternoon until night I do my second activity, I work as a hairdresser,” she says. Her dream is to have a kiosk in her house to sell the breakfasts. She wants to buy the cooking ingredients wholesale for the api, tojorí, cuñapes, yucca and more. This is her second cycle of loans with the institution during the year she has been doing this activity independently. 

That is why Eliana is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make breakfasts to serve a larger number of customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make breakfasts and serve a larger number of customers.

loans.name: Gigilyn

texts.en:
Gigilyn is 34 years old and married. They are currently residing in a rural community and earn their living through farming. To have additional income, Gigilyn has engaged in a hog-raising business for almost three years. She aims to make this business profitable, but she has inadequate capital. 

For this reason, she would like to avail an additional PHP12,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. 

Being a hard working mother, she believes that someday she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
To have an additional source of income, Gloria has been engaging in raising chickens for sale. She is 50 years old, and has three adult-age children. 

She wants to acquire more chickens to raise, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is requesting an additional PHP7,000 to buy cracked corn and additional chickens to raise. 

Being a patient and hard working mother, she believes that she will further improve the business and generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy cracked corn and additional chickens to raise

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 36 years old and married to a farmer. They live in a rural community and make their living by farming but have insufficient income.

Almas has also been engaged in the hog-raising business to earn additional income. She aims to make this business profitable, but she has limited capital. 

For this reason, Alma is asking for a PHP9,000.00 loan to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs.

She hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna has a large family, and she lives with her husband, two children and parents-in-law in the frontier village of Khashtarak Tavush region. She graduated from Ijevan State College, the faculty of Armenian Language and Literature. For several years she worked at the school as a teacher, but for the last six years, with her parents-in-law, she has been doing farming and agriculture. Anna’s husband regularly goes aboard to the Russian Federation to work, and tries somehow to enlarge his family’s income. 

On the farm, Anna takes care of pigs, sheep and chickens. The land cultivation also brings some income, and provides Anna's family with various vegetables and fruits (potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots and greens, and also apples, nuts, figs, pears and mulberries).

Anna really wants to make the farm richer with cattle and more profitable, so that her husband will give up working abroad. With this loan amount, she wants to buy several sheep and pigs, and also fodder for all her farm cattle, with the hope that these purchases will provide better income and improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy several sheep and pigs, and also fodder for all her farm cattle

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es:
Encarnación, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, su hijo mayor ya es independiente, trabaja en la comercialización de ganado y en el cultivo de granos básicos, su jornada de trabajo es de seis de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, su mayor ventaja es la experiencia de más de 15 años, aprendió el oficio cuando trabajaba con sus padres.
Necesita de un financiamiento para comprar más ganado, de esa forma fortalecerá su inventario para tener mejores ganancias, espera recuperar su inversión  y  mejorar su situación económica.
Los proyectos que el sr. Encarnación tiene son  disminuir las carencias de su familia,  remodelar su vivienda, expandir su negocio y comprar un camión para trasladar el ganado.
texts.en:
Encarnación lives with his wife and two children. His oldest son is already on his own. He works selling cattle and growing basic grains. His work schedule is from six in the morning until five in the afternoon. His biggest advantage is his experience of more than 15 years. He learned the trade when he worked with his parents.

He needs a loan to buy more cattle. This will fortify his inventory so he can have better profits. He hopes to earn back his investment and improve his financial situation. 

The projects that Encarnación has are to reduce what his family lacks, remodel his home, expand his business and buy a truck to transport the cattle.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to fortify his inventory and have better profits.

loans.name: Zeriline

texts.en:
Zeriline is 31 years old and has three children. She is married, and has two children who are currently in school.

Zeriline is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Zeriline has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Phai

texts.en:
Phai is 34 years old and married with three dependent children. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Kos Krolo district of Battambang province. For the past five years, she has been a corn farmer and this is the primary source of her family’s income. Phai supplements her income by working for others for a fee. 

Phai is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. This will be her second micro-loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund. Phai hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland
